The number of guest teachers was reduced by 22,000,” Tiwari claimed.“While the government claims that there are 16 lakh students in Delhi, only about 12.6 lakh students were studying in Delhi government schools in 2019-20 as per an RTI information,” the Delhi BJP chief said, alleging that 55% of the education budget was not utilised.“Delhi government spent Rs 20-25 lakh on one classroom, which could have been constructed at the cost of just Rs 5 lakh,” he added.

Title: Even retired employees can form a union: Madras high court
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

Representative image

CHENNAI: The Madras high court has made it clear that law does not state that only serving employees of an organisation can form unions under the Trade Union Act as even retired employees can form a separate union to espouse their grievances relating to terminal benefits and register it.

Justice S Vaidyanathan made the observation while allowing a plea moved by Karur Vysya Bank Retirees’ Association challenging the order of the labour department denying registration to their association on the ground that the members of the association are not in service.

“India is a democratic country, where there is no restriction for citizens to express their grievances to government by means of ahimsa and as such, preventing one sect of persons, namely, retired employees to form a trade union to espouse their cause to the government cannot be permitted at any cost, by giving a different interpretation to the provisions of law,” the judge said.

To put it precisely, even if seven employees were not on the rolls, they are entitled to form an association that has to be registered under the Trade Union Act and the same cannot be refused to be registered on this score, the judge said.

Though the existing union with permanent employees can espouse the cause of retired employees or others, who were not in employment, on the ground of community of interest, consequent to the absence of such interest in the present days, there is nothing wrong in permitting the retired employees to have their own association under the act, as unions, having permanent employees on the rolls, are withering away and shirking from their moral responsibilities to espouse the cause of employees who cease to be on the rolls, said Justice Vaidyanathan.

Title: Delhi polls: Not a single school opened in city, says BJP leader Manoj Tiwari
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

Delhi BJP chief Manoj Tiwari. (PTI photo)

NEW DELHI: As the war of words between Aam Aadmi Party and BJP over the quality of education in Delhi continues, Delhi BJP chief Manoj Tiwari on Saturday accused AAP of making false claims.

He asked chief minister Arvind Kejriwal to accompany him and mediapersons for an inspection to Mustafabad senior secondary school at 12 noon on January 27 to see for himself how much change had taken place in the last five years.

Complete coverage on Delhi elections

“In 2019, the result of the 10th exam was over 80% in UP and Bihar but in Delhi it was only about 72%. Kejriwal should answer why so many students failed,” Tiwari said at a press conference.

“AAP had promised to open 500 new schools but not a single new school was opened. Only some classrooms were constructed. The number of guest teachers was reduced by 22,000,” Tiwari claimed.

“While the government claims that there are 16 lakh students in Delhi, only about 12.6 lakh students were studying in Delhi government schools in 2019-20 as per an RTI information,” the Delhi BJP chief said, alleging that 55% of the education budget was not utilised.

“Delhi government spent Rs 20-25 lakh on one classroom, which could have been constructed at the cost of just Rs 5 lakh,” he added.

Title: Purnia administration launches ‘Kitab Daan’ campaign
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

PATNA: The Purnia district administration launched a ‘Kitab Daan’ campaign on Saturday to encourage the practice of donating books for building libraries in the government schools of Purnia.

As part of the campaign, whose tag line is ‘Donate a Book, Shape a Life’, over 500 books reached the collection centre on Day 1. In fact, more than 50 people, including some from foreign countries, also sent messages on social media platforms like Facebook and expressed interest in donating books.

The administration has targeted to collect approximately one lakh books by March-end so that libraries in government schools can be made functional from the new academic session on April 1.

District magistrate (DM) Rahul Kumar, who donated altogether 57 books, said people living in other towns, states or countries could send books directly from online suppliers.

“At first, all government schools will be told to include a weekly library period in their schedules. It will be made a daily affair after some time,” the DM told this newspaper and added that reference books, biographies, autobiographies, novels or motivational literary works could be donated.

A donor will get a certificate signed by the DM and his book will have a sticker with his name on the first page.

Title: Ahmedabad: Phones found in jail, sahayak accused
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

Representative image

AHMEDABAD: While the city crime branch probes the extortion case registered under GujCTOC against gangster Vishal Goswami, who allegedly using Android mobile phones from within the jail, two mobile phones, two chargers, two sim cards, 20 packs of tobacco and two lighters were found during searches within Sabarmati Central Jail in the past two days.

For the phones and sim cards, three accused including a jail sahayak (assistant) have been named in the FIR, which also mentions the smuggling of tobacco and lighters into the jail. Among those named in this FIR are convicts Imam Saiyed and Mehul Prajapati and jail sahayak Jagdish Prajapati.

According to jail officials, three FIRs were lodged on January 23 and 24 at Ranip police station. They will be transferred to the special operations group (SOG) for investigation.

According to the FIR lodged on January 24, a jail official found Saiyed near the new barrack. “On checking his person, 20 packets of tobacco and two lighters were recovered. He said the contraband had been given to him by jail sahayak Jagdish Prajapati, and who told him to pass it on to convict Mehul Prajapati, who is lodged in the Bada Chakkar of the jail,” said a Ranip police official.

The second FIR states that during a surprise check on January 23, at about 10.10am, jail staff found a mobile phone, a battery and a sim card buried in the ground near barrack number 4of Veer Bhagat Singh yard or Yard No. 4.

The third FIR states that hawaldar Rajendrasinh Bariya and jail sahayak Dinesh Mali found suspicious movements in the new jail near Circle Yard 2 , Barrack No. 2. “They found a mobile phone, a battery, a sim card and a charger hidden on the parapet of the window of the washroom there. By the time they got there, nobody was around,” a police official said.. Jail officials said nobody involved in pushing contraband into the jail will be spared. “Surprise checks will continue by jail staff and by the SOG,” he added.

Title: Patna’s Gandhi Maidan decked up for Republic Day festivities
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

Preparations made at Gandhi Maidan for the flag hoisting ceremony on Saturday.

PATNA: Patnaites have geared up to celebrate the 71st Republic Day with enthusiasm on Sunday.

Prominent buildings in the city have been illuminated with colourful lights and preparations made at Gandhi Maidan for the flag hoisting ceremony. The celebrations will begin at 9am with governor Phagu Chauhan unfurling the tricolour. A parade will also be held to demonstrate the state’s military strength.

Altogether 17 government departments and organizations will exhibit their tableaux during the R-Day celebrations at Gandhi Maidan . They will highlight several issues like violence against women, road safety and rainwater harvesting.

Patna (central) SP Vinay Tiwari told this newspaper on Saturday that heavy deployment of police personnel had been done around Gandhi Maidan and nearby areas.

“Police officers have been called from other districts and surveillance cameras installed for security purpose. Senior police officials will keep a vigil on people during the celebrations,” he said and added that only people with security passes would be allowed to attend the flag hoisting ceremony.

Besides, several roads leading to Gandhi Maidan will witness restricted vehicular movement from 7am to 10am. “Several constables and other patrolling teams have been deputed in every nook and cranny of the city,” said divisional commissioner Sanjay Kumar Agarwal.

Apart from the ceremonial parade, revellers have planned to visit the Sanjay Gandhi Biological park, commonly known as the Patna zoo, Buddha Smriti Park, Patna Museum and Bihar Museum to spend time with their loved ones on R-Day. Some people will also go to hotels, restaurants and coffee shops.

Meanwhile, youngsters thronged makeshift shops selling flags, badges and bands on the eve of Republic Day on Saturday. “Flags are available in the price range of Rs 10 to Rs 150. Earlier, customers used to buy plastic flags, but now, they prefer cotton flags,” said Raju Gupta, the owner of a makeshift stall on Bailey Road.

Sweet shops and confectioneries are also ready to fulfil the huge demand of ‘jalebi’, which is the national sweet of India. “More than 50kg ‘jalebis’ are sold at my shop on R-Day and Independence Day. Customers usually place their orders few days prior to the occasion,” said Pankaj Baranwal, the manager of a local sweet shop on Boring Road.

Title: Bihar: Teacher aspirants hold protest
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

Representative image

PATNA: More than 50 teacher aspirants, who could not download their admit cards for the State Teachers’ Eligibility Test (STET) to be held on January 28, staged protests outside the Bihar School Examination Board ( BSEB ) office here on Saturday.

The STET candidates from several districts said they were making rounds of the BSEB office for the last three to four days, but to no avail.

Rashmi Kumari from Gaya said every time, she tried to download the admit card, invalid login details popped up on the computer screen. “When I brought the matter to the notice of BSEB, it said my admit card was not made available as I had not paid the registration fee. The fact is that I had paid the registration fee and the slip for the same is in my possession,” she added.

Another aspirant from Nawada, Ravi Ranjan Kumar , said four candidates with identical name got the same roll number.

BSEB chairman Anand Kishor , however, said there was no duplication of roll numbers as claimed by the candidates. “Candidates who failed to download admit cards will get the same on humanitarian grounds. Around 56 candidates were not issued admit cards as they had not submitted the registration fee,” Kishor added.

Title: Freedom fighters’ kin honoured, 115 get police medal
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

Trichy: Colourful events marked 71st Republic Day functions as the district administration and several other institutions celebrated the day with patriotic fervour here on Sunday.

Republic day celebrations organised by the district administration and the police department at the Armed Reserve Police ground at Subramaniapuram turned out to be a mega event with hundreds turning up at the venue to watch the event.

The tri-colour was unfurled by district collector S Sivarasu after according floral tributes to the martyrs of the World War 1 at the memorial in Gandhi market. The collector accepted the guard of honour by the police.

The collector honoured the family members of 63 freedom fighters and presented chief minister’s police medal and certificates to 115 police officers. He also gave away certificate of appreciation and Rs 2,000 cash reward each to 18 officers of government departments for flawless service for 25 years.

As many as 450 students from schools presented cultural programmes at the event. City commissioner of police V Varadharaju, IG (central zone) A Amalraj, DIG V Balakrishnan, SP Zia Ul Haq and other officials participated.

Srirangam sub-collector Sibi Adhithya Senthilkumar was awarded with a certificate of appreciation for his work in the rescue operation of a two-and-a-half year old Sujith Wilson from an abandoned bore well in Nadukattupatti near Manapparai in Trichy last October.

Trichy international airport director K Gunasekaran hoisted the national flag at the republic day function held at the airport.

Sevai Childline organisation celebrated the Republic day with the children at Annai Ashram near Trichy airport.

The republic day celebrations were organised in a grand manner in Ariyalur, Perambalur, Pudukottai, Karur, Thanjavur, Tiruvarur and Nagappattinam districts also.

Title: Rajasthan: Alwar collector wins best electoral practices award
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

Alwar collector Inderjeet Singh (extreme right) gets felicitated by President Ram Nath Kovind and Union minist... Read More

JAIPUR: On the occasion of the 10th National Voters’ Day, Alwar district collector Inderjeet Singh was honoured by President Ram Nath Kovind for conceptualising and implementing mSVEEP mobile application during Lok Sabha elections in the district.

Singh is the only election officer to be shortlisted by the Election Commission of India (ECI) for best electoral practices award in the general award category from Rajasthan.

‘mSVEEP’ app was conceptualized by Alwar district magistrate for SVEEP (Systematic Voters' Education and Electoral Participation) programme with a vision to spread awareness about voting through EVM-VVPAT machines and other features like BLO directory. It also included other features like ‘Call for Pledge’, SVEEP activities and other online activities. During the election, mSVEEP app was downloaded by more than 1.47 lakh voters and residents of the district and its main feature of mock poll was used around 3.61 lakh times by registered users.

This digital innovation for voters' education was shortlisted by the Election Commission of India under general awards.

Title: 1,250 JD(U) netas to attend ‘grand meeting’ on January 28
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

Nitish Kumar

PATNA: The JD(U) will hold a ‘grand meeting’ of all its MPs, MLAs, MLCs, regional organisation incharges, district presidents, district organisation incharges, assembly constituency incharges and block presidents at 1, Aney Marg residence of CM Nitish Kumar here on January 28.

Party sources said there was no fixed agenda for the meeting. It is widely believed that Nitish will give a pep talk to the party leaders in view of the forthcoming assembly elections in the state.

JD(U) state general secretary (headquarters) Navin Kumar Arya said the party has two incharges (external and internal) in each assembly constituency. “As Bihar has 243 assembly constituencies, altogether 486 assembly constituency incharges, 534 block presidents, 51 district presidents, 51 district organisational incharges, around 100 MLAs/MLCs, 22 MPs and dozens of regional organisational incharges will participate in the meeting. In fact, at least 1,250 party leaders will be there,” Arya added.

Sources said the JD(U) conducted a two-day training programme for its 400 master trainers at Rajgir in Nalanda district on January 22 and 23. The programme was addressed by the party’s national general secretary (organisation) R C P Singh and Rajya Sabha deputy chairman Harivansh, among others. Nitish could not visit Rajgir to address the training programme due to his busy schedule.

Title: Criminal carrying Rs 25,000 reward arrested in Siwan
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

Representative image

PATNA: Notorious criminals Chandan Singh and Randhir Singh were arrested from the outskirts of Ainee village under Darauli police station in Siwan district on Saturday. Chandan carried a reward of Rs25,000 on his head. A carbine of .30 bore along with a country-made pistol and seven live cartridges were recovered from their possession.

A Special Task Force (STF) team conducted the operation with Siwan police. STF sources said the criminals first opened fire but surrendered after the police returned the fire. Chandan belongs to Ainee while Randhir is from Maghari under Basantpur police station in Siwan. Chandan was also accused in a dacoity case lodged in Deoria district of Uttar Pradesh.

Chandan is an accused in at least ten criminal cases, includes burning his wife alive and killing a trader for extortion. “Chandan killed his wife hardly a year after their marriage in 2008,” sources said.

They said Chandan shot dead a millionaire trader of Siwan, Prem Gupta, under Mairwan police station area in Siwan for extortion on August 25, 2015. “On May 12 last year, he shot at another trader under Mairwan police station area for refusing to pay him extortion money,” sources said.

Police sources said Chandan and his associates had looted Rs 12 lakh from a petrol pump under Bankatta police station area in Deoria district of UP on March 6 last year. “His property at Ainee was attached three months back after the court had declared him an absconder. Later, the state home department announced a cash reward of Rs25000 on him,” sources said.

They said Chandan was evading arrest in connection with a dacoity case lodged with Darauli police station and another case with Mairwan police station.

Title: Ladakh univ students celebrate R-Day at CUTN
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

Tiruvarur: Students and faculty members from Central University of Ladakh, Jammu and Kashmir joined Central University of Tamil Nadu (CUTN) in Tiruvarur fraternity to celebrate Republic Day on Sunday.

After hoisting the national flag on the campus, CUTN vice-chancellor A P Dash said it was an occasion to commemorate the values of our democracy and Republic.

“I am happy to tell you that we started four departments last year and about to start two more this year. The students' amenities centre will be ready by the beginning of the next academic year. Works will start this year for two hostels (450 beds for girls and 450 beds for boys) and one more academic building,” he said. After the celebrations, delegates and students from Ladakh, Jammu and Kashmir interacted with press people and expressed their happiness for learning Tamil culture and sharing theirs with the CUTN fraternity. Students and faculty members from the northernmost region of India have come to the south as part of Ek Bharat Shreshtha Bharat initiative for cultural exchange, according to CUTN release.

At the start of the year, Ladakh and Jammu region was tied up with Tamil Nadu for a host of initiatives for cultural exchange and to break the geographical, cultural and language barriers for inclusiveness. It included sharing of literature through translation; student and faculty exchange programmes; and youth carnival and cross-screening of films to accept and appreciate the diversity of India and stand united.

CUTN is among the first universities to host Kashimiri students and faculty members in Tamil Nadu. CUTN Registrar S Bhuvaneswari, controller of examinations A Ragupathy, finance officer CMA V Palani, Librarian R Parameswaran, deans of schools and faculty members took part.

Title: Patna HC CJ changes process of listing cases
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

PATNA: Acting on recommendations of a two-member committee comprising senior most judges, Chief Justice of Patna high court Sanjay Karol on Saturday approved fresh case-listing pattern for routine hearing of cases. Earlier, the committee had held series of meetings with the coordination committee of three lawyers’ associations of the high court.

Committee chairman-cum-senior advocate Yogesh Chandra Verma said lawyers had abstained from routine work in the second half of Friday to express reservation over the present case-listing pattern which, they felt, was very “complicated”.

Verma said the committee of judges comprised Justice Dinesh Kumar Singh and Justice Hemant Kumar Srivastava, who are senior most after Chief Justice of Patna high court Sanjay Karol. “After interaction in multiple sittings with committee members, they found problems of lawyers to be genuine,” Verma said.

“The coordination committee will again meet at 1.30pm on Monday,” Verma said, adding the listing pattern was changed by high court administration around three months back.

Verma said their request for ‘independent and self-contained cause list’ of cases for each day was accepted. “Cases will now be taken up in chronological order,” he said, adding bail matters will be taken up chronologically for hearing. Verma said tied-up matters would be taken up for hearing by single and division benches every Wednesday.

Title: Prashant Kishor tweets Sushil Modi’s video clip against Nitish Kumar, draws flak from BJP, JD(U)
Content:
JD(U) national vice-president Prashant Kishor

लोगों को character certificate देने में @SushilModi जी का कोई जोड़ नहीं है। देखिए पहले बोल कर बता रहे थे और अब DY… https://t.co/h49D8GGYdR — Prashant Kishor (@PrashantKishor) 1579917261000

PATNA: Three days after deputy CM Sushil Kumar Modi (SuMo) called him “ungrateful”, JD(U) national vice-president Prashant Kishor on Saturday took a dig at the senior BJP functionary by tweeting a five-year-old video clip in which he is heard accusing CM Nitish Kumar of deceiving BJP, RJD chief Lalu Prasad and many others.“Nobody can match Sushil Modi when it comes to giving character certificate(s). See, earlier he used to speak (for giving character certificate); now that he has been made the deputy CM, then he is giving it in writing,” Kishor tweeted a post roughly translated in English.“…Betrayal is in the DNA of Nitish. The way he betrayed Jitan Ram Manjhi, BJP after 17 years of alliance, Shivanand Tiwari, Jitan Ram Manjhi, George Fernandes and Lalu Prasad, it shows betrayal of Nitish, not of people of Bihar,” SuMo is heard saying in the video tweeted by Kishor.Incidentally, SuMo in the video had made the statement in response to a campaign originally planned by Kishor ahead of Bihar assembly elections in 2015 when Kishor’s poll management firm I-PAC was working for Nitish, who had aligned with Lalu’s RJD and Congress after breaking the 17-year-old ties with BJP after it declared Narendra Modi as its PM candidate for 2014 general elections.During his Muzaffarpur election rally on July 25, 2015, PM Modi had said: “Iss aadmi kaa DNA hi kharab hai. (This man’s DNA is poor)”. Kishor was prompt in taking up the DNA remark, portraying it as an attack on Bihari pride. Accordingly, JD(U) had launched a DNA campaign to corner BJP and PM Modi.Though Nitish won the election in alliance with RJD and Congress, he later came back to BJP and formed government with SuMo as his deputy again in 2017. Recently, when Kishor and JD(U) functionary Pavan Kumar Varma questioned Nitish’s support to Citizenship (Amendment) Act (CAA) and alliance with BJP for ensuing Delhi assembly elections, SuMO came to his defence and tweeted on Wednesday: “Nitish at times faces the irony in which the people whom he lifts from the ground, create problems for him later … He made many members of Rajya Sabha (referring to Pavan) and lifted many people from the non-political corridors and gave them higher position in the organization (referring to Kishor). However, some of those people have not refrained from being ‘thankless’.”Kishor’s counter to SuMo’s tweet has infuriated many BJP functionaries. BJP’s state president Sanjay Jaiswal called Kishor a “loudspeaker” of those who pay him well. “Some leaders get into this habit of increasing their TRP by commenting on big leaders … BJP will not make any comment on people who take money for doing political work,” Jaiswal said.BJP spokesperson Nikhil Anand said Kishor is a political “tout”, who is working on the payroll of Lalu.Kishor is also under attack from a number of JD(U) functionaries, including Munger MP Rajiv Ranjan Singh alias Lallan Singh and former party spokesperson Ajay Alok. “Some people do politics as well as business and if both are mixed then turbulence is bound to happen,” Lallan told reporters.Meanwhile, Kishor told reporters on Saturday morning that he will speak on all issues, including CAA, National Population Register (NPR) and proposed National Register of Citizens (NRC), after declaration of Delhi election results on February 11. “I will be mostly in Bihar after Delhi elections,” he said.

Title: 22 people injured in Karungulam jallikattu
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

A total of 22 people, including spectators, were injured in Jallikattu held at Karungulam village near Vaiyampatti in Trichy district on Sunday. The arena in front of St Ignatius Church at Karungalam, however, offered a sporting spectacle to visitors.

It commenced at 9.30 am and has a turnout of 633 bulls and 424 tamers. The tamers exhibited valor by overpowering bulls. On Sunday, all the 633 bulls were let loose in the event until the event was over at 4 pm.

It left 22 people, including seven tamers, 10 bull owners and five spectators, injured. While 21 of them were treated as outpatient by a medical team posted near the venue, one bull owner was taken as an inpatient to the government hospital.

Over 4000 people, including 1,000 women, watched the event unforld. Rural parts of the central region witnessed series of Jallikattu events in many places since the Pongal festival this year.

So far, three people were killed in the Jallikattu at Avarankadu in Trichy, Kokkudi in Ariyalur and Vadamalappur in Pudukottai this year. The deceased were either bull owners or spectators in the three incidents.

Title: Support group for arthritis patients opens today
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

Vadodara: Antardhwani – a patient support group for ankylosing spondylitis (AS) – is all set to begin its Vadodara chapter on Sunday. The chapter will be started in presence of experts in the filed of rheumatology – doctors Namisha Patel, Himanshu Pathak, Pradip Prajapati, Ripal Shah, Chetan Chauhan and Jeet Patel.

The support group is aimed to bring patients, doctors, physiotherapists, yoga trainer and dieticians to gather details about common ailments related to the disease and also in turn aid patients, share new findings, research and new medicines in this field.

AS is a condition where all or some of the joints and bones of the spine fuse together. It often causes inflammation in the backbone or in severe cases can even affect heart or eyes. AS has been classified as a rare disease as eight out of 10,000 persons suffer from it. It is a lifelong ailment but regular exercise and medical aid can provide relief to the patients, experts said.

Title: Surat turning into hub of low-cost diamond-studded jewellery
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

The world’s largest diamond cutting and polishing centre in Surat is fast emerging as a low-cost diamond jewel... Read More

SURAT: Thinking of buying diamond jewellery, and the skyrocketing prices are deterring you? Not any more. You can still flaunt sparkling diamonds on your jewellery at affordable prices.

The world’s largest diamond cutting and polishing centre in Surat is fast emerging as a low-cost diamond jewellery hub. It is here that diamond-studded gold jewellery including rings, nose pins, pendants, necklaces, bracelets etc., are available in the price range of Rs 3,000-Rs 15,000.

More than 60 manufacturers in the diamond hub of Varachha and Katargam have ventured into the low-cost affordable jewellery segment in the last few years, targeting middle-class and millennial consumers.

The manufacturers, who have their own in-house designing facilities, have been directly sourcing the polished diamonds from small and medium diamantaires. The lightweight jewellery is designed using 1.5 gram to 4 grams of gold, studded with the tiny gems.

Industry sources said that low-cost jewellery to the tune of Rs 1,500 crore is manufactured per annum in Surat and more than 95% of it is sold in India.

Raju Moradiya of Rosetta diamond jewellery told TOI: “All our products are priced below Rs 10,000 in real gold and real diamonds. Every month, we are launching 300 new jewellery designs and that we have tied up with more than 700 jewellery stores across India.”

According to Moradiya, the gold content in the jewellery is only 2 grams, which makes it affordable for the consumers. Even if the gold prices are fluctuating, the prices of the jewellery articles are fixed and never change. For example, the rings are priced at Rs 6,999 followed by nose pins at Rs 3,000, pendants at Rs 6,999 and necklaces at Rs 10,000.

Kinjal Suchak of Kiyaash diamond jewellery said, “Diamonds are forever and for everyone. This was the basic aim behind starting our jewellery line. All our diamond-studded jewellery products come at a fixed price of Rs 8,500, be it ring, necklace, bracelet, nose pins, pendants etc. These items are selling like hot cakes in the northern and western markets.”

Another manufacturer, Dipak Gadhesariya, director of Mezzaria Jewels Private Limited, said, “We are manufacturing jewellery at low cost as well as high-end jewellery. But our low-cost jewellery is more popular in India.”

Title: Save Constitution, urges Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal while reading Preamble
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal. (Image credit: @AamAadmiParty)

NEW DELHI: Chief minister Arvind Kejriwal on Saturday read out the Preamble while addressing a gathering at Chhatrasal stadium. The CM stated that it was also the responsibility of the citizens to protect the Constitution. Towards the end of his speech, Kejriwal recited the song ‘Hum honge kamyaab’ and the children in the audience repeated it after him.

“It is our duty to protect the Indian Constitution,” Kejriwal said at the cultural programme organised by Delhi government on the occasion of the 70th Republic Day . Members of Delhi Police, Delhi Fire Service and Civil Defence, Home Guard and students of various schools participated in the parade with the chief minister taking the salute. Girl students from various government schools in Delhi got the loudest cheer.

Soon after the parade was over, Kejriwal addressed the gathering by saying “Bharat mata ki jai, inquilab zindabad and vande matram.”

He congratulated the citizens of Delhi and the nation on the occasion of Republic Day. “Our Constitution was framed by revered freedom fighters and people who made many sacrifices. They had the vision and the dream of a free India, which has been preserved in the Constitution.”

Before reading out the Preamble, Kejriwal said, “The Preamble is the soul of our Constitution. It acts as its crux.”

“If we protect the Constitution, it will protect us when our nation is in danger. We have to excel in all fields and make India great and number one nation in the world,” he added.

The CM also said that he wouldn’t not be able to speak much because of the poll code of conduct. “Each year, on the occasion of Republic Day, I used to interact with you on a lot of issues of public importance. I used to answer all your questions. But unfortunately, I will not be able to interact with you much today since the model code of conduct is in force,” the CM added.

After the cultural programme by students depicting various dances from different regions was over, the CM walked up to them clapping through the way. He later released tri-colour balloons in the air to end the celebrations.

Title: State assembly extends SC, ST reservation quota in assembly
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

State assembly has approved the extension of SC and ST reservation quota in the state assembly by another 10 years in the state on Saturday. The bill will come into effect from January 25. The parliament passed the bill under the Constitution (126th) Amendment for the extension of quota in Lok Sabha and state assemblies on December 12. Thereafter, the Act was sent to the states for rectification.

Title: Water birds census begins
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

Asian Water Birds Census 2020 was conducted across Jaisalmer district on Saturday. A bird watch fair was also organised at Gajroop Sagar on the same day, to inspire the youth towards environmental conservation and to create awareness about the birds.

Title: Two arrested for circulating new movies, pornos
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

Trichy: Trichy city police on Saturday booked four people and arrested two of them for downloading and circulating newly released feature films without copyright and selling pornographic videos in two separate incidents.

The Cantonment police registered a case against Mohammed Ashraf, owner of an electronic goods shop at Rockins road, and his staff, B Kadar Batcha, 21, from Alwar Thoppu, after searching the shop. Police said that Kadar Batcha was caught downloading newly released films from the internet and selling them to people by uploading them on their pen drives. He was also found downloading pornographic content from the internet and selling them to the customers.

The police said that Kadar Batcha confessed to have indulged in the crime at the behest of Mohammed Ashraf. The police seized a CPU, a monitor, mouse, cable wire, pen drive and cash from the shop after arresting Batcha. Batcha and Mohammed Ashraf, who is yet to be arrested, have been booked under sections of IPC and Copyright Act.

In another incident, the owner and staff of another electronic store in the locality were booked for a similar crime. Cases were registered against Riyazuddin, the shop owner, and J Sheik Abdullah, 22, from Valluvar Nagar. Sheik Abdullah was arrested by police and was later produced in the court where he was remanded to judicial custody.

Most of the films downloaded by the accused were Tamil films apart from a few Hollywood movies.

Title: Delhi elections: Election Commission bans BJP leader Kapil Mishra from poll campaign for 48 hours
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

BJP's Model Town candidate Kapil Mishra

NEW DELHI: The Election Commission on Saturday banned BJP’s Model Town candidate , Kapil Mishra, from campaigning for the next 48 hours for allegedly trying to aggravate differences between two communities through his comments.

During the ban, which began at 5pm on Saturday, Mishra is barred from holding public meetings, carrying out public processions, rallies or road shows and making public utterances in the media.

Complete coverage on Delhi elections

On Friday, Delhi Police registered an FIR against Mishra under the Representation of the People Act, 1951, following a directive of the Election Commission. Referring to the protests against Citizenship Amendment Act and National Register of Citizens at Shaheen Bagh, Mishra on Thursday tweeted that the February 8 elections would be a “muqabla” between India and Pakistan. He followed it up with remarks that several “mini-Pakistans” had been created in Delhi and Shaheen Bagh was being replicated all across the capital.

Reacting to the ban, Delhi BJP chief Manoj Tiwari said he respected the commission’s order but urged it to take into cognizance the communally sensitive slogans being raised at Shaheen Bagh.

In a show-cause notice to Mishra sent by the office of the returning officer of Model Town assembly constituency on Friday, the commission said the remarks had violated provisions of Model Code of Conduct and the Representation of the People Act, and was punishable under law. It stated that in case the reply was unsatisfactory, action would be initiated against Mishra without any further notice.

In a four-page reply, Mishra said his comments had been taken out of context and misrepresented intentionally to paint a one-sided picture. He also claimed he had neither named any caste, community, religion or linguistic group, nor did he intend to aggravate any differences to gain electoral benefit. “My statement merely refers to two countries, two entities who are not involved in any election process at the national level at present,” he said, adding that the protests were causing inconvenience to people.

Before the notice was issued, Mishra said protesters at Shaheen Bagh “have refused to follow the Constitution and Parliament. Videos are emerging of children talking about the death of PM Narendra Modi and home minister Amit Shah. The site has virtually turned into a mini-Pakistan. It is being backed by political parties”.

He had claimed that for political gains, parties were creating Shaheen Bagh-like protest centres. “In such a scenario, Hindustan will stand up against Pakistan and the assembly elections will be a contest between Hindustan and Pakistan.”

Title: Defer zilla panchayat elections, let poll panel reserve wards: Congress
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

Girish Chodankar

PANAJI: Congress on Saturday demanded that the zilla panchayat elections, scheduled on March 15, be postponed and the powers of reserving wards be vested with the State Election Commission (SEC) as assured by former chief minister Manohar Parrikar as per the provisions of the Constitution.

BJP government assured on the floor of the House in 2017 that the necessary amendments would be done to the Panchayati Raj Act, but deliberately sat over it for three long years, Congress state president Girish Chodankar said, adding, “Frequent reminders by the Union ministry of Panchayati Raj and subsequent affidavit filed by the SEC before the high court there was not much headway.”

Chodankar said the declaration of date for ZP polls was unconstitutional and amounts to contempt of court.

The poll panel had stated in its affidavit that all panchayat elections have to be conducted under its supervision, direction and control right from electoral roll preparation to declaration of results, as per Article 243K of the Constitution.

In 2017, Parrikar had informed the House that “delimitation and reservation is difficult for government to do in a short period as it leads to confusion, allegations and someone goes to court. That is why I have clearly written on file that there is no need for the government to do it and election commission can do it”.

In spite of this, BJP government has not amended both Panchayati Raj and Municipal acts till date with a clear intention to hijack the grass root level governance by self-governing bodies in violation of the provisions of the Constitution, he said.

It is also clear that this has been done in order to manipulate the forthcoming ZP elections , and giving scope for challenging it in court which will be held illegal unless the powers of delimitation and reservation of wards are transferred to the SEC.

The Congress state president has now demanded that the order of conducting ZP elections be revoked and necessary amendments be made in the forthcoming Assembly session beginning February 3 and announcing another date for ZP elections.

Title: Nirbhaya parents and lawyer in Indore-Jan 25
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

Indore: Parents of Nirbhaya claimed to have lost their faith on human rights organisations and said that international human rights bodies are more interested in protecting convicts than upholding rights of victims and their families.

“Did my girl (Nirbhaya) who died seven years ago not have any human rights or do I not have any human rights while I have been fighting for justice? Not even one organization had come to ask me how I am fighting till now. Government should help such families financially,” mother of Nirbhaya, Asha Devi told reporters on Saturday.

Asha Devi was in city along with her husband, Badrinath Singh and lawyer Seema Kushwaha for a flag hoisting ceremony on Republic Day.

Kushwaha added that people, who are talking about human rights of convicts, should study the definition of human rights as these convicts did extremely heinous crime.

“It has been seven years but crimes haven't decreased. Even though there were several amendments done, it has been useless. Government is insensitive towards the females which is 49% of the country’s population. We are hopeful that the Article 72 will be amended,” she added.

Asha Devi, who is hopeful that convicts will be executed on February 1, added that in a span of three decades she has seen only one rape convict being hanged and she has decided that she will continue to fight for rights of several other Nirbhayas.

“Each month 6500 rapes take place in our country how can it be expected that the country will progress if society is not safe how will country be safe? I want to see how much court gives right. I am expecting Supreme Court to come up with guidelines soon and it's not just one Nirbhaya but for several others,” said father of Nirbhaya.

Parents of Nirbhaya suggested that in case of rape, or gang rape the family shouldn’t hide the victim as it wasn't the fault of the girl but that of those criminals. Parents should support the girl and the society will support. They also urged not to differentiate between children on the basis of gender.

Title: ‘Caste divide & negative propaganda should end’
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat addresses workers on Saturday

Gorakhpur: On the second day of his five-day visit to Gorakhpur, RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat on Saturday addressed Sangh members and discussed the importance of social harmony.

“Social evils like caste discrimination, inequality and untouchability need to end soon along with social arrogance. Negative propaganda is dividing society and this too should end.” Bhagwat said, water conservation, tree plantation and plastic-free surrounding is the need of the hour to remove environmental imbalance.

Backing traditional forms of agriculture, he said, “neither soil gets polluted nor crops get poisoned. Chemical fertilizers harm water, land and human health. With efforts of RSS, organic farming is being promoted. We follow two aspects of 8-fold yoga, yam-niyam. And we need to follow five rules for agriculture, which are swachhta, swadyay, tap, sudharm and santosh.”

“Under swachhta, villages should be kept clean, swadhyay is studying agriculture, ‘tap’ is considering land as God and ‘sudharm’ is following dharma, while santosh is organic farming.” RSS chief said.

Bhagwat said coexistence without caste discrimination could usher real development in the country. “For people of all communities to live in harmony, one needs to go to villages and showcase core Indian values to bring about a change in society. This can be achieved without advertisement or government help and change can be brought about at the grassroots.”

Title: Anti-CAA resolution by Rajasthan government unconstitutional: BJP
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

Gulab Chand Kataria

JAIPUR: State BJP president Satish Poonia on Saturday said the resolution passed against CAA , a law made by the Parliament, was an ‘unconstitutional’ move by the Gehlot government.

Poonia said the BJP will oppose the move at all possible public platforms. While talking to the mediapersons at the gate of Vidhan Sabha, Poonia said that Gehlot has blatantly demolished the Constitution and has lost right to remain on any constitutional post.

“Congress should read that Father of the Nation Mahatma Gandhi had told that if the Hindus and Sikhs will face any problem in Pakistan will be persecuted they will have full right to come to India,” said Poonia. He reiterated that in the federal cooperative system state cannot oppose any act passed by the parliament.

“Granting citizenship is a matter that comes under the purview of Centre. Who has given you the right to challenge the CAA. This has been done as a part of your appeasement policy and vote bank politics,” said leader of opposition Gulab Chand Kataria in the assembly. On excluding Muslims from CAA, he said, “Yeh Koi Dharamshalla nahin ki sabko daal do (India is not a free place to accommodate anyone).”

Supporting the CAA, Kataria said, “We should sincerely think how Hindu minority is being harassed and supressed in Pakistan and if these people apply for Indian citizenship they should be given it respectfully,” he said.

Former education minister Vasudev Devnani questioned Congress of even having an idea of the pain caused to the refugees from Pakistan. “I am the victim of the religious persecution in Pakistan as my family had to flee leaving behind our culture, history and spiritual abode. The stories of partition and persecution heard from my elders are still fresh in my memory. What BJP did was to make the procedure of citizenship bit easier and convenient for the minorities from across the border. And what Congress did was a historical blunder which the people of the country will never forgive him,” said Devnani.

MLA from Ramganj Mandhi Madan Dilwar minced no words in attacking the government in the parliament. He said, “I am openly challenging the government to try and make a law against the implementation of CAA in the state,” said Dilawar, who called the passing of a resolution means ‘nothing’ in the federal system.

Title: Gujarat: Student rehearsing for Republic Day dies in Anand district
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

Representative image

VADODARA/ ANAND: A Class IX student died during rehearsal of Republic Day parade in his school in Karamsad town of Anand district on Saturday.

The student identified as Suyog Soni fell unconscious while the rehearsal of the Republic Day parade was underway at the Shri Saraswati Vidyavihar School located on Vallabh Vidyanagar-Karamsad Road.

The school witnessed anxious moments after Soni fainted on the campus. Later, he was rushed to Shree Krishna Hospital at Karamsad where doctors declared him brought dead.

Vallabh Vidyanagar police has taken the body in its custody. A post-mortem will be conducted to ascertain the cause of death, sources said. Boy’s father Manish Soni is a resident of Karamsad, police sources said.

Title: Delhi assembly polls: Election Commission bans Kapil Mishra from poll campaign for 48 hours
Content:
BJP's Model Town candidate Kapil Mishra

NEW DELHI: The Election Commission on Saturday banned BJP’s Model Town candidate , Kapil Mishra, from campaigning for the next 48 hours for allegedly trying to aggravate differences between two communities through his comments.During the ban, which began at 5pm on Saturday, Mishra is barred from holding public meetings, carrying out public processions, rallies or road shows and making public utterances in the media.On Friday, Delhi Police registered an FIR against Mishra under the Representation of the People Act, 1951, following a directive of the Election Commission. Referring to the protests against Citizenship Amendment Act and National Register of Citizens at Shaheen Bagh, Mishra on Thursday tweeted that the February 8 elections would be a “muqabla” between India and Pakistan. He followed it up with remarks that several “mini-Pakistans” had been created in Delhi and Shaheen Bagh was being replicated all across the capital.Reacting to the ban, Delhi BJP chief Manoj Tiwari said he respected the commission’s order but urged it to take into cognizance the communally sensitive slogans being raised at Shaheen Bagh.In a show-cause notice to Mishra sent by the office of the returning officer of Model Town assembly constituency on Friday, the commission said the remarks had violated provisions of Model Code of Conduct and the Representation of the People Act, and was punishable under law. It stated that in case the reply was unsatisfactory, action would be initiated against Mishra without any further notice.In a four-page reply, Mishra said his comments had been taken out of context and misrepresented intentionally to paint a one-sided picture. He also claimed he had neither named any caste, community, religion or linguistic group, nor did he intend to aggravate any differences to gain electoral benefit. “My statement merely refers to two countries, two entities who are not involved in any election process at the national level at present,” he said, adding that the protests were causing inconvenience to people.Before the notice was issued, Mishra said protesters at Shaheen Bagh “have refused to follow the Constitution and Parliament. Videos are emerging of children talking about the death of PM Narendra Modi and home minister Amit Shah. The site has virtually turned into a mini-Pakistan. It is being backed by political parties”.He had claimed that for political gains, parties were creating Shaheen Bagh-like protest centres. “In such a scenario, Hindustan will stand up against Pakistan and the assembly elections will be a contest between Hindustan and Pakistan.”

Title: ‘Will raise duping case in House’
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

Colva: NCP Benaulim MLA Churchill Alemao on Saturday said he would raise in the state assembly the issue of hundreds of Colva villagers being duped of crores of rupees by a cooperative society. He said that although complaints of similar frauds were recorded at the Maina-Curtorim police station in 2010 and 2013, no MLA had spoken about it in the House. Alemao further said that on his request, cooperation minister Govind Gaude had appointed an administrator to look into the affairs of the society. He is expected to meet CM Pramod Sawant to demand an inquiry into the matter. tnn

Title: Bajri mafia attacks cop
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

Suspected bajri mafia attacked official of Sepau police station in Dholpur district on Saturday when he went to inspect stock of illegal gravel and sand. ASI Rajesh Singh was attacked with sticks and suffered injuries on his hand, legs and head. Villagers rescued him and took him to the hospital.

Title: Platform extensions among rly division’s new projects
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

Trichy: Trichy railway division has proposed to take up several infrastructure development works at the railways stations in its division. This was announced during the 71st Republic Day celebrations at the division on Sunday.

After unfurling the national flag at the railway grounds at Kallukuzhi, divisional railway manager (DRM) Ajay Kumar announced the projects to be undertaken in the division.

The project of extending the platforms at Srirangam, Ariyalur, Cuddalore Port Junction, Mayiladuthurai, Vridhachallam, Tirucchirappalli Fort, Ayanapuram, Thiruverumbur, Uttangalmangalam, Vadalur, Neyveli and Kurinjipadi railway stations will be carried out at the cost of Rs 4 crore, said Kumar.

The other projects include reconstruction of station building in Nagappattinam at the cost of Rs 3 crore, construction of boundary walls at various locations in the division at a cost of Rs10 crore, building platform shelters at Tiruvarur, Karaikal & Papanasam at a cost of Rs.2.5 crore and works on platform 2 and 3 at Tiruvarur station.Kumar also read out the number of on-going projects for passenger amenities and infrastructure development and its progress. He added that the redevelopment work of Trichy railway station is in its final stage. The works in the circulating area have been completed and buses are being allowed to drop and pick up passengers from the additional entry at Trichy junction. The work was taken up in two phases at a cost of Rs 23 crore, he said adding that Trichy division was the first under Southern Railway to complete bio-toilet fitting in all the coaches.

On the revenue, he said that gross earning of the division stood at Rs 776.25 crore that was 13.85 % higher than the earnings of last year. The originating freight earning was Rs 435.69 crore that was also 15.66% higher than the previous year earning of Rs 376.71 crore. The division has handled the transportation of 8.134 MTs of commodities registering 13% improvement. The target was 12.50 MT for the current financial year, he said.

He also said that the cumulative passenger earning also touched Rs 278.17 crore showing 9.34 % increase than previous year. The division also witnessed 31.5 million passengers travelling this year, making 0.32 % increase than last year. Kumar said that the division recorded 89.98% in punctuality in the current year that was 5.37 % higher than previous year.

Title: Abolish I-T, maintain 10% GDP for a decade to beat China: Subramanian Swamy
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

Subramanian Swamy

SURAT: Senior BJP leader Subramanian Swamy has said that India requires to maintain GDP of 10% for a decade if it wants to overtake China. For that, the first thing India needs to do is to abolish Income Tax, he asserted.

Addressing a large gathering at the session on India Rising-Future Economic Outlook organised by the Southern Gujarat Chamber of Commerce and Industry (SGCCI) at Sarsana on Saturday, Swamy lamented that the country’s economy is in bad shape for the past couple of years and the GDP is continuously down sliding.

“PM Narendra Modi focused on Ujwala, toilets and cleanliness, but on the other hand our factories are shutting down and the unemployment is rising. This is a big challenge and the economic policies are needed to be framed in right perspective,” he said.

The senior leader further said, “I have been writing letters to PM Modi since 2015 on the economic policies, but he is not listening. It may be because, I am the ‘Jamai’ (brother-in-law) as my wife is from Gujarat. I am ready to give the blueprint for the economic success” said Swamy.

“If India successfully achieves 10% GDP for one decade at least, it will overtake China and challenge the US in the next 20 years,” Swamy asserted.

India is a superpower when it comes to young population with average age of 26 years, he said. He added that 70% of the population is below 35 years of age. In America, it is 47 years, followed by China 35 years and Japan is 50 years, he explained.

“India is full of potential and talent. Our expert minds are going in foreign countries and achieving big milestones in technology, research and other areas. We have lost our resources and they have to be brought back,” Swamy said.

Coming down heavily on the protests against the Citizen Amendment Act (CCA) going on in the country, Swamy said, “The CAA protests across the country are fake and sponsored by foreign powers, who wants to spread fear among the people. This is a conspiracy against India’s development. There is no such section where the BJP has decided on its own and brought to the Parliament.”

“Our constitution is of Hindu Rashtra. There are sections for cow slaughter, giving encouragement to Sanskrit, Uniform Civil Code etc. Only BJP can protect the integrity of this country,” Swamy said, adding that Pakistan, Bangladesh and Afghanistan are Islamic states and are not secular like India.

“Muslims have not come as refugees from Pakistan, Bangladesh and Afghanistan as all these countries are Islamic. However, when the list was made there were no Muslims. There were 25,000 Hindus, 5,000 Sikh, 1,000 Christian, two each of Buddhist and Parsi,” he added.

Title: Role of youths vital for democracy, says governor
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

Jaipur: On the 10th National Voters' Day, Governor Kalraj Mishra on Saturday said if every voter realises his/her fundamental duties and follows them, the pillar of democracy will be strengthened further and called upon the younger generation and the newly-registered voters to play an important role in it.

Mishra said that the National Voters' Day was a proud moment for Indian democracy. "To strengthen the democratic traditions, the Election Commission is not only encouraging wide participation of the voters, but is also creating awareness, promoting fairness and lawful voting," the Governor said at the function of the 10th National Voters' Day held at HCMRIPA in Jaipur on Saturday. The poster of 'Election Literacy-Enabled Democracy' was also released.

"In order to connect the youth with the voting process, registered literacy clubs should be opened in all higher education institutions and regular meetings must be held," he added.

The Governor said that National Voters' Day is a unique attempt to inculcate a feeling among the people that as long as any eligible person is away from the process, the democracy cannot achieve its objective.

"The message of the commission is very clear that it will not stop until the last eligible person is engaged in the voting process," Mishra added.

He also stressed on making the voters of the cities more aware. "The celebration of democracy cannot succeed without everyone's participation," he said. He also appealed to all political parties, social organizations, NGOs, corporates and the media to lend all possible support in this "sacred work".

Title: Rajasthan high court notice to state government over farmers affected by Chittorgarh dam
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

Representative image

JODHPUR: The high court on Saturday issued notices to the state government and district collectors of three districts, while allowing a PIL by the farmers affected by submergence area of Matrikundiya dam in Chittorgarh district .

The affected farmers, after having knocked every possible door praying for relief, moved the high court with the PIL and sought relief by demanding that directions be issued for safeguarding their agricultural land affected by the dam water. The PIL has sought a fresh survey to estimate the damages caused to them by the dam water since its construction and directions for acquisition of the land of affected farmers falling under the catchment and submergence area of the dam.

According to the counsel for petitions, Shyam Paliwal, Matrikundiya dam was constructed at the confluence of Bhilwara, Rajsamand and Chittorgarh in 1974 as an extension of the Meja Dam of Bhilwara in order to meet the water needs of Hindustan Zink Ltd and Meja Dam primarily.

“The dam has been receiving water to its full capacity almost every year, due to which the crops of the farmers in the area have suffered consistently. This has turned into huge losses to the farmers, who are solely dependent on farming and cattle rearing,” said Paliwal adding that not a single penny in the form of compensation has ever been disbursed to these aggrieved farmers.

Title: Goa: Churchill Alemao says he’s against CAA, but will continue to back government
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

COLVA: NCP MLA Churchill Alemao said that he would move a resolution in the assembly against CAA, but would continue to support the BJP government in the state.

The Benaulim MLA said his support to the BJP government in the state has always been issue-based. “Union home minister Amit Shah is hell-bent on implementing CAA and there is no assurance from him that NRC will not follow CAA,” he said during a press conference on Saturday.

At least 70% of Goans have travelled abroad and a large percentage have opted for Portuguese passports for the sake of employment and better quality of life, but in case of any eventuality, they have to come back to their motherland, and they cannot be treated as outsiders, he said. The government has taken over evacuee and enemy properties belonging to Goans who failed to return to Goa within the stipulated time to claim the same, and a similar situation is going to arise if CAA and NRC is implemented in Goa, Alemao said.

Asked whether he would withdraw his support to the government if it does not allow his resolution, he said, for a resolution to be move, he needs the support of other members of the House. He said there is no reason for him to withdraw support as his has always been ‘conditional support’ and in this matter, he is not with the government.

Title: Man crushed to death, irate locals torch two trucks
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

A 30-year-old was crushed to death by a truck in Nandganj area of Ghazipur district on Friday night. An irate mob of locals torched two trucks and police had to toil hard to bring the situation under control. One Bijendra alias Guddu Ram, a resident of Fatehullapur village, was run over by a truck while returning home from Ghazipur on his bicycle. He died on the spot. Locals went on rampage after the mishap, indulged in brick batting and set two trucks laden with grains on fire.

Title: ‘Send reports of lottery process before Feb 5’
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

Jaipur: Following Supreme Court's order, the panchayati raj department has written to the district collectors directing them to complete the process of ward panch delimitation and to conduct lotteries to reserve seats of sarpanch, ward panch, zila parishad members/pradhans and members of panchayat samitis (under the remaining 142 panchayat samitis) at the earliest.

The districts have been asked to submit final reports to the state election commission and the panchayati raj department before February 5, while mentioning that the districts must complete the lottery within three days of finishing the delimitation of ward panch.

tnn

Title: In DK, six people die in a week due to road accidents
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

Representative image

MANGALURU: The roads of Dakshina Kannada witness six deaths every week due to road accidents . Interestingly, Mangaluru is the worst among tier-2 cities in Karnataka when it comes to rash and negligent driving leading to deaths.

According to data, Mangaluru city commissionerate alone recorded 1,028 accidents in 2019, out which 20 per cent were fatal, and similar accidents take place in Dakshina Kannada district police jurisdictions. As many as 293 people were killed in 266 fatal accidents in Dakshina Kannada in 2019.

However, data also shows that deaths as well as number of accidents are decreasing every year due to traffic enforcement. Five years ago (in 2015), 373 people were killed in 345 fatal accidents in the district.

Dakshina Kannada superintendent of police B M Laxmi Prasad , who recently conducted a study on accidents in Dakshina Kannada district police limits, pointed out that road accident deaths on national highways, state highways and major district roads take place due to riders not wearing helmets, drunken driving, use of mobile phone while driving, sudden lane change while speeding, due to speeding and pedestrians being run over by vehicles.

People killed in poorly lit areas in DK district limits

“After implementation of a higher penalty for not wearing helmets and other traffic violations, over three months, police have noticed an increase of pedestrian deaths in Dakshina Kannada district police limits.

People have been killed in places where there is poor lighting, which includes national highways, state highways and mofussil areas,” said Laxmi Prasad.

He added that there is no direct correlation between the amount of fine charged and accidents. So police are now changing focus to enforcement, which is specific to reasons for death.

The year 2018 has seen the least number of deaths in many years, because the two major national highways—Sampaje and Gundya-Shirady— are closed during monsoon due to landslides.

“In Dakshina Kannada police limits, overall, there is a 24% reduction in fatal accidents from 2017. Recently, we have given details to the PWD and NHAI to fix black spots on the road and to add safety features. We have also requested for more number of speed cameras and speed guns for better traffic enforcement,” said Laxmi Prasad.

Jay walking too a killer

In Mangaluru city police commissionerate, the main cause for road accidents are rash and negligent driving and skidding of vehicles.

A study on traffic accidents in city limits by the postgraduate department of criminology and forensic science of School of Social Work, Roshni Nilaya, showed that 47.6 percentage of victims of road accidents were drivers or riders of other vehicles.

About 29.5 percentage of pedestrians were victims to road accidents as they do not cross on the zebra crossing, some tend to walk on the middle of the road and due to rash driving, pedestrians are run over.

A total 10.2 per cent of road accidents resulted in deaths. In 2018, 1,172 accident cases were registered out which 167 were fatal, in which 167 people died, including 63 pedestrians. The results were the outcome of traffic accident data of 2018.

Title: Three arrested for murdering history-sheeter in Pandesara
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

Representative image

SURAT: Crime branch sleuths of city police arrested three persons for allegedly murdering Sachin Mishra, a history-sheeter , at Pandesara on Friday. Devendra alias Bunty Mishra, 26, Swapnil alias Nandu Rane, 28, and Mahendra alias Dharmedra Kothari, 27, were nabbed by police from Kadodara on Saturday and a country-made pistol and two knives were recovered from their possession. They had escaped to Kaodadara in the same autorickshaw in which they had come to shoot Sachin to death.

Police investigation revealed that Devendra, a history-sheeter, and Sachin were lodged in Lajpor Central Jail (LCJ) after their arrest in different cases. “They fought over some issue in the jail and Sachin had thrashed Devendra in the presence of other prisoners. Devendra wanted to take revenge for the thrashing and hence planned the murder,” police said.

After Sachin came out of the jail, Devendra used to visit Pandesara regularly to locate him. The accused were carrying two knives with them to stab Sachin in case the pistol failed or missed the target. The victim was shot in neck to ensure that he died. Devendra had purchased the country-made pistol from Prashant Patil .

Title: To shake off slowdown, businesses pin hopes on Budget
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

Battling subdued demand following slowdown pressures, businesses and industries are looking forward to the ensuing general budget with great hopes. Industry stakeholders are expecting a slew of announcements and steps to boost demand and provide impetus to economic growth. TOI brings what industries with Gujarat as their stronghold are expecting from the Budget, which is scheduled to be presented by the Union finance minister Nirmala Sitharaman on February 1.

Pharma wants support for R&D, APIs

Research and Development (R&D) is a key to India’s growth in the pharmaceutical sector. To encourage R&D, the government provides weighted tax deduction of 150% for any capital and revenue expenditure incurred on in-house R&D by a company. Indian Drug Manufacturers Association (IDMA) has asked the finance minister to raise the limit to 200% or 250% or to a feasible level.

Secondly, R&D incentives are offered to units approved by the department of scientific and industrial research (DSIR). Smaller and medium units, however, do not get such benefits. The industry has asked the government to cover SMEs by easing the criteria for such sops.

Active pharmaceutical ingredients (APIs) or bulk drugs manufacturing needs support if India is to reduce growing dependence on China for APIs. “There is a need to formulate a policy or scheme on a priority basis to boost manufacturing of APIs in India,” said Viranchi Shah, chairman, IDMA-Gujarat.

The industry has also requested for an alternative mechanism to cover loss of GST on physician samples or expired goods. Pharma firms have to return ITC on these goods.

Reduce import duty on gold, diamonds

India is the world’s largest diamond cutting and polishing centre where diamonds retrieved from old jewellery come for re-cutting. The industry has demanded reduction in the import duty on diamonds and gemstone from 7.5% to 2.5%.

After the hike in the duty last year, the current imports of cut and polished diamonds have come down to less than US $500 million from US $1 billion in 2017-18. “Re-cutting of diamonds is a big business in India, but the high import duty is a major challenge. The trading of diamonds is also hampered due to high import duty,” said Colin Shah vice-chairman, Gems and Jewellery Export Promotion Council (GJEPC).

The industry has also demanded reduction in the import duty on gold and other metals from 12.5% to 4% to stop the illegal smuggling of gold from other channels and undue blockage of working capital of small and medium jewellery exporters.

K K Sharma, CEO of Surat Hira Bourse (SHB) said, “India has the highest import duty on gold in the world. With GST, the duty on gold comes to around 15%. The government has to seriously think of reducing it to promote exports.”

MMF sector pitches for curbs on cheap imports

Surat is the country’s largest manufacturer of man-made fabrics (MMF) with the annual production pegged at Rs 35,000 crore. The industry wants 10% import duty imposed on cheap fabrics from Vietnam, China and Bangladesh.

Countries like Vietnam and Bangladesh enjoy Most Favoured Nation (MFN) status with the provision to have free trade of major textile commodities including MMF and silk fabrics. Ashish Gujarati, president of Pandesara Weavers Association (PWA) said, “Cheap import of fabrics have put the domestic industry in doldrums. The fabrics manufactured in Surat and other places have become non-competitive.”

The industry has also demanded 40% subsidy under the Technology Upgradation Fund Scheme (TUFS) as against current 10% to promote modernization in the MMF sector.

Jitu Vakharia, president, South Gujarat Textile Processors Association (SGTPA) said, “The production cost is very high due to electricity tariff, anti-dumping duty on yarns etc. We want the government to make policy changes for the textile sector.”

Dairy majors hope for more allocation, tax benefits

Dairy majors like Amul and National Dairy Development Board (NDDB) have sought higher budgetary allocation as well as ‘priority sector’ status for dairy and animal husbandry. They have also demanded that income earned from dairying be exempted from income tax. Currently, income from agriculture defined in Section 2 (1A) of the Income Tax Act does not mention “dairy farming” as agricultural operation because of which dairy farmers are taxed.

“Dairying and animal husbandry contributes 27% to the total agriculture GDP. Hence, we believe that the budget should be at least Rs 37,412 crore for the sector. If the sector gets the required thrust, we will be able to achieve the target of doubling farmers’ income,” said R S Sodhi, MD, Gujarat Co-operative Milk Marketing Federation (GCMMF), which markets Amul brand.

Amul has also sought steps to remove the disparity between cooperatives and corporates. “The corporate tax rate was reduced from 30% to 22% in the previous full budget. The benefit, however, is not extended to cooperative societies like ours,” added Sodhi.

“Also, we are looking for support for grid connected solar irrigation pump and biogas/slurry production schemes on cooperative model to help the dairy sector sustain its growth momentum in coming years,” said Dilip Rath, chairman, NDDB

Ceramic industry demands inclusion of natural gas in GST

The ceramic tiles industry has demanded that the government should bring natural gas under the ambit of Goods and Services Tax (GST). “If natural gas is brought under GST, the tile makers will get input tax credit (ITC) on gas consumed. We do not get any tax rebate currently on value added tax (VAT) levied on gas, which accounts for 30-35% of the total production cost,” said Nilesh Jetpariya, president, Wall Tiles Division, Morbi Ceramics Association (MCA).

The industry players also want a dedicated export promotion council for ceramic industry. Morbi has been declared as “The Town of Export Excellence”. However, it has not received any benefit from the declaration. Tile makers are seeking announcement of special package for sprucing up infrastructure in the town.

More work needs to be done to promote EV

The budget announcements will provide the key to setting the tone for 2020 for the automotive industry. “The government’s recent announcements on the promotion of EVs in India, especially for government use and public transport, is encouraging. However, we feel that more work needs to be done to promote EV adoption in India not only in public transport but among private customers as well,” said Rajeev Chaba, president & managing director - MG Motor India.

“It should also look at providing incentives to stakeholders for sourcing critical raw materials for EV battery manufacturing in India. This will enable a strong EV-centric ecosystem and will be beneficial for the long-term growth of this high-potential space,” he added.

“The textile industry provides the highest employment in the country. We want the import of cheap fabrics to be stopped to protect the domestic industry.” Bharat Gandhi, chairman, Federation of Indian Art Silk Weaving Industry (FIASWI)

“Enhancement of weighted tax deduction on R&D to 200% will enable new discoveries and innovations. Proper financial support from technology upgradation fund for pharma SMEs will help them graduate to the next level and become exporters.” Mahendra Patel, MD, Lincoln Pharmaceuticals Ltd.

“We hope the government is watching the tumble in our export numbers and heeds our long-standing request for duty reduction on gold and cut and polished diamonds and gemstones.” Colin Shah, vice-chairman, Gems and Jewellery Export Promotion Council (GJEPC).

“The major challenge for small and medium diamantaires is to get loans from banks. Our request is to make a banking policy where diamantaires can get loans for their businesses.” Babu Kathiriya, president, Surat Diamond Association (SDA).

"We hope that the government provides the right policy, incentives, and charging infrastructure to put more EVs on the road.” Rajeev Chaba, president & MD, MG Motor India.

“We have asked government to set up a dedicated export promotion council for ceramic industry. Unlike other sectors, ceramic has shown a growth in exports.” Nilesh Jetpariya, president, Wall Tiles Division, Morbi Ceramics Association (MCA).

“We are looking for policies aimed at scientific farming in unutilized ‘gauchar land’ so that farmers can get proper fodder as well as schemes to promote biogas production. Also, the thrust should be on ensuring that every village has banking facilities and there should be a digital ecosystem which supports direct payment to farmers.” Amit Vyas, MD, Amul Dairy

“Consider reduction in GST rates on ghee and flavoured milk, dairy-related equipment and breeding inputs, remove customs duty on follicular stimulating hormone and cattle germplasm and increase custom duty on all categories of whey.” Dilip Rath, chairman, NDDB

Title: Two killed as car overturns
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

A tourist vehicle met with an accident in which two girls died on the spot and one girl & two boys were injured. The car got disbalanced and overturned. The five friends were going to Longewala. On Ghotaru Longewala road, at Nihalkhan Ki Dhani, 10 km from Ghotaru, the mishap occurred.

Title: Delhi assembly polls: Your vote will keep country secured, says Amit Shah
Content:
Amit Shah

NEW DELHI: Union home minister Amit Shah in his campaign rallies at Badli and Bawana on Saturday night said that Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal and Congress leader Rahul Gandhi through their vote bank politics had made Delhi unsafe for everyone. He accused the Aam Aadmi Party government of not only failing to keep its promises, but also supporting those who wanted to break the country. Shah also attacked AAP for opposing the abrogation of Article 370 and questioning the “surgical strike.”“Your vote on February 8 will not only ensure the future of Delhi but also the security of the country,” said Shah.Attacking Kejriwal for not delivering on his promises of setting up 1,000 schools, 50 colleges and buying 5,000 DTC buses, apart from providing clean water, Shah said: “The status of education has worsened. Kejriwal has given poisonous air and water to the people of Delhi.”Promising the slum dwellers two-room pucca houses, he also attacked Kejriwal for delaying and blocking the Union government’s action to regularise the unauthorised colonies. “Modiji wrote to Kejriwal in 2015 and 2017 for the list of the colonies. He said it would take two years. When Modiji came to power in 2019, we identified the colonies through satellite mapping and started the process of regularising them,” he said.Attacking Rahul Gandhi and Kejriwal in the same breath, Shah said they supported those who raised anti-national slogans in JNU. Kejriwal government didn’t permit prosecution to those who raised slogans to break the country, he added. “Mauni Baba, Rahul Baba and Kejriwal, you can abuse me and my party, but abusing the country will not be tolerated. Delhi will decide whether it will vote for tukde tukde supporters or those who want to put them in jail.”

Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

Amit Shah

NEW DELHI: Union home minister Amit Shah in his campaign rallies at Badli and Bawana on Saturday night said that Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal and Congress leader Rahul Gandhi through their vote bank politics had made Delhi unsafe for everyone.
