Title: Cong releases list of 22 vice-presidents, 31 general secretaries
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

Dehradun: After a long wait, the All India Congress Committee (AICC) on Saturday released the list of the ‘Pradesh Congress committee’ on Saturday.

The jumbo list comprises 22 vice-presidents, 31 general secretaries, 1 treasurer, 98 secretaries and 90 special invitee members. After the declaration of the list by AICC general secretary KC Venugopal, state Congress chief Pritam Singh is expected to announce the name of party spokespersons in the next few days.

Former minister Rajendra Singh Bhandari, MLAs Mayukh Mahar, Vijaypal Sajwan, Vikram Singh Negi, Madan Bisht, Ganesh Godiyal and other senior members such as Suryakant Dhasmana and Jot Singh Bisht have been given the position of vice president. Former MLA Jeet Ram, former chairman of Mussooorie Municipal Council Manmohan Mall, Bhuwan Kapdi, Godavari Thapli, Anand Rawat, Rajendra Shah and Vijay Saraswat have been made general secretary. Sunil Gulati has been named as the treasurer of Pradesh Congress Committee. Harish Dhami, Ranveer SIngh Rawat, Mukesh Singh Negi, Rajeev Kandari, Akeel Ahmed, Ram Babu Mishra, Kiran Dalakoti, Sagar Manwal and Pradeep Choudhary are among the 98 secretaries announced by the AICC. Senior party leaders, including former CM Harish Rawat, leader of opposition Indira Hridayesh, former state chief Kishore Upadhyay, Rajya Sabha MP Pradeep Tamta, former speaker Govind Singh Kunjwal, former MP KC ingh Baba, Ranikhet legislator Karan Mahra, MLAs Manoj Rawat, Aadesh Chauhan, Furkhan Ahmed, Mamta Rakesh and former ministers Dinesh Agarwal, Nav Prabhat, Mantri Prasad Naithani, Harish Durgapal and Tilak Raj Behad have been given a place in the special invitee member list.

“The new committee strikes a balance between youth and experience and it will vastly help the party,” said Pritam Singh.

Meanwhile, the announcement of the committee sparked an angry reaction from Dharchula MLA Harish Dhami who has been made one of the 98 general secretaries. In a Facebook post on Saturday, he said that he was resigning from the post that he has been given and will soon announce a date when he would be leaving Congress.

Title: Husband kills tribal woman in Chhota Udepur
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

Representative image

VADODARA: A casual labourer was arrested on Saturday for killing his wife over petty issue in forests of Naswadi taluka of Chhota Udepur district last Sunday.

The accused Arvind Nayka admitted of murdering his wife Kokila (42) to the deceased’s brother Ramesh, when the latter went to inquire about her whereabouts.

Police said that the husband and wife had a bitter quarrel following which she came to her father’s house at Pala village around three weeks back.

On January 19, Arvind, who lives in Bodeli , went to meet his wife.

After waiting at Pala for a few hours, Arvind asked Kokila to tag along to a health centre in Naswadi as his health is not fine.

The duo left for Naswadi but on the way, they had another round of argument when Arvind asked for money for treatment from Kokila and she said that she was not carrying any.

Arvind slapped her a couple of times and Kokila started to run away from there but fell at a distance. In a fit of rage, Arvind strangulated her to death and then went back to his home.

When Kokila did not return home, her father Shankar called up Arvind and asked about her, he gave him vague answers. Shankar then asked Ramesh to come home and help him find Kokila.

Ramesh was working as a farm labourer in Surendranagar .

On reaching home on Friday, Ramesh went to meet Arvind where the latter admitted of murdering his wife.

Ramesh and other villagers found Kokila’s decomposed body in the forest late on Friday evening.

An offence of murder was registered against Arvind and he was arrested on Saturday.

Title: Valuables worth over Rs 3 lakh stolen
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

Representative image

VADODARA: Burglars targeted a house at Siddharth Bungalows on Sama-Savli Road on January 22 and decamped with cash and jewellery worth Rs 3.3 lakh.

Owner Ashwin Makwana, whose works as a manager at an agrochemical company in Ankleshwar , learned about the theft on January 22 when he was holidaying with his family members in Goa.

Makwana’s neighbour called him up to inform after noticing the broken window grill on the back side of the house.

On reaching Vadodara on Friday, Makwana found that the valuables in the bedroom were scattered on the floor and ornaments which were kept in the locker were missing. He stated in his complaint that burglars stole gold necklaces , earrings, rings, nose rings, bracelet, silver anklets and other silverware all worth Rs 3.2 lakh. Thieves also stole Rs 5,000 in cash that was kept at the same place.

Title: BJP damaging secular structure of India: Parliamentary affairs minister Shanti Dhariwal
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

Shanti Dhariwal

JAIPUR: Parliamentary affairs minister Shanti Dhariwal , who is known for his knowledge, wit and straight forward replies in the assembly, took a jibe at BJP on Saturday while moving a resolution against Citizenship (Amendment) Act. He laid emphasis on consolidating the secular structure of India.

Recalling the film Baiju Bawara’s bhajan ‘Man Tadpat Hari Darshan Ko Aaj’, Dhariwal said, “Do you remember who is the lyricist of this bhajan? Do you remember who composed the music for it and who has sung it?” Replying to own question, he said, “The lyrics were by Shakeel Badayuni, the music composition of this melodious bhajan is by Naushad and it was sung by Mohammad Rafi.” “You should remember Bade Ghulam Ali who had sung ‘Hari Om Tatsat’. How can you discriminate with these people,” he said. “So, this is the beautiful structure of this country. Where will you send talents like these?,” he asked.

While talking about Ustad Bismillah Khan the famous Shehnai player who spent most of his time in Varanasi, he said, “Once a delegation of a university from America came to book Khan saab for a music concert for the USA. He did not accept it saying he only plays on the bank of Ganga. To this the organisers said that they will create a set depicting bank of Ganga on the stage in America while he would participate there.” “To this Bismillah Khan denied to participate and said how will they bring the flow of water on the stage? This is the beauty of this country and such bills are an attempt to damage the secular structure of our country,” he said.

Commenting on the growing confusion over bringing the certificates for place of birth and others, he said, “My grandfather was on the way from Bhilwara to Kota along with my pregnant grandmother. On the way my grandmother gave birth to my father in a farm.” “Ab kahan se laon certificate,” he said while the Congress legislators applauded him for the remark.

Title: Coronavirus outbreak: 1 more with fever isolated in Kerala
Content:
A barricade set up near the isolation ward at Government Medical College, Ernakulam on Saturday.

KOCHI: One of the students, who reached Kochi from China, was admitted to Government Medical College, Ernakulam on Saturday. Authorities shifted the student to the medical college as he had fever. With this, the number of persons admitted to the isolation wards in Kochi rose to three.While two were admitted to the medical college in Ernakulam, one person was admitted to a private hospital. Officials with the health department said the condition of those kept under observation is satisfactory. Their blood samples have been sent to National Institute of Virology in Pune and officials are awaiting results of the lab tests.A total of 39 persons, including those who visited areas where Coronavirus (CoV)cases cropped up in the past 28 days, are under surveillance at their homes. Nobody was diagnosed with the symptoms of Coronavirus, said officials.Health department officials asked the public to follow the instructions given to prevent the disease. Officials with Cochin International Airport said they had screened 44 passengers who arrived from countries with Coronavirus cases and no one was reported to be ill.

Title: 17 sarpanchs, 6,953 ward panchs elected unopposed
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

Jaipur: Seventeen sarpanchs and 6,953 ward panchs were elected unopposed for the third phase of panchayat elections, scheduled to be held in the state on January 29. In the third phase, 10,865 candidates will be contesting for post of sarpanch and 28,233 for post of ward panch.

In the third phase, voting will be held in 1700 gram panchayats and 17,516 wards under 49 gram panchayats. State Election Commision (SEC) secretary Shyam Singh Rajpurohit said that 17,620 candidates had filed 17,713 nomination papers for the post of sarpanch posts and 45,754 candidates had filed 45,770 nomination papers for the post of ward panch in 17,516 wards. After scrutiny of nomination papers, 16,910 of the total nominations were found to be valid for the post of sarpanch and 6,028 candidates withdrew their nominations. For the post of ward panch, 44,620 candidates were found to be valid after scrutiny of nomination papers and 9,444 candidates withdrew their nominations.

Title: Permission granted for water distribution
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

Malappuram: Kuttippuram grama panchayat will distribute drinking water in Cherukunnu SC colony, where colony residents raised allegation that they were denied drinking water by neighbouring people.

In a special order issued on Saturday, the district collector of Malappuram Jafar Malik has granted special permission to Kuttippuram panchayat secretary for distributing water in the region using the local body’s own fund.

Earlier, a group of people of the colony had come up with a serious allegation that a neighbouring family that provided drinking water to the people of colony, stopped water supply from January 17, citing the participation of three people from the colony in a function supporting CAA. Senior BJP leaders also raised the same allegation. After the allegation kicked off controversy, revenue and panchayat officials had visited the colony and filed a detailed report on shortage of drinking water in the colony, to the district collector.

The order issued by collector says that the Jalanidhi Project is not functioning in the colony situated on the hill top and the special order is issued in the backdrop of the tension between two sections of people in the region. It also says that the ongoing Thirunnavaya drinking water project would be completed soon after receiving permission from Railway authorities to install a pipeline crossing rail tracks in Thirunnavaya region.

Title: Wedding card of Rajasthan man displays pro-CAA-NRC slogan
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

The wedding card with slogan supporting CAA and NRC

JAIPUR: While protests against the Citizenship (Amendment) Act (CAA) have intensified across the country, a family from Sikar has come up with slogans in support of the CAA and NRC, on one of their member’s marriage card.

The father of the groom, a tea vendor, has not only printed slogans supporting the Act on the wedding card of his son, but has also urged people to vote for the BJP and Narendra Modi as a gift to his son and daughter-in-law, whose wedding is to be solemnized on February 9. The family has also invited Prime Minister Modi and home minister Amit Shah for the wedding.

Amit Khandelwal (27), who has done his master’s in commerce and is presently running an e-mitra kiosk in Sikar, while talking to TOI on Saturday said, “Due to lack of knowledge, people are protesting against the CAA and NRC everywhere. They are only protesting against the possibilities. Our family supports the CAA and NRC, thus I planned to get a card published with these slogans. It will inspire more people.”

The family has also put a photo of the Prime Minister on the wedding card. “Some people are misleading the country and are indulging in violent protests. I urge people to maintain peace and harmony,” he added.

Khandelwal is the eldest son of Mohan Lal Khandelwal, who runs a tea stall and a flour mill in Sikar town. “Rather than creating confusion, people should appreciate what Modiji and Amit Shahji are doing for the country. I hope our small act will inspire many,” said Mohan Lal.

The family has also sent the wedding invitation card to the PM and the home minister. “We had sent it by registered post and have also received the acknowledgement confirming the receipt of these cards,” said Mohan Lal. The family has so far distributed 700 wedding invitation cards with the slogan, “We support NRC & CAA” and with the Swachh Bharat Abhiyan logo.

Title: Delhi elections: BJP’s four-time MLA Harsharan Singh Balli switches to AAP
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

BJP leader Harsharan Singh Balli (L) joins AAP in the presence of Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal (C) and deputy CM M... Read More

NEW DELHI: Four-time MLA and former Bharatiya Janata Party functionary Harsharan Singh Balli joined Aam Aadmi Party on Saturday. AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal welcomed him to the party along with former BJP councillor from Subhash Nagar constituency, Mukta Nagpal.

Balli has served as a minister in the previous Madan Lal Khurana-led Delhi government.

Complete coverage on delhi elections

Balli lauded the efforts of the AAP government in the field of education, health and other areas. “I appreciate Kejriwal for serving Delhi as his motherland. I am happy to join hands with a person who is working hard to transform the capital into the number one city in the country and in the world,” he said. Balli joined AAP with a group of his supporters during a press conference at AAP headquarters.

Balli came into mainstream politics in 1977, when Delhi Assembly had not come into existence. He is known to have a hold in Hari Nagar assembly constituency, which he first won in 1993 and then represented in back-to-back four terms till 2008. In 2013 when AAP emerged, Bali was pushed to the third position with AAP’s Jagdeep Singh winning the seat.

AAP has dropped its sitting MLA Jagdeep Singh and fielded former councillor Rajkumari Dhillon against BJP’s Tajinder Pal Singh Bagga and Congress’s Surinder Setia.

Title: ‘Cloud kitchens’ turning out to be silver linings for these homemakers
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

Nagpur: Who doesn’t love the traditional authentic meals? Even though there are plenty of mobile apps, restaurants and hotels across the city that are ready to dish out hotel-esque food, there is something about traditional home-made food that triggers an unmatched craving.

To fulfil such cravings, city’s homemakers have donned the hat of chefs and are catering to foodies across the city.

Gone are the days when the finger-licking taste of dishes like dal baati or maccher jhol were restricted to the walls of the kitchen. Such traditional dishes are now just a click away, thanks to the homemakers who are now showcasing their expertise from their ‘cloud kitchens’ and selling the dishes on an online website called ‘Native chefs’.

‘Native chefs’ is providing a unique platform to these housewives who were always passionate to cook tasty food but never got a chance to showcase their expertees in front of the world. TOI had reported in 2018 how the start-up being steered by Leena Dixit is giving wings to homemakers. Two years later, the success stories continue to roll out of the kitchens.

For the foodies, there is a potpourri of dishes to choose from — right from Hyderabadi biryani to spicy Nagpur-style Saoji, from Bengali maccher jhol to Maharashtrian kalari patodi. The chefs go through well-defined selection process to ensure only the best authentic meal arrive at your doorstep.

One of the chefs, Sunita Prakash, used to dish out delicious litti chokas only for her family. After joining Native Chefs, she is catering to people across the city. “I am a passionate cook. People in Nagpur now recognize me as someone who specializes in cooking delicious Bihari meal. I have an identity of my own,” she says.

More than 60 chefs are working from their homes and over 150 dishes are exhibited on the online website. Rohini Deshkar specializes in plating what she calls ‘a piece of Maharashtra’. Her saoji and sambar wadi are two of the most popular dishes on the website. “I love to cook and feed people. Those who order food are getting to enjoy masala bhat, sev ki sabji, patodi and much more from my kitchen,” she says.

A Punjabi chef, Kareena Khurana’s butter chicken and Punjabi-style soya chap are a hit. “Native chef gave me a perfect opportunity to roll out Punjabi dishes from my kitchen to other people’s dining table. It also acts as a source of income but the satisfaction of feeding people is immeasurable,” Kareena says.

It’s not just the spicy, masala meals that are on offer at the website. Jennifer Estiberio, a Goan chef, is satisfying the sweet craving by baking tempting cakes. “I get multiple orders in a day and feedbacks from my clients are my true rewards. I make teatime cakes and fudgy chocolate balls that are always in demand,” Jennifer says.

Home-cooked fish by Moushmi Shome is getting many thumbs-up as well. “I cook every meal with atmost love. For us (housewives), it’s an opportunity to bond over food and traditions,” says Shome.

Leena Dixit, founder of Native Chef, says, “I presented this idea of start-up in IIM Bangalore and out of 100, nine got selected and mine was one of them. I started Native Chef in August 2018 and the journey has been amazing so far.”

Title: Five killed in road accident near Kodai Road in Dindigul
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

The accident occurred near a bridge on Kodai Road after the driver of one of the car hit a cyclist, lost contr... Read More

MADURAI: Five people including three members of the same family were killed in a road accident near Kodai Road in Dindigul district on Saturday. The accident occurred near the bridge on Kodai Road after the driver of one of the car involved in the accident hit a cyclist, lost control and collided head-on with another car.

The car driven by Pragadish was proceeding from Madurai to Dindigul. His relative Periyammal, 70, was travelling with him. He hit Krishnan, 70, from Moovathampatti , who was riding a bicycle, following which he lost control and jumped the centre median and collided head-on with a car proceeding to Madurai.

In the second car, driven by Vellaiappan, 58, were his wife Vasantha, 42, and relatives Selvam Maidan, 45, Jayakani, 80, and Jeyanthalmani, 40. Periyammal, Vellaiappan, Selvam Maidan, and Jayakani were killed on the spot. Krishnan died at the Dindigul government hospital.

Pragadish, Jeyanthilalmani and Vasantha have been admitted to the hospital with serious injuries. Ammaiyanaickanur police rushed to the spot and cleared the wreckage with the help of a crane. While the operations were under way, the chain of the crane snapped and fell on Perumal, driver of a highway patrol vehicle, who was injured and admitted to the hospital.

Title: BJP’s four-time MLA Harsharan Singh Balli switches to AAP
Content:
BJP leader Harsharan Singh Balli (L) joins AAP in the presence of Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal (C) and deputy CM M... Read More

NEW DELHI: Four-time MLA and former Bharatiya Janata Party functionary Harsharan Singh Balli joined Aam Aadmi Party on Saturday. AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal welcomed him to the party along with former BJP councillor from Subhash Nagar constituency, Mukta Nagpal.Balli has served as a minister in the previous Madan Lal Khurana-led Delhi government.Balli lauded the efforts of the AAP government in the field of education, health and other areas. “I appreciate Kejriwal for serving Delhi as his motherland. I am happy to join hands with a person who is working hard to transform the capital into the number one city in the country and in the world,” he said. Balli joined AAP with a group of his supporters during a press conference at AAP headquarters.Balli came into mainstream politics in 1977, when Delhi Assembly had not come into existence. He is known to have a hold in Hari Nagar assembly constituency, which he first won in 1993 and then represented in back-to-back four terms till 2008. In 2013 when AAP emerged, Bali was pushed to the third position with AAP’s Jagdeep Singh winning the seat.AAP has dropped its sitting MLA Jagdeep Singh and fielded former councillor Rajkumari Dhillon against BJP’s Tajinder Pal Singh Bagga and Congress’s Surinder Setia.

Title: Finally, road work begins at AIIMS site
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

Madurai: Fencing and road works have begun at the site selected for the All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS) in Madurai nearly a year after Prime Minister Narendra Modi laid the foundation stone for the Rs 1,264 crore hospital.

An area of 201.75 acres has been allocated for the construction of the premier hospital-cum-research institute in Madurai. Even after completion of formalities for the land acquisition, work remained dormant and no construction was initiated at the site since the stone-laying on January 27, 2019.

The hospital is located off the Bangalore-Kanyakumari national highway. Sources said that the works to be carried out initially will include those of roads, which are important for transporting construction material. Till now, it had a narrow stretch of road. This is being converted into a two-lane road from the highway for 6 kilometres till Karadikkal beyond the AIIMS site. On the other side, the second road from Koothiargundu junction to the AIIMS hospital site is being laid as a four-lane structure for 3.5 kms. The works are being carried out from the central government’s road fund to the tune of Rs 21 crore.

As of now, the work on the construction wall and precast concrete fencing is being carried out by NHAI. The pillars are erected and the precast wall structures are slipped into them and plastered with concrete. These walls are easier and faster to install and can be removed and replaced as the structure expands, they said. The compound wall would be installed for a length of 5.5 km around the site, said sources. A loan from the Japan International Cooperation Agency (JICA) is awaited to start the works on the hospital building. Only basic groundwork has been initiated now, said sources.

Title: Delhi assembly polls: Notice to BJP’s Hari Nagar candidate Tajinder Pal Singh Bagga over rap song
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

BJP's Hari Nagar candidate Tajinder Singh Bagga. (ANI photo)

NEW DELHI: The Election Commission has served a notice to BJP’s Hari Nagar candidate, Tajinder Pal Singh Bagga, over a video song, seeking to know why its expenditure should not be added to his poll expenses. The rap song ‘Bagga Bagga Har Jagah’ was released on social media by Bagga soon after the saffron party announced his candidature.

The notice was issued on Friday by returning office of Hari Nagar constituency, Dharmendra Kumar, on the basis of an email from the Media Certification and Monitoring Committee (MCMC) of West Delhi. “The committee had sent an email raising suspicion of paid news against Bagga for uploading campaign video on social media without the approval of the MCMC,” sources said.

Complete coverage on Delhi elections

In the notice, Bagga was asked why the expenditure on the song should not be computed as per standard rate and added to his poll expenses. The BJP candidate was asked to reply within 48 hours, failing which the “decision of the MCMC will be final,” the notice stated.

The video song, which projects Bagga as a strong nationalist voice, has gone viral on social media. “I was not a candidate when I released it. It is not an election campaign song. I did not use any funds for the promotion of the song, which was released by my personal account. My lawyer will give a reply to the notice,” Bagga said, adding that he respects the EC notice.

Bagga further said that the song does not mention about Hari Nagar constituency and also does not seek votes for BJP.

Title: CS foundation results: Five Vadodara students in top 25
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

VADODARA: Five students from the city featured in top 25 by bagging All India Ranks (AIRs) in the exams of the company secretaries (CS) foundation programme of the Institute of Company Secretaries of India (ICSI).

The computer-based examination of CS foundation was held in December, results of which were declared on Saturday.

Ruchi Agrawal, who topped the city’s list who placed in AIR 2 with 90% marks in CS foundation. A first year student of bachelors of commerce (B Com) from M S University’s faculty of commerce, Ruchi is now preparing to clear both her bachelors and two other levels of CS – executive and professional.

“I am planning to pursue MBA in marketing after CS,” said Ruchi, who lost her mother Neelam due to kidney failure last year. Daughter of businessman Rakesh Agrawal , Ruchi received support of her father and other members of her joint family in pursuing her studies.

Another first year BCom student, Abbas Sabuwala ranked AIR 8 with 87% marks. Abbas, whose father Aliasgar owns an electric shop while mother Munira is a homemaker, wants to pursue LLB after finishing his CS and BCom studies. “I believe I can be good in pursuing law,” said Abbas.

Masoom Soni, who bagged AIR 11 with 85.50% is also a first year BCom student. Daughter of businessman Jayendra and homemaker Pallavi will decide her future choice of career after completing her CS and BCom studies.

Like others Masoodrana Khan too is pursuing his BCom and CS studies. But Masoodrana, who bagged AIR 17 with 82.50% marks, also helps his father Abdul Ajad in catering and food delivery business.

“Once I am financially stable, I also want to pursue chartered accountancy. I have to work hard to ensure a bright future for my family,” said Masoodrana, who wants to turn into an entrepreneur.

Shikha Shah, who bagged AIR 23 with 79.50% marks, wants to finish CS and also pursue bachelor in law after completing her BCom studies. “It is all because of hard work and dedication and support of my parents and teachers,” said Shikha, whose father Chirag works with an MNC while mother Sejal is a homemaker. A total of 87 students from Vadodara centre cleared their CS foundation program on Saturday.

Title: Fire destroys old building at Kanyakumari med college
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

Madurai: Scores of patients, attendants, doctors and other hospital staff at the Kanyakumari Government Medical College and Hospital at Asaripallam in Nagercoil had tense moments on Saturday when a fire broke out in a building where scrap and packing materials were stored. The incident took place around 8.30 am in an old tiled roof structure about 300 feet from the labour ward and the outpatient buildings.

Preliminary inquiry by the fire and rescue services personnel and the hospital authorities has led to the suspicion that it could have spread to the building from dry grass and bushes around it when someone carelessly disposed a match stick after lighting a cigarette or a cigarette butt. Fire and smoke engulfed the place in no time.

A team of 10 fire and rescue services personnel from the Nagercoil fire station rushed to the spot with two fire tenders and fought the flames from 9 am to 12 noon to put off the flames. Station fire officer M Thurai who led the operation said that they used five loads of water to put out the fire and that the building was razed to the ground using an earthmover as the already old structure was weakened by the fire.

The nearly 2,000 sq.ft building is a British structure that has not been frequently used by hospital staff and not at all used by patients. It existed from the time when a tuberculosis hospital was established on the premises before the medical college and hospital was set up. It was used to store scrap and packing materials such as cardboard boxes and plastic cans, which fuelled the fire. Hospital dean R Suganthy told TOI that the scrap stored is annually auctioned by the pharmacy unit, which is independent from the hospital administration, during February and March. The dean said that the building that was damaged by the fire is among the more than 10 such old and unused structures on the premises. Suganthy added that more than 60% of the 110-acre premises is covered by a thick cover of shrubs and has a forest like feel. She said that they were clearing the bushes manually from time to time but they need help from the PWD to clear the major portion.

Title: MERS: Saudi health ministry bans sale of fresh camel milk
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

Jeddah: Saudi ministry and municipality has banned the sale of fresh milk with immediate effect after a MERS (Middle East Respiratory Syndrome) case was reported from Abha town in Aseer province. Two nurses, one of whom is a Malayali afflicted with MERS, are undergoing treatment at the general hospital.

Health department officials of the municipality started inspecting sales points in north and south districts along the border and shut 15 camel barns in Al-Masrah district and confiscated the milk stocked there. Municipal officials also sanitized the locality. Engineer Saeed Jarulla, chief of the ministry of environment said sale of fresh camel milk is banned.

Dr Aboobacker Kadavathur from the Malayali-dominated Sharafiya district said in 2012 the first victim of MERS was a Saudi man and the disease was transmitted from his pet camel. He said that pasteurized camel milk is available in supermarkets and that it was better to avoid fresh camel milk. tnn

Title: Leaflets against CAA, NRC distributed in city
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

Allahabad: Volunteers of Nagrik Manch, Allahabad, on Saturday distributed leaflets in Chowk and adjoining areas of the city and campaigned against implementation of amended citizenship law and proposed NPR and NRC.

“We have formed groups of 8-10 volunteers who are distributing leaflets in various parts of the city. We will cover all parts of the district to inform people on intention of the central government behind implementation of CAA,” OD Singh, an official bearer of Nagrik Manch said.

The leaflet questions the communal plank of CAA and purpose of a new population list (NPR) even as Aadhaar data, voter list and old NPR details are available. The leaflet claims that the exercise will create hundreds of doubtful citizens.

Title: Couple to walk, pedal 1,000 km to spread Gandhian ideology
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

Madurai: Madurai couple M Karuppaiah, 49, and his wife K Chitra, 51, is all set to begin a 1,000 km walking-cum-cycling yatra to spread Gandhian ideologies on the 70th Republic Day from Erode to Hyderabad. The couple who claim to have completed nearly 86,000 km across the country for this cause in 30 expeditions said that the one on January 26 which will be the last in this fashion.

Following the demise of their spouses, the duo got married in a modern swayamvaram held in Tirupur in 2000. They started walking and cycling together in 2001, covering 1,600 km from Madurai to Chennai. “Our longest expedition was 11,500 km across India from Virudhunagar in 270 days in 2003,” Karuppaiah said.

During their Madurai to Attari Waha border expedition in March 2010, they were resting below a tree at Vasanthapura near Ludhiana when a car went berserk and knocked down Chitra. “I suffered multiple fractures and was hospitalized, bedridden, for four months. Upset over the incident my son died. I was unable to walk for two more months. But we were determined to spread the message and resumed walking six months later,” she recalled. The couple said that a few years ago they covered 80 to 100 km a day by cycle but ageing has reduced it to 50 to 70 km a day by cycle or not more than 30 km on foot. Staying at public places, they set off with Gandhian caps and wearing hand-woven clothes around 7 to 8 am. Spreading the message on Gandhian ideologies on national integration, religious harmony, total prohibition, terror-free India and women empowerment and on new education policy and linking of rivers they halt at sunset. While Karuppaiah can converse in Tamil, Hindi and English, Chitra is fluent in Telugu, Kannada and Malayalam, making it easy for the couple to share the message pan India. They also carry pamphlets and small banners.

Back home at Andipatti Bungalow village near Usilampatti where they spend close to half a year – apart from their yatra – they run a petty shop and also sell textiles and cottage industry items door to door for a living. On Sunday they will set off from the Gandhi temple at Senthampalayam in Erode district and complete their yatra at the Hyderabad Gandhi Bhavan on March 12 – the 90th anniversary of the Salt Satyagraha. After this yatra, they plan to continue spreading the message on a moped for the rest of their lives. “Our mission is to complete at least 1 lakh km,” they concluded.

Title: Delhi assembly polls: Notice to BJP’s Hari Nagar candidate Tajinder Pal Singh Bagga over rap song
Content:
BJP's Hari Nagar candidate Tajinder Singh Bagga. (ANI photo)

NEW DELHI: The Election Commission has served a notice to BJP ’s Hari Nagar candidate, Tajinder Pal Singh Bagga, over a video song, seeking to know why its expenditure should not be added to his poll expenses. Title: Mob catch hold of robber, thrashes him
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

Nagpur: A group of people on Friday evening caught hold of a miscreant who was on the run after snatching a mobile phone of a teenager at Dahibazaar overbridge. The group also thrashed the miscreant before handing him over to Shanti Nagar police.

The accused, identified as Abhishek alias Ankit Tiwari, 23, is a resident of Kanhan. He has been booked for attempt to commit robbery. It is learnt that Tiwari also has an offence registered against him at Kanhan police station.

According to police, Ayushi Pachkavde, 19, is a student of a college in Shanti Nagar area. On Friday, she was going to her home along with her friend on an e-rickshaw. They stopped on the Dahibazaar overbridge to buy papaya. In the mean time, the police said, Ayushi received her mother’s call on her cell phone.

When she was speaking to her mother, Tiwari came and snatched the phone worth Rs9,000. Ayushi raised the alarm following which people caught hold of Tiwari.

Tiwari will be produced before a court on Saturday.

Title: 12 suspended for ‘lifting lid off’ NU paper leak
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

Nagpur: In a bizarre case, a prominent engineering college on Wardha Road had allegedly suspended around 12 first-semester students who complained to their principal that the engineering chemistry paper was leaked 15 days prior to the Nagpur University (NU) exam for the subject. They were reinstated a couple of days back.

The question paper, which is common for all first-semester engineering branches in NU, was allegedly leaked on the pretext of revision and class test.

Though authorities from St Vincent Palloti College are tight-lipped about the entire episode, sources said that the suspension seems to be a result of students confronting the college “for not sharing the paper with them”.

As per their complaint lodged with the principal, the students said they got “low marks” while those from the section in which the paper was leaked have comfortably passed with ‘good marks’ after declaration of NU results.

Both the internal and university question papers are word for word same. TOI has in its possession copies of the papers. TOI posed several queries to the authorities but they remained unanswered till going to the press.

St Vincent Palloti College principal Surendra Gole and vice-principal Rajendra Gowardhan didn’t answer to TOI’s calls and messages. Vice-chancellor SP Kane and director of examinations and evaluation Prafulla Sabale too didn’t answer TOI’s calls and messages.

This is the second such case where the university paper was allegedly leaked days in advance on the pretext of class test and revision.

The model question paper of Kamla Nehru College of Pharmacy at Butibori, given on December 6, 2019, and the NU paper held on December 24, were same. So far, the university is yet to take any action in this case.

In the Palloti case, the internal paper carries detailed solutions for all questions. It was first leaked on November 22, 2019, and later circulated on class WhatsApp group a day before the NU exam on December 7. The students lodged the complaint on December 30 and they were suspended around January 12.

In their complaint, the students said they were shocked to see striking similarities in the university question paper and the model paper given to them some days before the exam. A day before the paper, the same model question paper was circulated on WhatsApp group. Some students had saved the model paper prepared in handwriting of the class counsellor.

The same evening the aggrieved students had complained about the incident through the suggestion box of the college but no action was initiated.

After all their papers were over, the students mailed the question papers demanding strict action against the counsellor. The administration identified the students and suspended them, a move the students claimed was aimed at “silencing them”.

What happened

Nov 22 | St Vincent Palloti College of Engineering first-semester counsellor gives hand-written model question paper to students of her class for revision

Dec 21 | The same model paper with complete solutions is circulated on class WhatsApp group

Dec 22 | NU engineering chemistry exam is held. Other students find the model paper and university paper word for word same

Dec 22 | Students submit complaint with proof in suggestion box to principal

Dec 30 | They mail the complaint to principal

Jan 12 | Around 12 students suspended on a different pretext. They were those who complained

Title: ‘Plans afoot to develop villages along Ganga’
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

Allahabad: State minister for jal shakti and flood control Mahendra Singh on Saturday said the government was planning to develop villages on the banks of Ganga so that people may get enough space for playing and offering prayers andaarti.

Reviewing preparations for Ganga Yatra programme at Reserve Police Lines on Saturday, Singh said: “Rivers have always given life to human beings and civilizations thrived along rivers. We are planning overall development of villages on the banks of Ganga for which Ganga maidan, Ganga park and Gangachabootra (platform) will be arranged to provide space for puja and aarti.”

Title: Vadodara: Class X girl raped while returning from farm
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

Representative image

Title: Students in Wuhan seek Centre’s help to return home
Content:
Image used for representational purpose only

KOCHI: Following reports about the US and French governments planning to evacuate their diplomats, employees and citizens from novel Coronavirus-affected Wuhan, Indian students trapped at College of Medicine Wuhan University , China demand that the Union government make similar moves to help them return to home at the earliest.The students said that French consulate has started arranging bus rides for its citizens to leave the locked-down city, and the US is arranging flights to carry its citizens to their homeland. Many students at Wuhan University have left the city using these facilities and Indian students have sought authorities help to arrange private vehicles to help them reach nearest airports.“The Government of India can negotiate with the Chinese authorities to arrange flights to take us back home. If countries like the US and France have ordered evacuation, it shows the bleak picture. We are facing food shortage too as most shops are shut and our food provisions are running low,” said Faizal Naser , a final year medical student. He said that he speaks on behalf of fellow Indian students who are desperate to leave Wuhan.The students also expressed concern about misleading reports coming from Kerala that authorities were not keen about bring them home as it could lead to the spreading of virus. However, on cross verification, it was found that such reports were false.Meanwhile, it is learnt that around more than 25 Keralite students from Wuhan University have managed to leave the city and are expected to reach Kerala over the next days. Manasa Manoj and Athul Raj , both final year medical students at China Three Gorges University in Yichang, near Wuhan, landed in Kochi airport on Saturday night. They had undergone health screening at Kunming airport and Kolkata airport. “We were a group of 17 students who took a flight to Kolkata from Kunming airport, which is more than 1,300km from our university located in the landlocked Hubei province. At the airport, they checked our body temperature, and only those who indicated temperature variations were detained. We were screened at Kolkata too. There were students from various parts of Kerala and they had taken different connection-flights available,” Manasa said.

Title: The new pop stars
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

Chennai: When regular clients visit businessman Suresh Kannan’s factory in Chennai, he usually presents them with a treat box as a token of appreciation. But of late, it’s not boxes of sweets or chocolates that he hands out but gourmet popcorn .

"You get it in assorted flavours, it’s delicious but unique," says Kannan, who picks from the Planet Popcorn array, which offers more than 20 flavours, from toffee, cappuccino and garlic butter to chilli oregano, masala masti, and lemon pataka.

From being a humble snack sold in oily little plastic covers in cinema theatre, popcorn has made its way to stores, coffee shops and online platforms. It now graces tamboolams, is gifted by corporates and picked to be party favours.

One of the brands instrumental in giving popcorn its makeover is 4700BC Popcorn. "We wanted to give popcorn a whole new image, so we traced its history. We discovered it is possibly one of the oldest snacks in the world. It is believed that ‘fossils’ of popcorn were found in the caves of Peru, which dated back to 4700BC, and that’s how we chose our brand name," says co-founder Chirag Gupta, adding that they now have seven flavours in retail, and 12 at the store level.

City-based Bharat Ramani launched Planet Popcorn in 2014 after seeing how well gourmet popcorn was doing in southeast Asia. "When I saw my kids munching on chips, I realised popcorn is a healthier snack option, full of protein, high in fibre and comparatively low in carb," says Ramani. "Since any food has to pass the taste of the tongue before it ends up in the stomach, I thought gourmet popcorn is a good option."

Today, it has a presence in eight Indian cities and can be ordered online. "Caramel popcorn is the most popular, but Indians also love spice, so flavours such as Chilli Devil are in demand," he says.

Most brands import the corn, usually from the US. And the gourmet snack, now a popular gift option for individuals as well as corporates, has its seasons as well. "It’s a great alternative to sweets during Christmas, Diwali, Rakhi and Lohri," says Diksha M Rai, co-founder and director, The Crunch Box, launched in New Delhi in 2014. "We supply to school canteens in Delhi like the British School and tie up with Book my Show cafes, and Mukta Cinemas."

Ramani says it’s popular as return gifts at birthday parties. "It’s also part of tamboolams at weddings," he says.

Popcorn and movies will always go together, and that’s why cinemas now sell popcorn as an experience. "We stock packaged as well as fresh popcorn, which sells more as customers get to choose their flavour and seasoning. It’s all customised by the customer and it adds to the level of excitement," says Swaroop Reddy, regional director (south), PVR Cinemas.

Experts feel the market will grow. "It’s similar to what happened with ice cream 20 years ago. You could buy it off the street for `5, then bigger brands, and flavours came in," says Ramani. "Popcorn is evolving in India, and people are addicted to it."

Title: ‘All abilities’ kids park to be model for other smart cities
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

Visakhapatnam: After the Greater Visakhapatnam Municipal Corporation ( GVMC ) developed its ‘park for children with all abilities’ on the Beach Road, other smart cities in the country are likely to take a leaf out of the civic body’s book, with officials of the ministry of housing and urban affairs on Saturday requesting CEOs of all 100 smart cities to construct at least one ‘all abilities park ’ in their respective cities.

The announcement was made by Rahul Kapoor, director, Smart Cities Mission on behalf of the secretary, ministry of housing and urban affairs, Durga Shanker Mishra during the wrap-up of the two-day third Apex Conference of Smart Cities in Visakhapatnam.

Mishra, after visiting the park on Friday afternoon, said that about 2.2 per cent of India’s population had some form of disability. “This park is totally dedicated to such children. The park can be accessed by all differently-abled users, including visually-impaired, hearing-impaired, physical disability , etc.” said Mishra.

Under the Smart Cities Mission, the park was retrofitted and had new play equipment installed, with play structures and seating accessible to children of all abilities in its 2,156 square metres area. Earlier, there was no dedicated play area in the park.

These issues were addressed in the retrofitting of the park by utilising available open space in an efficient manner. The GVMC spent about Rs 3.5 crore on the renovation of the park. The topography of the park was realigned for better access and aesthetics for children of all abilities. Since its opening, the park has received a positive public response and has been drawing a large crowd on a daily basis, since its inaugural in 2018.

The delegates, who attended the two-day conference, visited the park on Friday and Saturday and praised the civic body for taking up the initiative.

The delegation also visited the floating solar power project on Mudasarlova reservoir, smart schools developed under the Mission and the City Operations Centre on Saturday.

Title: NOISY NAGPUR: Pollution above safe limits everywhere in city
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

Nagpur: Noise pollution levels are breaching the permissible decibel marks all across the city, reveals the latest study by the National Environmental Engineering Research Institute (Neeri).

Around two years ago, the institute initiated the country’s first-of-its-kind noise pollution monitoring using bicycles, under the guidance of director Rakesh Kumar. The scientific report for the city shows that out of its 38 wards, 16 recorded dangerously high noise levels — each more than 30 decibels above the World Health Organization-prescribed community guidelines limit of 70 decibels.

At 105.8 decibels, ward 33 from south Nagpur was the noisiest in the city, and ward 35 in south-west Nagpur was the second loudest at 105.6 decibels. Areas on the city’s outskirts were found to be comparatively quieter thanks to plentiful vegetation cover.

The study was carried out at 700 locations in the city, including national and state highways, roads — major, minor and ring, and, industrial, commercial and residential areas. A total of 2.10 lakh readings were analysed by Neeri scientists. It revealed that noise levels all across the city exceed acceptable standards of both, WHO and the Central Pollution Control Board (CPCB).

Co-authored by Kumar, principal scientist and head of Mumbai zonal centre Ritesh Vijay and research scholars Vijaya Laxmi, Jaydip Dey and Komal Kalawapudi, the study further highlighted that the maximum levels of average noise were recorded in commercial areas of the city. “This is due to traffic congestion and honking noise at intersections,” it stated.

The minimum levels of average noise, on the other hand, were observed in industrial areas. “Most of the sampling locations were dominated by high noise levels. Only one location in the city recorded noise level below 60 decibels,” the report added.

According to scientists, noise levels have significantly increased in the city in the last 10 years. “Traffic continues to be the biggest source of noise pollution. A change in mindset of the citizens is needed. We should be better aware of traffic rules and use horns judiciously. Also, with the advent of Metro, citizens have a great opportunity to switch from private to public transport,” said Vijay.

The report also suggested mitigation measures to curb the rising noise pollution in the city. “Provision of better public transport system, creating public awareness, reducing honking, changing attitudinal behaviour of drivers, improving traffic management system, street landscaping and roadside plantation are effective ways to minimize noise pollution,” it stated.

As reported by TOI earlier, Neeri conducted the study simultaneously in 10 cities of the state. Apart from Nagpur, it has been completed in Mumbai, Navi Mumbai, Thane, Kalyan, Dombivli, Pune, Kolhapur, Aurangabad, Solapur and Nashik.

POINTER

DEADLY DECIBELS KILLING YOU

Noise pollution causes depression anxiety, heart failure, infertility, impotency. P 8

Title: Auto lifters target SUVs, steal car first for ease
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

Allahabad: Auto lifters prefer stealing SUVs, but lift cars first to facilitate the crime. The new modus operandi was revealed when a joint team of crime branch and Kydganj police nabbed a high profile auto lifter Waseer Ahmad, alias Ali Ahmad (42), a resident of Pratapgarh, with his accomplice Aditya Tripathi (50) of Mauaima near New Yamuna bridge road on Friday night. Ahmad is accused of stealing more than 100 four-wheelers, including SUVs, across the country.

“Ahmad is expertise in making master keys. He kept changing locations to dodge arrest and was running an inter-state gang in an organised way,” said crime branch officials.

Kydganj SHO Shishu Pal Sharma told TOI, “About a fortnight back, we seized five Boleros, four engines and six chassis of SUVs from a garage on Handia-Saidabad highway. Ahmad’s name cropped up during probe. He was running a gang that lifted SUVs from metro cities.”

“Our joint team was looking for Ahmad who sold stolen SUVs and cars in other states or got them dismantled,” he added. Mumbai and Delhi Police had sought information about Ahmad when his name surfaced in auto lifting cases.

“In half-a-dozen recent SUV theft cases in which we found CCTV footage, we noticed the auto lifters came in four-wheelers since cars, SUVs are generally not stopped during checking drive unless there is specific input. They did recce of posh colonies,” said officials.

They look for SUVs parked on the road and can easily carry the equipment to steal vehicles, said officials.

Title: Coronavirus outbreak: Lockdown in Wuhan University worries parents in Chennai
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

P Vishal (center) studying medicine at Wuhan University with his colleagues

CHENNAI: It’s been a week since S Palayam’s son had a full meal. P Vishal is one of the medical students from Chennai at Wuhan University, China, stuck in their hostel rooms and dormitories following the government-ordered lockdown of the city since the outbreak of coronavirus.

Many Indian students had come home for the month-long Chinese New Year holidays, but the few who stayed back – especially at Wuhan, which is the centre of the outbreak – are living in fear. The whole city has been quarantined; flights and trains remain cancelled.

Parents in India are desperate to have their wards back home, while they are still healthy. “If there’s a right time to send them back, it is now,” says Palayam, who works as an auto plant serviceman in Chennai. “We speak with our son twice a day, and as a medical student he probably knows the precautions better than we do, but we’ve still asked him to drink turmeric mixed with warm milk every day to keep infections at bay. There’s nothing more we can do now,” he says.

Back in Wuhan, one of the 13 cities in China shut down following the outbreak, Vishal and his friends have been calling the Indian embassy at Beijing at least four times a day, appealing to them to be transported to India. “As it is, we have no access to facilities here. We’re only asked to stay in our rooms, wear masks and not step out. The university has also only given us basic surgical masks. They say if any of us exhibits symptoms, they’ll look into it. But we’re trying to find a way to not fall ill in the first place,” says a student. “One of our friends had a cough a few days back, and it made us all anxious,” he adds.

Following their constant appeal, the canteen at the university has been opened once a day in the evenings, but all restaurants, shops and transport has been shut down.

An intern from Chennai (who asked not to be named) at the Jiangxi medical hospital in Nanchang, says students have been advised not to travel via Wuhan. “The challenge is that a lay person cannot differentiate between influenza, pneumonia and coronavirus, until they collapse,” he says. He, however, says that Nanchang, which has close to 100 students from Tamil Nadu, is safer. “The government has released emergency numbers that are accessible, and the hospital has provided us with masks,” he says.

P Palanivelu, vice-president of China Tamil Community in Guangzhou province that is home to about 1,000 Tamils including 400 medical students, says people are meticulously following precautions. “They wear masks when they head out and don’t consume game meat,” he said.

Coronavirus has spread to Hong Kong, as well, where most Tamil natives are employed in the IT sector. Mohamed Ismail S M K, Tamil cultural association-Hong Kong president, however, said things were normal in Hong Kong.

“People are taking all safety measures and we do not see much panic,” he said.

Title: Rajini Makkal Mandram fans club seeks police action against DK, DVK members
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

COIMBATORE: Members of Rajini Makkal Mandram on Saturday petitioned city police commissioner Sumit Sharan, seeking action against Dravidar Kazhagam (DK) and Dravidar Viduthalai Kazhagam (DVK) cadres for threatening that they would not allow actor Rajini’s films to be screened in the state.

In his petition, N Sathyamoorthy, a representative of Rajini Makkal Mandram form the city, said on January 14 the actor had spoken about a rally that was organized by social reformer Periyar E V Ramasamy in Salem in 1971.

“It had courted a controversy. Amid this, on January 22, members of the DVK and DK staged a demonstration in front of the actor’s house, saying they would not allow Rajini’s films to be screened in theatres in the state. They said they would not allow him to stay in the state. They also threatened to disrupt his film shootings. Some YouTube channels have uploaded the video of the protest,” the petition said.

Pointing out that Rajinikanth was a popular actor and that he has been doing philanthropic deeds such as helping poor students in their education and helping poor people with their medical expenses, the petitioner sought police action against the DK and DVK members . He also wanted the YouTube channel, which uploaded the video, to be brought to justice.

Title: Man gets double life term for murdering live-in partner, child in Puducherry
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

Representative image

PUDUCHERRY: Second additional district judge M Suba Anbumani on Friday sentenced a man to double life term for murdering his live-in partner and their six-month-old child in Puducherry.

The judge also sentenced Prabhakaran, 32, to 10 years in jail for kidnapping his live-in partner and their child and another seven years jail for attempting to cover up the crime by suppressing evidence of the crime. All the terms will run concurrently.

According to the prosecution, Prabhakaran, a flower merchant from Tiruvannamalai was staying in Puducherry leaving his wife and children in his hometown. He befriended an unmarried woman five years older to him in the Union territory.

Hiding his earlier marriage, he began a live-in relationship with the woman identified as K Gunavathy, a few years ago. The couple had a boy. The woman insisted that Prabhakaran marry her after the boy was born.

However, he delayed the marriage citing one reason or the other. Meanwhile, Gunavathy came to know about his first marriage and urged him to marry her immediately. She threatened that she will reveal their relationship to his wife and others, if Prabhakaran does not marry her.

Promising to marry her, Prabhakaran took her and the boy on his bike to Kiliyanur in Villupuram district on November 25, 2017. Reaching a secluded spot, he strangulated both Gunavathy and the child to death. He threw the bodies into the Sitheri dam and returned to Puducherry.

Police registered a case following a missing woman complaint lodged by Gunavathy’s brother and began investigations. Meanwhile, the bodies of a woman and a baby were fished out from the dam by police, who identified that they were Gunavathy and her child.

On interrogation, Prabhakaran confessed to murdering Gunavathy and the boy. Pronouncing the judgment, the judge also slapped a fine of Rs 4,000 on Prabhakaran. Public prosecutor N K Perumal appeared on behalf of the government.

Title: MIA bomb scare: Police retrieve box from bank locker
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

Udupi: The Mangaluru city police brought MIA bomb scare case accused Aditya Rao,36, to Udupi on Saturday. Aditya Rao was arrested on charges for planting a bag containing explosive material near the ticketing counter of Mangaluru International Airport (MIA) on January 20.

A team led by ACP (North) Belliappa K U visited several places across the city, including Karnataka Bank, Kunjibettu branch. Aditya reportedly hired a safe deposit locker at the bank. Sources said that since he did not have the key, the police were forced to break open the locker. The locker contained a few documents and a box. The box has been sent to the Forensic Science Laboratory for examination. It is suspected that cyanide is stored in the box, stated an official investigating the case.

There have been reports of a family member mentioning that Aditya wanted to commit suicide by consuming cyanide.

Threat call to airport made from Malpe

Police sources informed that after placing the explosive-laden bag near the MIA ticketing counter, Aditya travelled to Malpe.

He made a hoax call to the terminal manager that the Indigo Mangaluru-Bengaluru flight had a bomb in it. He is said to have confessed to the crime. The police are searching for the sim card that he had disposed of.

He reportedly told the police that he made a call while sitting on a bench near an eatery. The shop is located a few kilometres away from the Malpe police station.

After making the hoax call, he threw the sim away and headed towards Bengaluru. The police have searched the area, and in particular around the eatery, for the sim card. Since the shop opens only after 6pm, Aditya who arrived in the afternoon, sat on the bench alone and made the hoax call. Sources stated that he used to work as a cook at a house near the Malpe Vadabhandeshwara Temple, and hence is familiar with the area.

The police then took him to the Malpe police station. He was then taken to a hotel in Karkala in connection with the investigation.

After surrendering before the police in Bengaluru on January 22, he was put in 10-day police custody.

Title: ‘Pay allowance to suspended road workers’
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

Coimbatore: Members of the Tamil Nadu Highways Road Workers’ Association staged a protest in front of the state highways office on Trichy Road on Saturday, seeking livelihood allowance and other benefits that had been suspended for those who had participated in Jacto-Geo protests last year.

General secretary of the association A Amsaraj said the state highways department had not given livelihood allowance for around 30 workers from Coimbatore, Gobichettipalayam and Pollachi, who had participated in the protests.

“These workers were suspended and disciplinary action was taken against them under Rule 17(b). However, under the rule, the workers should have been given half of their salary as livelihood allowance for the period that they were suspended. But they were not given,” he said.

Besides, five workers from the Nilgiris were not given increments and other benefits for a long time now, he said. These workers were field staff, who were involved in maintenance of roads laid by the state highways. He also alleged irregularities in preparing seniority lists and giving other benefits.

When contacted, superintending engineer of state highways, Coimbatore, S Suresh said the workers would be given livelihood allowances and they had discussed it with the superiors. On the issue of five workers from the Nilgiris not being given increment, he said they had joined service by showing fake certificates. “But instead of suspending them, the court, on humanitarian grounds, had ruled that they should not be given increment for five years,” he said. tnn

Title: Rajasthan becomes third state to pass resolution against CAA
Content:
Ashok Gehlot

JAIPUR: Rajasthan Assembly on Saturday passed a resolution urging the Centre to repeal the Citizenship (Amendment) Act amid opposition by the BJP which accused the ruling Congress of pursuing appeasement politics.It is the third state to pass a resolution against CAA state after Punjab and Kerala. Chief minister Ashok Gehlot said, “We have urged the central govt to repeal the law as it discriminates people on religious grounds, which violates the provisions of our Constitution. This is the first time in the history of the nation that a law has been enacted which discriminates people on religious grounds. It violates secular principles of our Constitution and also Article 14 of our Constitution.”“A number of states have been opposing NRC and CAA keeping in mind public opinion at large. It is the duty of the Centre to keep the federal structure intact n strong. I urge the NDA govt to come forward and withdraw the Act. Govt should not make it a prestige issue,” he tweeted. The resolution, which was passed by voice vote, also asked the Centre to withdraw the new questionnaire for preparation of the National Population Register (NPR), 2020 as people would face inconvenience with the proposed additional information.“The preamble of the Constitution clearly states that India is a secular country. It is a basic feature of the Constitution that cannot be changed. However, the CAA, which has been enacted by Parliament, is aimed at distinguishing illegal migrants on the basis of religion. Such discrimination of people on the grounds of the religion is not in consonance with the secular ideas enshrined in the Constitution and is a clear violation of Article 14,” the resolution stated.The resolution has incorporated objections against NPR and NRC and has urged the Centre to start the Census work only after withdrawal of new fields of information that has been sought for updating the NPR.“CAA is clearly violating the provisions of the Constitution. Therefore, the House resolves to urge upon the government of India to repeal the CAA to avoid any discrimination on the basis of religion in granting citizenship and to ensure equality for all religious groups of India,” said Shanti Dhariwal, parliamentary affairs minister, while moving the resolution.Dhariwal also replied to the allegations of BJP legislators who accused the Congress-led government of appeasement by objecting to the CAA. “My grandmother was travelling to Kota from Bhilwara when she gave birth to my father in a field after experiencing labour pain. So, where should I get the birth certificate of my father?” he questioned.Earlier, participating in the debate, state BJP president Satish Poonia said, “CAA to aapke fufaaji ko bhi laago karna padega (Even your uncle will have to implement CAA).”Responding to it, Dhariwal said, “Humne rajtantra bhi dekha, loktantra bhi dekha, ab sanghtanra dekh rahey hain.”Leader of Opposition Gulab Chand Kataria also questioned the right to challenge the Act in the assembly. “Granting citizenship is a matter under the Centre and in such a situation do we have the right to challenge the CAA. The Congress should stop doing appeasement and vote bank politics,” said Kataria, leader of opposition.

Title: I am praying for VK Sasikala’s early release, says minister KT Rajenthra Bhalaji
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

MADURAI: Minister for milk and dairy development K T Rajenthra Bhalaji on Saturday said that V K Sasikala’s term in prison is disturbing and he was praying for her early release.

The minister visited the Andal temple in Srivilliputtur and later the mutt head, Sadagopa Ramanuja Jeeyar along with his party members on Saturday.

Later speaking to reporters outside the temple, he said he had come to the temple to pray for Sasikala’s release. “The fact that she is in prison is disturbing and I want her to come out soon,” Bhalaji said.

He also said that he discussed the retrieval of lands belonging to the Srivilliputtur temple and that steps were being taken to free them of encroachments.

On being asked about actor Rajanikanth’s anti-Periyar speech, he said that he found nothing wrong in it, and that the actor had only spoken about something that had been reported. It is for the people to take it or leave it, the minister said. When asked about the sudden arrest of former AIADMK MP K C Palanisamy, the minister said that he did not have any information about it.

Title: Scrap godown gutted in Halol, nobody hurt
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

The fire broke out on Saturday night

VADODARA: A major fire broke out at a scrap godown near Halol on the Pavagadh Road on Saturday night. The fire had not been doused till late in the night on the day.

The fire was reported at around 9.30pm at the godown that collected scrap from various industrial units in and around Halol. The scrap included cardboard boxes and plastic and metal barrels used to store various liquids.

Six fire tenders from Halol, Kalol and others rushed to the spot to bring the blaze under control. The reason for the fire is not known yet. Police officials rushed to the spot on being informed about the incident. Sources said that initial information did not reveal the presence of anyone in the godown when the incident took place.

Since the material stored in the godown was inflammable in nature, the fire spread in it in no time. Firemen too had a difficult task on hand to control the fire. With smoke spreading in the surrounding area, several residents and rushed to the spot to ascertain what had happened.

Title: Eight devotees injured as temple buses collide
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

Representative image

COIMBATORE: At least eight devotees were injured after two minibuses belonging to Marudhamalai Subramaniyaswami temple collided with each other near Idumban Sannathi on ghat road on Saturday morning.

According to police, the incident took place when the bus drove by R Gurumurthy, 32, of Rajivgandhi Nagar at Vadvalli, was heading to the foothills of Marudhamalai with more than 20 passengers on board.

Meanwhile, another minibus was heading to the temple and G Manikandan, 27, of Vadavalli , was at the wheel.

“When the buses reached near Idumban Sannathi on the ghat road, they collided with each other. Windshield of the buses were damaged completely. While eight devotees sustained minor injuries, six of them told the temple administrative officials that they didn’t require treatment. However, the remaining two - G Madhumitha, 9, from Vellalore, and 19-year-old J Madhana, of Sivakasi - were taken to the primary health centre at Kalveerampalayam , where they were treated as outpatients,” a police officer said.

When alerted, the Vadvalli police reached the spot and held an inquiry.

Title: Karnataka: Man bludgeoned to death by drunk acquaintances at Kuvettu
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

Representative image

MANGALURU: A man was murdered by two of his acquaintances at Kuvettu village in Belthangady taluk, late on Friday evening. The Dakshina Kannada district police have arrested the two accused in this connection, hours after the incident.

Police said that victim Narayana ,45, a resident of Kaniyur , who was working as a truck driver, was murdered by Annu,24, a resident of Ashwath Nagar, Belthangady, and Siraj,25, a resident of Uppala in Kasaragod district, Kerala.

The incident took place around 9.30pm on Friday, when Narayana was walking home near Pottukere in Kuvettu village. Annu and Siraj, who were drunk, picked up a fight with the victim over past issues, which resulted in the murder of Narayana. They hit him on his head with an iron rod, which killed him instantly.

The accused were produced before a court on Saturday. A case has been registered at the Belthangady police station in this regard.

Title: Tamil Nadu: Metro paints Nandanam station red, brands sit up
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

Painting metro stations with vivid colours has earned CMRL a revenue source, with firms coming forward for col... Read More

CHENNAI: With its bright red painted walls, Nandanam metro station has added colour to the junction. Soon, a few other metro stations too will sport a new look with different colours and popular brands prefixing their names as Chennai Metro Rail Limited (CMRL) has started giving out contracts for branding stations to raise additional revenue.

Nearly two months ago, motorists crossing the bustling Nandanam junction would have noticed the walls of the entrances and the ancillary building of Nandanam metro station sporting bright red paint. Officials said contracts were awarded and now The Muthoot Group’s name has been added to the name of the station. “Soon, Teynampet and Thousand Lights will have names of brands,” an official said.

After Nandanam metro station caught the attention of the Chennaiites, officials said many firms have already approached them to affix brand names in the upcoming phase-2 stations. Metrorail officials said they have awarded contracts for renaming and branding of Teynampet and Nandanam metro to Vas Media and Thousand Lights metro station to Spencer Plaza.

“Other firms and brands are showing interest in our phase-2 stations. A private hospital wants to affix its name to the Alwarpet station after it begins operation,” an official said.

While many more stations would soon be renamed with well-known brands, for CMRL, this exercise is one of the avenues to generate non-fare revenue. Space inside and outside stations are also being rented out for setting up retail outlets and restaurants of well-known brands as well as ATMs. Efforts are also under way to award contracts for advertising inside the stations.

“Maximising options to generate non-fare revenue helps in keeping the ticket fares low and operating efficiently,” an official said.

The outer walls of a few metro trains too are covered with stickers of colourful advertisements while the inside walls have slots for brand promotions. Earlier, CMRL floated tenders to sell advertisement space on the pillars of the elevated corridors where brands can install boards with colourful lights. But so far, there seem to be no takers.

While low patronage is cited as one of the reasons for the poor use of ad space in stations and trains, with the opening of another 9km line in North Chennai, CMRL officials said their patronage may go up by 30% which will, in turn, attract more firms and bring additional revenue.

Title: Grade-II computer teachers in government schools to get promotion
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

Representative image

COIMBATORE: The state is all set to promote computer instructors in government higher secondary schools with eight years of service to Grade-I from Grade-II.

According to a communication from the directorate of school education, only those computer instructors who have completed postgraduation and BEd would be eligible for promotions. They should also have eight years of experience in government higher secondary schools.

These are the minimum qualifications as per the National Council for Teacher Education (NCTE) norms. The promotions would be effected from a pay scale of Rs 9,300-Rs 34,800 to Rs 36,900 to Rs 1,16,600, the communication said.

Computer instructors said this was their long-pending demand. M Kalaivanan, a computer instructor, said around 1,600 of them were recruited in 2008. “But we were posted as “instructors” and it was not clear whether we were posted in the cadre of graduate teachers or postgraduate teachers.”

After several representations, the government said their posts were Grade-II. It also declared vacant posts as Grade-I. “Later, the state said it would recruit fresh cadres to the 814 vacant Grade-1 posts. But we said we had been working since 2008 and we should be given promotions. So, now the state has called for our details for promotion,” Kalaivanan said.

Title: SSI murder accused enact crime in Kanyakumari
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

Representative image

MADURAI: Abdul Shameem and Thoufiq, who are accused of murdering special sub-inspector of police Y Wilson, 57, were taken to the Kaliyakkavilai Market Road check post in Kanyakumari district , the crime scene, on Saturday to narrate and enact the murder . The accused showed the officials how they fired a few rounds at the SSI and also stabbed him multiple times when he was alone on duty at the small check post in the late hours of January 8.

Investigation officer K P Ganesan, deputy superintendent of police, Kanyakumari district, crime branch, told reporters that during investigation they came to know that Thoufiq who is trained in using guns fired at Wilson, while Shameem stabbed the victim. Escorted by nearly 50 police personnel, the accused showed the police how they reached the spot, committed the crime and escaped.

The DSP said that on the day, the duo escaped through the back gate of a mosque close to the check post and reached the other road through the front gate. They walked for close to 500 meters as they could not get a lift from motorists, despite seeking lifts from a few people. They crossed the inter-state border and entered Kerala, where they got an autorickshaw to flee.

Sameem and Thoufiq, who were on the run, were arrested by Karnataka police at Udupi railway station on January 14 and brought to Kanyakumari on January 16. They were produced before the Kuzhithurai judicial magistrate and lodged in jail in judicial custody. On Tuesday, the principal district judge of Kanyakumari granted police 10 days’ custody of the duo.

Police recovered the pistol used for the murder from a drainage gutter near Ernakulam bus terminus on Thursday and the knife from Thiruvananthapuram bus terminal on Friday. The police have the custody of the duo for further questioning till 4 pm on Friday (January 31).

Title: Officials exchange notes on Mission
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

Visakhapatnam: At a presentattion on the second day of the third Apex Conference of Smart Cities, Rahul Kapoor, director of the Smart Cities Mission drew parallels between the 1975 film Sholay and the Smart Cities Mission, pointing out that the scheme needs to be as much of a blockbuster as the film was.

The presentation was laced with dialogues from the film, such as “arre o Samba, kitne aadmi the?”, “bhaag Danno, bhaag” and “ab tera kya hoga re?”

Charulata Somal, managing director of Karnataka Urban Infrastructure Development & Finance Corporation spoke on the implementation of the Mission across seven smart cities in Karnataka. Somal also spoke on the smart city review and implementation committee, review mechanism, online project monitoring tools and social integration.

Thiru R Murugan, DGM, programme management unit, Smart City Mission, Tamil Nadu Urban Finance and Infrastructure Development Corporation, said a total of 414 projects have been sanctioned at a cost of Rs 11,000 crore in all 11 smart cities of Tamil Nadu.

Officials from Gujarat also spoke about the progress of the Mission in the state.

In the valedictory, GVMC commissioner G Srijana said such conferences will help in exchange of knowledge and sharing ideas between officials of various smart cities. “It was an honour for the GVMC to host the conference and it was a learning experience for me and the GVMC team. Building inclusive, sustainable and resilient cities are the major theme of the Smart Cities Mission,” said Srijana.

Rahul Kapoor lauded GVMC officials for making arrangements for the conference.

Title: Coronavirus: 10-bed facility ready at GH; airlines, airport step up safety measures
Content: Chennai: As coronavirus infection continues to spread in China and cases surface in Southeast Asia and the Far East, the state government has laid out a protocol to manage patients detected with the novel strain.All passengers arriving at airports in Tamil Nadu from China and Hong Kong are being screened using thermal detectors to watch out for influenza-like symptoms in order to pick possible cases of new coronavirus identified in China. Airlines which fly to destinations where cases have been detected have told their crew to look out for passengers with symptoms of fever and report them to the authorities. If there are patients who are suspected and tested positive, they will be taken to the Rajiv Gandhi Government General Hospital in the city.The hospital has 10 isolation beds and it can be increased to any number in multiple hospitals if necessary, said Dr K Kolandaisamy, director of public health.A multidisciplinary team comprising a public health expert, clinician and microbiologist will reach Chennai to review end-to-end preparedness for management and control of the virus - thermal screening and transferring of patients to hospitals for isolation. It will also visit tertiary hospitals attached to airports for reviewing the isolation wards and availability of personal protective equipment (PPE) and masks etc.The team will review whether infection control, surveillance and other guidelines are being followed and will coordinate with the government to support and strengthen preparedness, said a statement from the Union government.Though airports at Hong Kong, Singapore, Tokyo, Kuala Lumpur and Bangkok are screening passengers, airlines are also taking steps to ensure that passengers and crew are safe. Flights from the infected destinations are being fumigated and crew has been told to watch for passengers who show signs of fever. Chennai has direct flight link to Hong Kong and Japan where cases of the virus have been detected. There are around seven flights on weekdays and nine flights on weekends between Chennai and Singapore.Singapore Airlines said, “A health advisory notice by Singapore’s Ministry of Health is being distributed to passengers.
