Title: An Ancient Stigma
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

Dr Asha and Dr Zai with a patient

Title: Delhi elections 2020: See changes in govt school, Arvind Kejriwal tells Amit Shah
Content:
Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal (L), BJP leader and Union home minister Amit Shah.

I invite Amit Shah ji to come visit any Delhi govt school with me. I will cancel all my appointments for him. Polit… https://t.co/PE09jKGDyE — Arvind Kejriwal (@ArvindKejriwal) 1579944600000

NEW DELHI: As BJP and Aam Aadmi Party continue to spar about the quality of education in Delhi, Arvind Kejriwal invited Union home minister Amit Shah on Monday to visit a Delhi government school and see for himself the transformation that has taken place in the last five years. Shah has been punching holes in AAP ’s claims of having transformed the education sector and insisting at public meetings that the condition of Delhi schools had only worsened.“We are in favour of education being an important part of the political system and people should cast their votes on the basis of whether a government has worked to improve school education infrastructure,” Kejriwal said at a press conference. “This is what will take the country forward. There should be no dirty politics around schools and education.”The AAP convenor described as false all the declarations made by Shah about Delhi’s education system and schools being faulty and urged him to keep education out of political rivalries. “Our model of education is lauded not only in the nation, but across the entire world,” Kejriwal said.The Delhi CM urged Shah to accompany him to a Delhi government school of his choice. “We have never said that everything has been done. There is still much that needs to be done. But a lot of improvements has been made in the government schools,” Kejriwal said. “We have tried to rectify in the last five years the wrongs of the last 70 years. And I credit the progress in the government schools to the efforts of 16 lakh students of these schools. I also give credit to the parents of those students for the improvements. These improvements are also a result of the efforts of 60,000-65,000 teachers and principals working in the Delhi government schools.”Kejriwal said that the Union home minister’s remarks mocked the efforts of the students and their guardians.“His statements have insulted the 16 lakh students and their parents, the 65,000 teachers. The hard work of those students, their parents and their teachers made them achieve 96% pass result in Class XII,” Kejriwal said and asked Shah “not to rebuke the students, parents and teachers for their hard work”.The AAP chief pointed out that more than 400 Delhi government school students had cleared the tough IIT entrance exam and the medical joint entrance exams. He then dared Shah to give the example of even one school in a BJP-served state where a similar improvement had been recorded.“I would like you to improve the schools in Uttar Pradesh and Haryana, or even the municipal schools in Delhi, and then talk about the lack in our model of education and how your schools are better than ours. That would be positive politics,” Kejriwal said.

Title: Can news coverage tick to heartbeats of poetry?
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

BENGALURU: No, you can neither mix nor match news and poetry . Or, can you? Strange as the hypothesis might sound, it was part of the question a nerdy teenager asked at the Times literature festival a couple of years ago. Do reporters show a poet’s emotional response in situations? Do poets feel compelled to react to breaking news? Does the language in one form inspire or influence the other?

Establishing a connection between poetry and news seemed absurd to the couple of authors around then, but I found out a year later that there was ample reason for suspending the scepticism. Practitioners of both forms of writing had considered the idea. In 2009, the Israeli newspaper, Haaretz, commissioned 31 authors and poets to cover the day’s news and ended up offering an astonishingly unique fare. Except for a couple of sections, the entire newspaper consisted of articles and – er, poems – by these writers. Hebrew poet Roni Somek presented the weather report in a sonnet with the lines: “Summer is the pencil/ that is least sharp/ in the seasons’ pencil case.” Children’s book author Avri Herling described a sedate day on the stock exchange as: “Everything’s okay. Everything’s like usual. Yesterday trading ended. Everything’s okay. The economists went to their homes, the laundry is drying on the lines, dinners are waiting in place…” He didn’t miss mentioning the day’s closing figures on the Dow Jones and Nasdaq, though. There were a few literary gems too, among them novelist David Grossman (Booker-winner for “A Horse Walks Into A Bar”) who spent a night in a children’s drug rehab centre.

In 2010, the University of Oregon brought together poet laureate Paulann Petersen and Pulitzer-winning journalist and poet Don Colbum to discuss various aspects of poetry and journalism and whether the twain can meet. It included a reference to the famous lines of William Carlos Williams in “Asphodel, That Greeny Flower”: “It is difficult/ to get the news from poems/ yet men die miserably every day/ for lack/ of what is found there.”

Paulann traced the essential difference between the two, pointing out that journalism is news for a majority and poetry is news by epiphany. On the face of it, a poem and a news report are different: if one records a soft whisper, the other captures pandemonium in parliament; if for one a blooming flower is momentous, for the other, only a typhoon can be eventful; one uplifts the mood with a lover’s silent smile and the other celebrates with a thousand fist-pumps. Agreed a poem comes to live with us in our private space, persuading us to look at the world through our little window. And that it uses the evocative power of metaphors, similes and hyperbole to stir our thoughts and feelings. On the contrary, news brings the “here and now” to our doorstep, employing a set structure and familiar expressions. Often, clichés are the pizza boys of news delivery.

Poems as we know rely on creative tropes. And because the scope of expression in a poem is so vast, poets can go so far to vehemently disagree with others on what constitutes an impactful line. Dom Moraes, then only 16, wrote a letter to the TOI in 1954, in reaction to a comment on the most beautiful line ever written. What does the adjective imply, he asks. If it meant “the architectonics of verse, then the loveliest line ever written is to be found somewhere in the collected works of Alexander Pope, Edith Sitwell and Wallace Stevens, which I do not believe in the least…” He concludes, saying “there is no universal rule applicable to the appreciation of poetry and the question should not be discussed as if there were”. Dom was among the few poets Coleridge and Walt Whitman who engaged in active journalism. His despatches from conflict zones, his interviews and biographies bear testimony to sparkling prose that took birth in a poetic mind.

In an email interview with me after he won the Pulitzer for poetry in 2014, Bengaluru-born Vijay Seshadri said he was fascinated by the historical narrative and the emotional depths that poetry could explore. His “The Disappearances”, which deals with an undisclosed catastrophe, was published after the 9/11 attack on the World Trade Centre. Although it wasn’t specifically written to memorialize or recall the tragedy, readers then connected it with the feeling of loss.

Journalism works to the ticks of the clock, poetry chimes to the beats of the heart. A poem nudges a person’s deepest thoughts, making us observe life, things and ideas in a different light. If some news reports absorbed the soul of poetry, they could be richer. Be it about the hustle and bustle of everyday life or earth-shaking events, that approach could help shape our consciousness.

— Jayanth Kodkani

Title: Goa: Padma Bhushan for Manohar Parrikar, Pramod Sawant says tribute to a visionary
Content:
Manohar Parrikar

Thank You Prime Minister @narendramodi ji and HM @AmitShah ji for bestowing Padma Bhushan award in recognition of m… https://t.co/IYDmvrP41X — उत्पल Parrikar (@uparrikar) 1579972381000

PANAJI: The central government on Saturday announced a posthumous Padma Bhushan to former chief minister Manohar Parrikar for public affairs. Parrikar was four-time chief minister of the state and former defence minister.Chief minister Pramod Sawant said that he was delighted that Parrikar has been given Padma Bhushan award posthumously. “A tribute to the great visionary leader of the masses,” he said.Parrikar passed away on March 17, last year, after an almost year-long battle with cancer. Introduced into BJP by former Goa RSS chief Subhash Velingkar in the late eighties, Parrikar was hesitant at the start.He turned out to be a top political strategist, representing the Panaji constituency uninterrupted from 1994 till his death.Briefly, when he resigned to become the defence minister, he got his aide elected as the MLA and won when he returned to the state in 2017. Parrikar formed the first BJP government in the state in 2000.At a time when BJP had just 10 MLAs, he stitched together a coalition, and two years later, formed the government again with just 13 MLAs in a House of 40.In 2012, following five years of Congress governance, Parrikar won a majority on his own for the first time with 21 MLAs. How a swayamsewak rose to such great heights in Goa with a significant minority population would have surprised many. Parrikar, after all, was the one who led around 700 kar sevaks from Goa during the Ram Janmabhoomi movement.A non-conventional politician, his style of governance projected simplicity and middle-class values. He became chief minister at the age of 43 in 2000, and came up with schemes — computers for students, direct money transfer to beneficiaries, old age pension and health insurance — which were later introduced by the Modi government at the Centre.“Manohar bhai was a colossal leader, who worked tirelessly for the people till his last breath. His contributions to the state and country have touched upon every strata of society and through his vision, he was instrumental in making people’s lives better. He was a people’s man,” said BJP state president Sadanand Tanavade.Reacting to the announcement, Parrikar's son Utpal tweeted, "Thank You Prime Minister @narendramodi ji and HM @AmitShah ji for bestowing Padma Bhushan award in recognition of my father @manoharparrikar‘s contribution towards public service and whatever small part he played towards nation building.”“This will be inspirational to every Goan, including myself, that although we come from a very small state like Goa we can contribute immensely towards nation!,” Utpal said.The Centre also announced president’s police medal for gallantry to deputy superintendent of police Sammy Tavares and president police medal for meritorious service to police sub-inspector Dattaram Raut.Fire officer Dnyaneshwar Sawant has been awarded president's medal for meritorious service.John Aguiar, company commander of Home Guards, Panaji division, has been awarded the President's home guard and civil defence medal for distinguished services and Raulu Gawas section leader home guard and Santan Francis Dias, home guard volunteer have been awarded home guards and civil defence medal for meritorious service.

Title: Congress slams govt for LDC test today
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

Panaji: Congress on Saturday condemned the state government’s decision to conduct written test for recruitment of lower division clerks for the directorate of women & child development on Republic Day . Almost 8,000 candidates are scheduled to appear for the written test from 9.30am to 5pm on Sunday . This exposes BJP’s scant respect and lack of reverence for the memorable day, a Congress statement reads.

“The government has displayed once again its disrespect to this historic day where the sacred document of the ‘Constitution’ was instituted by the Union of India,” Congress’ media convener Trajano D'Mello said.

Title: Chennai: Man kills sister for hiding booze
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

Representative image

CHENNAI: A 50-year-old Sri Lankan Tamil murdered his sister suspecting that she concealed a liquor bottle, at Valasaravakkam on Friday night. Police said Guhadasan attacked his mother and nephew too when they tried to prevent him from attacking his sister. They arrested Guhadasan. A police officer said Guhadasan was under the influence of alcohol. The deceased R Tharageshwari, a widow from Sri Lanka, was staying at a rented house in Velan Nagar with her mother S Vedanayaki, 81, and son R Athishan, said police.

Police said Guhadasan came to the city from Sri Lanka 10 days ago to visit Sabarimala. After returning, he consumed liquor and got into an argument with Tharageshwari after she allegedly hid a liquor bottle. He stabbed her multiple times with a kitchen knife. Athishan, who tried to rescue her, also received knife wounds on his chest. Vedanayaki suffered a hip fracture as Guhadasan pushed her during the fight. Neighbours rushed Tharageshwari to hospital, but she was declared brought dead.

Title: Chased by crowd, dispersing tiger attacks three in forest near Maharashtra-MP border
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

A crowd gathers as the tiger was spotted on the highway

NAGPUR: Fear gripped over a dozen villages in Tumsar range of Bhandara forest division after a tiger attacked three persons on the Maharashtra-Madhya Pradesh border around noon on Saturday.

One of the victims had a lucky escape in Binaki village after the tiger had a him in a tight grip. But a big crowd, which had gathered at the spot, pelted stones and managed to drive the tiger away. Not many forest and police officials were present to control the restive crowd.

The injured persons have been identified as Shankar Turkar (40) from Pandharwani in MP, Chhotelal Thakre (35), a resident of Gondekhari (Bhandara), and Virendra Sahare (45) from Sindpuri (Tumsar). Videos of the tiger crossing a road, striding across farms and attacking a man was widely circulated on the social media.

All were admitted to a primary health centre at Sihora from where they were shifted to Bhandara district hospital. On January 18, one more person named Ganesh Bankar from Gondekhari was injured by the tiger.

After this incident, forest officials burst crackers to push the tiger towards the forest. The aerial distance between the two spots where the attacks took place is 6km.

According to Sawan Bahekar, president of Gondia’s NGO Sustaining Environment and Wildlife Assemblage (SEWA), the chased tiger is a young dispersing male from Khairlanji range in MP.

“The unfortunate incident is a fallout of lack of strong monitoring and coordination between Maharashtra and MP forest officials,” alleged Bahekar.

In a late night press release, Bhandara deputy conservator of forest (DyCF) Vivek Hoshing said efforts are on to capture the tiger. “For the past eight days, it is moving in cluster of forest and farms connecting Binaki, Sukli, Gondekhari, Sihora and Chulhad villages. The spot where it attacked a villager last Saturday is 5km from today’s incident,” he said.

After the tiger was sighted on Saturday noon, a crowd started gathering to scare it away. Though forest and police officials swung into action, they failed to control the mob which had a free run. “After allowing the situation to go out of hand, forest officials want to capture the innocent animal. This is unacceptable. There is no record of cattle or human kill against this tiger. The latest attacks were due to poor mob mentality,” added Bahekar.

SEWA volunteers are monitoring two tigers since January 7. These tigers are suspected to have entered Tumsar and Tiroda forest ranges from neighbouring MP. One tiger quietly moved towards Nagzira-Waraseoni after entering Tiroda and Gondia range. The one involved in the attack came into limelight on Saturday.

Title: India, Brazil sign 15 pacts to bolster defence, trade ties
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

COMING CLOSER: Prime Minister Narendra Modi with Brazil’s President Jair Bolsonaro in New Delhi on Saturday (B... Read More

NEW DELHI: Reaffirming a strategic partnership, India and Brazil on Saturday signed 15 agreements as Prime Minister Narendra Modi held talks with Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro who will also be the chief guest at the Republic Day parade at Rajpath on Sunday.

India wants to open up its relations with Latin American countries , and Brazil could become New Delhi’s gateway to the continent.

The two sides signed a joint statement and an action plan to deepen cooperation in defence and security; trade and investment; agriculture and energy; civil aviation; energy; environment; and health and innovation. They promised to work together to conclude an agreement to deal with international terrorism. The major focus was on boosting bilateral trade and investment as both the large economies have been hit by economic slowdown.

The 15 agreements cover a wide range of areas including oil and gas, mineral resources, traditional medicine, animal husbandry, bio-energy and trade and investment.

India and Brazil drew up ambitious plan to boost their stuttering economies by expanding cooperation in oil, gas and minerals sectors, and set a target of USD 15 billion in bilateral trade by 2022. “Your visit to India has opened a new chapter in ties between India and Brazil,” Modi said. Tweeting later, Modi said, “Apart from bilateral cooperation, India and Brazil are working together at various multilateral forums. We see immense synergies on various issues including the need to uproot the menace of terrorism. India and Brazil will keep working together for a better planet.”

Title: Man rapes junior colleague, inserts metal into private part
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

Representative image

Title: Youth Cong members driven out from Fadnavis CAA talk venue
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

Devendra Fadnavis was delivers a talk on CAA

Nagpur: A group of 10 to 15 people, allegedly from city Youth Congress unit, on Saturday evening were stopped and evicted from the venue where leader of opposition and former chief minister Devendra Fadnavis was delivering a talk on ‘Citizenship Amendment Act ( CAA )’.

The talk organized under the Late Manoramabai Mundle Lecture Series by Dharampeth Education Society at Dharampeth Kanya School Ground on North Ambazari Road, witnessed attendance of mainly right-wing activists, citizens and RSS ideologue MG Vaidya.

The Youth Congress activists alleged that around 30 to 40 Bharatiya Janat Yuva Morcha (BJYM) activists didn’t allow them to enter the venue though they had only come to listen to the ex-CM.

BJYM activists, led by city president Shivani Dani, said they had no objection to anyone attending the event but suspected the Youth Congress activists from South-West constituency would disrupt Fadnavis’s lecture.

“They were about to raise slogans. We told them to do it outside,” Dani told TOI.

Around six youths were rounded up and taken to Bajaj Nagar police station where cops recorded their names and addresses before releasing them. They were detained after they accused the organizers and cops of not letting them listen to the talk and started raising ‘Youth Congress Zindabad’ slogans.

In the speech, which went for over an hour, the MLA from South-West Constituency accused the mainstream political parties of spreading canards and attempting to create anarchy in the country. “India is marching towards $5 trillion economy under Modiji but these parties want to stall the progress. This will only benefit the enemies of India,” said Fadnavis.

The former CM reiterated the Sangh Parivar’s rhetoric on CAA and National Register of Citizens (NRC).

Fadnavis said while the CAA was meant to give citizenship and not take it away from anyone, there was no plan to implement NRC across the country by the Modi government. “Some parties are instilling fears in the minds of minorities, especially Muslims, that they would be sent to Pakistan or thrown out of the country. False news and social media propaganda are running. Every day a new list of documents are circulated asking Muslims and others to search them. This is not true. Not every social media post is genuine,” he said, referring to the one where a purport ‘New Constitution Draft’ allegedly by RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat went viral.

At the same time, Fadnavis said there are two sets of people who need to be differentiated while considering for citizenship. “One is those who came here after being persecuted while the other came in search of employment but indulged in unlawful activities. There is talk of giving citizenship to not just Hindus from Pakistan, Bangladesh and Afghanistan but also the second lot which has been found indulging in terrorism actives,” he said.

Title: Kerala opposition launches bid to oust governor
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

Governor Arif Mohammed Khan said those seeking his removal had the right to do so, but for that they should ap... Read More

KOCHI/ THIRUVANANTHAPURAM : The opposition Congress-led United Democratic Front (UDF) in Kerala on Saturday sought the assembly speaker’s permission to introduce a resolution urging the President to recall governor Arif Mohammed Khan.

Confirming this, Leader of Opposition Ramesh Chennithala told reporters in Kochi that the demand for recall was necessitated because of the governor’s continued objection to the resolution passed by the assembly against the controversial citizenship act , which is tantamount to insulting the assembly and rejecting the sentiments of the people.

“The governor raising objections to the resolution passed by the assembly is a serious insult to the assembly… If the governor has any objection to the resolution, he should intimate the speaker in writing. His questioning the actions taken by the assembly and defying it is not acceptable,” he said.

Reacting to the development, governor Khan told reporters in Thiruvananthapuram that those seeking his removal should approach the President not the assembly speaker. “They have the right to seek my removal. But for that, they should approach the President who appointed me… It’s wrong to claim that the governor is in confrontation with the government. It’s not so. I’m only discharging my duties,” he said.

“I'm fully aware that I have to discharge my duties with the aid and advise of council of ministers. They are an elected body. I have full respect for them. But then the institution of governor is there to keep an eye on the government that they transact the business of the government in accordance with rule, law and constitution. I am the constitutional head of the government. We are not separate. This is my government. I can’t have a conflict with myself,” he said.

The governor also said that if “they (state government) hide something from me, as they did in the case of going to the Supreme Court against CAA, that is not lawful”.

It is the first time in the history of the Kerala assembly that a resolution demanding recall of the governor has been mooted.

Title: 139 trees likely to be cut for Smart City Project roads
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

Nagpur: Smart City Project special purpose vehicle Nagpur Smart and Sustainable City Development Corporation Limited (NSSCDCL) has sought permission to cut down 139 trees for construction of five roads in Smart City Project area.

The Nagpur Municipal Corporation (NMC) tree officer has issued a public notice on Friday inviting suggestions and objections on NSSCDCL application even though trees cannot be cut and need to be transplanted for road works as per The Maharashtra (Urban Areas) Preservation of Trees Act, 1975.

As per the notice, 68 trees will be cut down for road proposed from Saduru Factory, Navin Nagar to Bhavani Hospital in Pardi, 33 trees for road from entrance gate of Shree Bhavani Mata Mandir, Punapur to Bharatwada road, 29 trees for Bhandara national highway to Punapur road, 6 trees for Bharatwada road to Navkanya Nagar and 3 trees for road going toward Navkanya Nagar.

The NMC is constructing 52km long roads in Smart City Project area covering Pardi, Punapur, Bharatwada and Bhandewadi in East Nagpur. The roads are being constructed under tenderSURE concept in which NSSCDCL will construct roads along with all types of amenities like street light, storm water drain, sewage network, footpath, road-divider, duct for laying cables, cycling track etc at the cost of around Rs650 crore.

NSSCDCL had appointed Mumbai-based Shapoorji Pallonji Group for execution of the works. The firm has already started works. TNN

Title: Three booked for rape
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

Representative image

Title: 1 killed, 4 injured in car accident
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

Nagpur: A car turned turtle after hitting a tree near Ambazari garden, shortly after Friday midnight, resulting in the death of a man. Four others, including 3 women, sustained injuries.

Police said Prashant Tekade, a businessman, was driving the vehicle. He was declared brought dead at the Government Medical College and Hospital. The injured were identified as Amol Ghadge, his wife Trupti, sister Apurba and Arundhati Wahadkar.

Police said that Tekade and the others were returning to their Dhantoli home after dinner in Kondhali. “Tekade lost control of the car after which it turned turtle and rammed into a roadside tree,” the cops said.

The cops, who were in the vicinity, alerted the control room and also helped the passengers who had to be pulled out of the car. They were rushed for medical assistance. Ambazari police have registered a case of accidental death.

Title: Leopard found ‘dumped’ in lake
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

Nagpur: The carcass of a leopard was found in Nand lake in Amgaon (Butibori) under mysterious circumstances on Saturday at 7.15pm by foresters. “It might have been dumped there, possibly after being electrocuted,” sources told TOI. The carcass has been shifted to Butibori range office and a post-mortem will be conducted on Sunday morning. “Only then the exact cause of death will be ascertained,” said honorary district wildlife warden Kundan Hate.

Title: Assam to put language clause in govt job offers
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

Assam CM Sarbananda Sonowal (File Photo)

GUWAHATI: The Sarbananda Sonowal-led NDA government is set to make the ability to speak and write in Assamese mandatory for people seeking state government jobs .

“The ability to speak Assamese is not enough. If one does not know how to write in Assamese, one will not be able to apply for a state government job. We will bring a law in this regard within this year. The move is aimed at protecting the Assamese language ,” state finance minister Himanta Biswa Sarma said here on Saturday.

“An Assamese who does not know how to write in his language will not get (a government) job. My son studies outside the state and he can speak in Assamese but he can’t write in Assamese. This means, he will not be eligible to get a job here,” he added.

In next month’s assembly session, the state government will introduce two bills — one prohibiting the indigenous people from transferring their land rights to non-indigenous people, and the other making the teaching of Assamese compulsory in schools up to Class X.

Read this story in Bengali

Title: 10,000 more PG medical seats likely this year
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

File image used for representation.

NEW DELHI: There may be a significant addition of 10,000 new postgraduate medical seats from the new academic session this year that will help improve availability of specialists across the country as well as facilitate the district residency programme, which entails at least three months of rural posting .

The Board of Governors - vested with powers of the MCI - has approved the proposal to increase PG seats after states raised concerns about the residency programme, saying hospitals attached to medical colleges will suffer if these students are sent to district hospitals, a senior official said. The service at district hospitals is mandatory for every PG student.

The BoG, headed by Niti Aayog member VK Paul, has given the go-ahead to district residency programme, another senior official, who is member of BoG, told TOI . At present, there are over 23,000 PG and 68,500 undergraduate medical seats in both government and private colleges across the country.

The district residency programme has been in the works, but the BoG approval will facilitate the increase in seats in the 2020-21 session itself. As per health ministry data, India faces a shortfall of around 82% specialists.

Title: 10 from Mumbai among 35 hurt in mishap on Goa highway
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

The ST bus veered off the highway

NAVI MUMBAI: At least 35 persons, including 10 from Mumbai and two from Thane, were injured when an ST bus overturned and fell into a ditch on the Mumbai-Goa highway following brake failure, ahead of Godh bridge at Kalamaje village, in Mangaon , Raigad , around 5am on Saturday. Four of them were seriously injured. The bus was plying from Parel to Dapoli in Ratnagiri with 45 on board.

"The driver, Devendra Yelve (33), told us that brake failure lead to the mishap. The bus veered off the approach road of the bridge. The injured were taken to hospital," said Mangaon inspector Ramdas Ingvale.

Mangaon sub-district hospital medical superintendent Dr G K Desai said, "Mumbai resident Swati Mane (46), wife of a JJ Hospital staffer, with a pelvic fracture, had been shifted to JJ Hospital, Mumbai, for further treatment."

Constable Anil Vadate said the bus broke the safety barrier and veered off the highway.

Title: Central Railway to train 15 personnel for its own flood rescue team
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

300 personnel rescued people when Kolhapur-bound Mahalaxmi Express was stranded on flooded tracks between Badl... Read More

MUMBAI: Central Railway will soon have a Flood Rescue Team (FRT), as it has short-listed 15 personnel for the team, including 5 women, to be trained by the National Disaster Relief Force ( NDRF ) to help handle emergencies, such as passengers who are stranded inside a train on water-logged tracks.

The team will begin training soon, and will be deployed during the monsoon months. The personnel on the team will perform their usual duties during the rest of the year.

CR chief spokesperson Shivaji Sutar said, "During the Mahalaxmi express incident of July 28, which was stuck for almost 5 hours at Badlapur, we realized more needs to be done to ensure faster relief and rescue operations before the NDRF teams arrive."

The trained team will be pressed into service as soon a train is stranded. "The training will help sharpen their skills, and more importantly, they will learn how to evacuate stranded passengers to safety. The team can also be deployed to help our staffers whose homes in railway colonies get flooded," Sutar added.

Apart from the trained team, railways is also going to procure inflatable boats to help rescue passengers and ensure quicker delivery of relief material.

Title: 11-year-olds from Mira Road stage kidnapping after teacher pulls them up
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

Representative image

MUMBAI: Two classmates, aged 11, from Mira Road staged their kidnapping and subsequent escape from their abductors on Wednesday, after being reprimanded by their teacher for not doing their homework.

The girls, students of class IV at an English medium school in Mira Road, travelled ticketless to Virar in their uniform.

Their 'abduction' came to light when one of the girls called her father on his mobile, using a juice vendor's phone in Virar. She told her father that she and her friend had been kidnapped by a 'burqa-clad woman in car' and taken to Virar at knife-point. She said that at a traffic signal, they managed to bite the woman's hand, get out of the car, and get lost in the crowd to hoodwink the abductors.

The girls' parents rushed to Virar, took custody of the girls, and filed a kidnapping case with the police. The case was then transferred to the Naya Nagar police station . Inspector Kailash Barve said that they examined CCTV footage in the locality of where the girls claimed the abduction took place. He said they found no evidence of the girls' story.

On further questioning, the girls admitted to being pulled up by their teacher. They said the teacher had asked them to bring their parents to school. Afraid of the scolding their parents would give them, they staged the kidnapping. The girls said they did it based on crime serials on TV. Police said the girls were counselled before being sent home.

Title: Checks on at cop armouries in Jhargram, W Midnapore
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

Midnapore/Jhargram: Inspection of arms stocked in police station armouries has started across Jhargram and West Midnapore days after 18 single-barrel guns went missing from the Lalgarh PS armoury. The arms belonged to people with valid licences.

Two cops, including SI Tarapada Tudu, and two of their local accomplices were arrested after the matter came to light. Tudu, who was in charge of the Lalgarh PS armoury, had handed over responsibilities to Biswajit Panja on January 16. After Tudu took up his new posting at Jamboni PS, Panja reported to the Lalgarh IC that 18 guns were missing. Jhargram SP Amitkumar Bharat Rathod said these had not been recovered yet.

The inspections that followed are being led by inspectors or DSPs but are yet to uncover any more discrepancies. Inspectors-in-charge or officers-in-charge of police stations are keeping track of findings by these teams.

West Midnapore SP Dinesh Kumar said: “These inspections are conducted routinely to look for discrepancies in arms stored in police station armouries.”

Title: Padma honours for Ajoy Chakraborty, Manilal Nag
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

Kolkata: Nine years after being awarded a Padma Shri in 2011, veteran vocalist Pt Ajoy Chakraborty has been conferred the Padma Bhushan.

A torchbearer of the Patiala gharana, 68-year-old Chakraborty told TOI he is “happy” with the news and wants to continue doing more work to propagate Indian classical music.

“I am happy and feel this is a result of the blessings of my guru, Pt Gnan Prakash Ghosh. I hope I can carry on with the work that I want to do,” he said.

Explaining this “work”, he referred to this passion of grooming youngsters. “Nowadays, my performances have become very secondary for me. I want to groom more students. My daughter, Kaushiki, has become famous all over the world. I would have been happier if she had more competition. I want 10 more Kaushikis to come up. I come across many with a lot of potential. If their parents are sorted, I think they have it in them to go far. It requires talent, fire in the belly and good support from the guardians for them to go far.”

Asked what needs to be done on behalf of the government to promote Indian classical music, he said: “There should be more people in positions of power who love Indian classical music. The media, too, has to do its bit.”

Pt Manilal Nag was conferred the Padma Shri. The 81-year-old sitarist said: “It is a milestone for the Bishnupur gharana. This award is a recognition of the 400-year-old classical and dhrupad tradition of Bengal that dominated the country’s music scenario in the first half of the last century. I have disciples all over the world. I love to share my joy with all of them while my family feels proud that a long-awaited reward is finally here.”

Sushovan Banerjee, known as ‘ek takar doctor’, also received the Padma Shri. The 81-year-old has been treating patients for a Re 1 fee since 1964 in his Bolpur clinic Nevedita Seva Sadan.

Banerjee, who graduated from RG Kar Medical College, completed a PG degree in pathology from Calcutta University with a gold medal before heading to London for a diploma in haematology.

“I had been working as a senior register in a London for four years before I decided to come back to my country to serve the poor. I got a call from the home ministry on Friday night that I had been chosen for Padma Shri. I am absolutely elated at my work being recognised,” he told TOI.

Banerjee has refused lucrative offers from many organisations, choosing instead to stay in his native Bolpur to tend to the poor and tribals.

Title: CalTel set to lease part of landmark headquarters to stay afloat
Content:
Telephone Bhavan

KOLKATA: Funds-starved Calcutta Telephones is set to lease out parts of Telephone Bhavan , its Dalhousie Square headquarters that happens to be one of the city’s most easily recognised addresses.The Bharat Sanchar Nigam Ltd ( BSNL ) subsidiary is also looking to rent out telephone exchanges and even sell some of its prime properties across the city, besides leasing out parts of its nine-storey headquarters, as part of a drive to monetise its assets to keep itself afloat.CalTel chief general manager Biswajit Paul said he had already received the nec-essary clearances from the centre to sell a few prime properties located at posh addresses and lease or rent out the rest to garner revenue.For Telephone Bhavan, which overlooks Lal Dighi and Writers’ Buildings in Dalhousie Square, the city’s most precious heritage district, CalTel has fixed a rent of Rs 284 per square foot. The ground-plus-eight-storey Art Deco building, with built-up space of 1.5 lakh square feet, was constructed in 1954.“We propose to rent out around 45,000 square feet or virtually the entire ground floor of Telephone Bhavan, retaining only a sales counter. We also plan to rent out 8,000 square feet in the 30,000-square-foot annexe building,” Paul said.If CalTel finds takers at the price it has quoted, it will make a neat Rs 1.5 crore in monthly rental from the two properties in Dalhousie Square. That, along with whatever else it is able to cobble together in rental income from sprawling telephone exchanges in various neighbourhoods, will come in handy in meeting its fin-ancial commitments like paying salaries.The second highest rental — of Rs 96 per square feet — has been fixed for the Salt Lake exchange located next to the Central Government Office Complex.Other high-value properties are located in Chowringhee, Alipore, Ballygunge, Kalighat and on Sarat Bose Road. “Initially, the rental period will be three years, following which terms of the contract will be reviewed for extension,” Paul said.Properties that will go under the hammer for outright sale are situated in Madhyamgram and Maniktala. The Bhubaneswar circle of BSNL has already leased out a number of properties in the Odisha capital to banks.The public sector unit, facing an acute funds crunch, has already asked 1,700 employees to opt for VRS; the staff strength now is 2,500. The VRS scheme has also helped unlock big chunks of office space. A process is underway to relocate the remaining staff so that the vacant spaces can be aggregated for renting out. “The offices are being redesigned for optimal use of work space,” the CGM said.

Title: JMB Assam module trained at Burdwan madrassa: National Investigation Agency
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

File image used for representational purpose

KOLKATA: National Investigation Agency has claimed that an Assam module of Jamaat-ul-Mujahideen Bangladesh, in operation till July 2019, had been trained at Burdwan’s Simulia madrassa , which became synonymous with the October 2014 Khagragarh blast .

Citing the high seizure of arms, NIA has also claimed the terror group — banned in Bangladesh and India — was eyeing attacks across eastern India, including Bengal. The revelations were made in a charge sheet filed in a Guwahati special court on Friday against five JMB members, who were charged under Section 25(1B) of the Arms Act and Sections 18 & 38 of UAPA.

NIA investigations revealed that all five were recruited to JMB by Barpeta resident Sahanur Alom, arrested in 2014 for involvement in the blast that killed two persons. He is serving an 8-year sentence for “conspiracy to commit terrorist acts in India and recruiting and training other members of JMB”.

“Accused persons have undergone training as JMB cadres in Barpeta at the house of Sahanur Al-om. Some accused were also trained at Simulia madrassa,” said NIA.

The charge sheet will be a precursor to one expected soon against Jahirul Sk (29), one of the 37 named by NIA as having spearheaded JMB training at Simulia. He was arrested last August from Madhya Pradesh. Sources said Jahirul, from Karimpur in Nadia, was a resident of the madrassa. He was initially a JMB driver and placed in charge of the Nano used to ferry JMB recruits.

Over time, besides arranging logistics, he became an able organizer who issued sermons and indoctrinated recruits.

“Given that more than two dozen of his cadres have been arrested in four years and that the original JMB no longer exists, Jahirul’s movements between Bengal, Assam and Madhya Pradesh are under investigation. The charge sheet is expected on similar lines,” said a source.

Title: Happy Republic Day 2020: Images, Quotes, Wishes, Messages, Cards, Greetings, Pictures, GIFs and Wallpapers
Content: The Republic Day is a national holiday of India, which is celebrated to mark the day when India officially adopted the Constitution of India. It is one of the three national holidays of India, the other two being Independence Day and Gandhi Jayanti. This national holiday honours the date 26 January 1950, when India's Constitution came into effect by replacing the Government of India Act. This day commemorates the historic moment when India became the Independent Republic after years of struggle. This year, India will celebrate its 71st Republic Day on 26 January. To celebrate the occasion, show your love for the country by sending these meaningful greetings, quotes and images to your friends and family:India has no dearth of brave young men and women and if they get the opportunity and help then we can compete with other nations in space exploration and one of them will fulfil her dreams. – Atal Behari VajpayeeAt the dawn of history, India started on her unending quest, and trackless centuries are filled with her striving and the grandeur of her success and her failures. Through good and ill fortune alike she [India] has never lost sight of that quest or forgotten the ideals which gave her strength. – Jawaharlal NehruWe are Indians, firstly and lastly. – BR AmbedkarLet new India arise out of peasants' cottage, grasping the plough, out of huts, cobbler and sweeper. – Swami VivekanandaEven if I died in the service of the nation, I would be proud of it. Every drop of my blood... will contribute to the growth of this nation and to make it strong and dynamic. – Indira GandhiHappy Republic Day 2020! Let’s recall the true heroes of India who sacrificed their lives to give us freedom.Freedom in the mind,Strength in the words,The pureness in our blood,Pride in our souls,Zeal in our hearts,Let’s salute our India on Republic Day.Happy Republic DayNever forget the hero’sWho sacrificed their livesTo bring up this glorious day to India,Happy Republic Day 2020One nation, one vision, one identity“no nation is perfect, it needs to be made perfect.”Meri pehchaan mera India.Happy Republic Day!One nation, one vision, one identity“no nation is perfect, it needs to be made perfect.”Meri pehchaan mera India.Happy Republic Day!Freedom in the mind,Strength in the words,Pureness in our blood,Pride in our souls,Zeal in our hearts,Let’s salute our India on Republic Day.Thousands of people laid down their lives… so that our country breath Today… never forget their sacrifice… Happy Republic DayAazaad bharat mein jeete hain hum,Aage badne ka khwab bhi dekhte hain hum,Bharat phir se sone ki chidiya ban jaaye,Aesi kaamna karte hain hum!Gantantra diwas ki hardik shubhkamnayein!Freedom in the mind, Strength in the words, Pureness in our blood, Pride in our souls, Zeal in our hearts, Let’s salute our India on Republic Day. Happy Republic Day 2020.May we always have the freedom to choose, freedom to live and freedom to dream…Happy Republic Day!It’s 26th January today,The historical day to remember our national heroes & freedom fighters,Who suffered to give us a republic nation.Happy 26th January, Happy Republic Day!The tricolour gives the messages of Peace Humanity & Prosperity Very Warm Wishes on this Republic Day India.On the Republic DayLet’s carry on ritually rememberingeach other and greeton occasions, on anniversaries;let’s carry on to count years,add on the numbers,for the delight of managersof our affairs;let’s hope for the magic wandto work miracles by the turnof the endless night.Never Forget The Hero’sWho Sacrificed Their LivesTo Bring Up This Glorious Day To India,Happy Republic Day.Recalling and RejoicingIn the Victory of Our Freedom Fighterson This 70th Republic DayBest Wishes to AllHappy Republic DaySaffron means courage,White represents purity,Green means growth,That’s why it is the most beautiful flag.Watan hamara misaal mohabbat ki,Todta hai deewaar nafrat ki,Meri khush naseebi mili zindagi is chaman mein.Bhula na sake koi iski khushbu saton janam mein.Happy Republic Day!

Title: Fake call centre kingpin held, hunt on for 2 others
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

The fake call centre had made Rs 70-75 lakh in about three months

Gurgaon: One of the kingpins of the fake call centre that cheated Amazon customers in the US and Mexico was arrested from Delhi on Saturday. Umesh Sharma (33) ran the call centre along with Munish and Vishal from an office in Udyog Vihar.

Sharma is originally a resident of Paschim Vihar in Delhi and had graduated in commerce. “We have been able to nab one of the kingpins behind the scam. We are currently questioning him to get more details about his two partners,” said Karan Goel, ACP, DLF.

He added that the police had retrieved some data from computers in the call centre, which has been sent to Madhuban labs near Karnal for examining. Two teams have been formed to trace the other two accused and they have been raiding locations which they suspect could be their hideouts.

The police have also questioned employees of the sham call centre to know more about how they cheated their targets. Around 30 of them had been detained on Friday, but were released after questioning. Most of the employees have claimed they were unaware of the scam and were under the impression that they were working for Amazon itself.

According to police, the fake call centre in Udyog Vihar had been operating since November last year and had made Rs 70-75 lakh during this period. The call centre, which did not have any licence or permission to operate, would send messages to targets saying their Amazon accounts had witnessed some “unusual activity” and would be blocked soon. The caller urged the gullible targets to dial a toll free number and pay $100-150 through gift cards in exchange for the solution offered. The money would be routed to India through bank accounts in Europe and China, the police said.

Of the 30 youths who were detained on Friday, 25 are boys and the remaining girls. Most of them had joined the call centre after finishing Class 12 and were paid around Rs 15,000 to Rs 2000 a month. Police said 10 of them are from the Northeast, while the remaining are from UP, Delhi and Punjab.

The script they would read out to their targets in the US and Mexico and other voice samples were sent to them by the three alleged masterminds. When the targets would dial the toll free number — 1-855-918-0438 — from any country, the call would land in the Gurgaon office and the employees would read from the script in a heavily accented voice.

Title: Businessman kills friend to fake own death, arrested
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

File image used for representation.

KOLHAPUR: A 30-year-old businessman from Maharashtra’s Satara district allegedly murdered his close friend and tried to pass off that body as his own to claim Rs 1.5 crore in life insurance , police said. The suspect, Sumit More, was arrested by Satara police from Jejuri in Pune district late on Friday night.

Police said More suffered huge financial losses in his business at Navi Mumbai and meticulously planned the murder to pay off the debts by claiming his life insurance.

Deputy superintendent of police (Satara) Suhas Garud said More has confessed to the murder and narrated the chronology of events. More killed his friend, Tanaji Baba Aawale, a tailor, because Aawale’s body structure was very like his, Garud said. On January 21, More requested the victim to accompany him to Mahimaangad, his native place. An unsuspecting Tanaji went with him

During interrogation, More admitted to hitting Tanaji on the head with a stump and later setting the car (MH 01 DB7105) alight. More waited till the car was completely burned and left the place, Garud said.

“Koregaon police found a charred body in a gutted car on January 22 on the Bodhewadi-Diska road. The car was registered in the name of Sumit More and it was easy to trace his residence,” the officer said.

“Police handed over the body, which was charred beyond recognition, to More’s family, assuming it was his because the car was registered in his name,” Garud said.

However, police kept a close watch on them and got suspicious as nobody seemed to be mourning the death while preparing for the last rites. Then More’s elder brother was questioned. Initially, he gave inconsistent information to police, but after sustained interrogation, he told them that his younger brother was hiding in Jejuri, Garud said.

A Satara court on Saturday remanded More in four-day police custody. Police said the family of the victim, Tanaj, were not aware about his death until police informed them about the same.

“More arrests are likely in the case during investigation as some of the relatives of More may be in the know about the murder plot,” police said.

Title: Gurugram: Classrooms used to store books, students made to sit out in cold
Content:
The school has 350 students and has been accommodating 150 more from the one in Om Nagar

GURUGRAM: At about 6°C, it is a chilly morning and a particularly windy one. Exactly at 8am, a bell goes off and the din slowly dies down as children settle down, jostling for the few sunny spots in the courtyard. School is in session. This has been the routine for the past 10 days — because the classes are now stopgap warehouses.The government school at Shivaji Nagar in Sector 11 has 350 students. The 13 classrooms it had were not quite enough. Sometime around July last year, it got 150 more. The school at Om Nagar was under construction and its students were moved here. Pressed for space with 500 students, the school started conducting classes in double shifts. Ten days ago, some of these few classrooms went out of bounds.The education department stocked them with books. “Textbooks which will be distributed across various districts have been stocked in three classrooms,” said principal of the school, Madhubala. The books are meant for the next academic session, which will begin in April.So the students of classes II, IV and V have been moved to the corridors and out into the open for their classes. “It gets really cold and class starts early. We wear our sweaters and jackets but it is very windy sometimes,” said a class V student. Classes continue till 12.30pm.Parents are worried. “It is disturbing that children are forced to sit outside. The education department could have stored the books at a godown instead of compromising on the health and education of children,” said Munish Kumar, a parent. “Children get sick more easily and they are the ones forced to endure this. It is heartbreaking,” said Ranjit Chaudhry, another parent.The school may have more to fix. With no cleaning staff, teachers clean the toilets. “The situation is pathetic. I clean the toilet of the primary wing because the school does not have any staff to do it. Most government schools in the district don’t,” said Om Prakash, head of the primary wing.Principal Madhubala said the children’s health is a priority for the administration. “We are taking care of the children. They are clad in winterwear,” she said, adding that the education department will “take action soon”.

Title: ICICI Bank posts highest ever quarterly profit
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

MUMBAI: ICICI Bank has reported its highest ever quarterly net profit of Rs 4,146 crore for the quarter ended December 2013, which was two-and-a-half times higher (158%) than the Rs 1,604 crore reported in the corresponding quarter last year.

The year-on-year growth in domestic advances was 16% on December 31, 2019. Advances growth was a 19% year-on-year growth in its retail loan portfolio on December 31, 2019. Total deposits increased by 18% year-on-year to Rs 7.2 lakh crore. Sandeep Batra, president, said the earnings were driven by an improvement in operating profit while the bottom-line got an additional boost through a reduction in corporate tax rate .

The bank's core operating profit (profit before provisions and tax, excluding treasury income) increased by 24% year-on-year to Rs 7,017 crore in the quarter ended December 31, 2019 (Q3-2020) from Rs 5,667 crore in the quarter ended December 31, 2018 (Q3-2019).

Although the bank managed recovery from the insolvency proceedings of Essar Steel , these were partially offset by having to provide for losses due to a default by Karvy. Another large loan, which was provided in the form of refinancing, to a south-based group, required provisioning as the refinance was classified as loan restructuring.

Title: Ahead of R-Day, Customs seizes 22 Chinese drones
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

MUMBAI: Ahead of Republic Day , Customs department searched three places in Mumbai, Jaipur and Chennai in the last few days, and seized 22 drones, imported from China, which were being sold illegally in the open market. Names of suspects have not been disclosed.

Principal commissioner customs (preventive) Reshma Lakhani told TOI they learnt about the drones being sold openly and worked on the information. "We sent personnel as customers to interact with sellers. Our deal was finalised and the drones were ready for delivery. This is when we carried out searches and seized the drones and documents," Lakhani said. During interrogation of office-bearers of Saki Naka-based Ascom Systems, Customs officials learnt about Chennai-based K J Enterprises and Godawan Media in Jaipur.

A senior officer said this was the first time that so many drones were seized simultaneously. Marine and preventive wing of Customs Preventive Commissionerate (Mumbai) booked a case of illegal import of drones on January 20. The suspects are being questioned and arrests will follow, officials said.

Title: PMO reviews steps to fight any outbreak
Content: Amid a mounting scare over the spread of coronavirus in China, the Prime Minister's Office on Saturday reviewed the preparedness and the country's preventive management system to tackle any possible outbreak here.At a high level meeting, chaired by the principal secretary to the Prime Minister, health ministry officials apprised him of the recent developments, preparedness and response measures associated with the spread of the virus.The ministry officials briefed the principal secretary on the hospital and laboratory preparedness, measures taken for capacity building of rapid response teams and the extensive surveillance activities undertaken to deal with exigencies.

Title: West Bengal: Three bodies recovered from Teesta
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

Members of the NDRF team at the spot

KALIMPONG: The National Disaster Response Force (NDRF) and Teesta Rangeet Rescue Team (TRRT), on Saturday, traced the bodies of three missing persons and the car that plunged into Teesta river from NH-10 on Friday. The driver, Devnath Tamang's body could not be found till this report went to the press.

On Friday, the rescue team had recovered the 15-year-old Sakshi Rai's body from the river. She was travelling to Birpara from Gangtok in the car with her father Chandan, mother Tulsi and brother Sangam. The four family members' bodies were sent to Kalimpong district hospital before being handed over to their kin.

Locals said the car had fallen into the river from the place near Liquvir, where the construction of parapets was left incomplete.

Title: Man murders wife 2 days after buying policy, gets life term
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

File image used for representation.

NEW DELHI: A man who had his wife murdered two days after taking a life insurance policy in her name almost 18 years ago has been awarded life imprisonment by the Supreme Court .

The man, a resident of Uttarakhand , had alleged that five men had entered his house in the intervening night of March 24 and 25, 2002 to abduct him and his wife was shot dead by them when she resisted. But he failed to mention any reason for his “attempted abduction” or name any person who tried to abduct him. He also could not provide any description of physical features of the intruders.

Holding that there was inconsistency in statements made by the accused before police and the trial court, a bench of Justices Ashok Bhushan and Navin Sinha said he failed to furnish any plausible defence and convicted him in the murder case and awarded life sentence. The court noted that the accused tried to give false evidence by first raising alleged “extramarital affairs” of his wife and later stating that five intruders had broken into his house to abduct him. The court said there was no evidence to prove that people had barged into his house as there were no footprints in the muddy courtyard.

“The appellant initially stated in the FIR that three persons entered his house at midnight to abduct him. In his evidence as defence witness, he stated that there were five persons. If the intruders had come to abduct him and his wife had been shot dead after she tried to prevent his abduction, it would have been all the more convenient for the intruders to take him away with them. No explanation has been furnished by him in this regard,” the bench said.

The bench said it was very difficult to accept his explanation that despite the presence of five people, one of whom could have easily overpowered the woman, she was shot dead.

“He has not mentioned any reason or named any on suspicion of enmity or otherwise... No details of the physical features and approximate age, height, built of the intruders have been mentioned, even if they had their faces covered, despite the fact that the spot map establishes the light of an electric bulb. The appellant initially took the defence that he suspected his wife of having an illicit relationship... intruders having entered by scaling the northern side wall built of mud and cement is belied by the spot map and evidence that no damage or marks were found on the wall,” the court said.

While upholding the trial court and HC verdicts on his conviction and life imprisonment, the apex court also took into consideration statements of his in-laws who said the accused was very greedy and had demanded money from them and had also taken an LIC policy in the name of his wife just days before the incident.

Title: West Bengal: Four hurt after clash over CAA campaign
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

Cops at the spot on Saturday

KOLKATA: At least four persons were injured in a series of clashes that broke out between alleged Trinamool and BJP supporters at Halisahar over CAA-NRC campaigns on Saturday afternoon. Sources said the trouble broke out after Bijpur's BJP MLA Subhranshu Roy launched a campaign in the Banimandir area. A huge police contingent was deployed to bring the situation under control

Roy later said, "We will carry on with the campaign in the interest of common people." Halisahar Town Trinamool leader Subodh Adhikary, said, "None of our party supporters was involved."

BJP leaders alleged that as their supporters led by Roy began a door-to-door campaign, Trinamool men attacked BJP supporters. "They also assaulted and harassed Roy when he tried to resist the TMC-backed goons from beating up his supporters. When Roy and other BJP activists went to Bijpur police station, the Trinamool men also attacked them there. But officers still didn't help Roy by providing security," said Phalguni Patra, BJP's Barrackpore unit president.

Adhikary said, "Locals protested against the campaign but came under attack by BJP men."

Title: Spain professor tips on organ donation for Kolkata doctors
Content:
Representative image

KOLKATA: Barcelona with a population of 1.6 million, which is just about one fourth of Kolkata’s 4.6 million, recorded 65 deceased organ donations in 2019. Kolkata clocked only 11 donations in the same year, just about one sixth of the figure of Barcelona. This year, organ donation in Kolkata has started on a great note with three donations in January. But there is a need for more focussed action to keep up the momentum, feel experts.“One of the most important things is to train ICU doctors who can identify the brain deaths. Keeping these intensivists at the forefront will make a lot of difference,” said Matri Manyalich of Barcelona University Hospital.Manyalich was in Kolkata as an internal expert at the recently held Kolkata Transplant Colloquium (KTC) and gave tips to doctors in the city.Kolkata in 2018 had registered 15 organ donations. But the figure came down to 11 in 2019, including two from the neighbouring districts.“In our hospital, we have a transplant procurement management team (TPM) with 10 intensivists complemented by an equal number of trained nurses. This team works works 24x7 dedicatedly on deceased organ donation and procurement. All hospitals in Spain has to have a TPM unit,” Manyalich said.A leading country when it comes to deceased organ donation, Spain recorded 2,300 donations in 2019, against 2243 in 2018. In addition to highly organised process of deceased donation, Spain has a ‘opt-out’ system in which all citizens become organ donors automatically unless they choose to opt out.“In Spain, the deceased organ donation rate is 49 per million populations. Though citizens can opt out, the refusal rate today is just about 14%. Media also played a very supportive role,” he said.The total organ donation figure for India in 2019 was only 890. Maharashtra and Tamil were Nadu major contributors.Manylaich, who is also the president of Donation & Transplantation Institute (DTI), an institute that has been training healthcare professionals worldwide including China, Croatia, Germany and UAE on organ donation, explained how such training could push organ donation in these countries. He is hopeful that his team would be working in India in the near future.“We need more deceased donations for transplant surgeries. Now that Kolkata has started witnessing such donations, we have roped in professor Matri Manyalich to get valuable inputs from him,” said Deepak Shankar Ray, chairman, organising committee of KTC. Arghya Majumdar, chairman scientific committee, and Sharmila Thukral, secretary organising committee, of KTC.

Title: Tamil Nadu: Financial tech city will come up at Kattupakkam, says Edappadi K Palaniswami
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

Edappadi K Palaniswami

CHENNAI: Chief minister Edappadi K Palaniswami on Saturday announced that the state government would set up its ambitious financial tech city on 300 acres at Kattupakkam near Chennai. He also said the state was studying options to divert water from Marakkanam in Villupuram district to meet the drinking water needs of Chennai. More than 4 tmcft of water is now getting wasted into sea at Marakkanam.

Speaking at the martyr's day event organised by the AIADMK in MMDA colony, the chief minister virtually launched the campaign for the forthcoming local body polls in Chennai. "The voters should elect the AIADMK and its allies in all 200 wards so that the government schemes will reach out to all. To support the government that takes lots of initiatives for Chennai, a mayor belonging to the AIADMK should be elected," the CM said, adding that schemes could be implemented effectively only then. He said the metro rail extension route between Washermenpet and Wimco Nagar will be launched by the middle of this year.

Taking a dig at DMK leader M K Stalin, Palaniswami said his government was not subservient to the BJP government at the Centre. "We are opposing whatever should be opposed. We support when it serves the interest of the people. Unlike you (Stalin), we don't blindly support," he said, accusing the DMK of being in power at the Centre for 13 years without bringing any schemes to the state. He said his government was firm on the two language policy. "All languages are equal here ( Tamil Nadu ). We are not against any language. We celebrate our mother tongue like it is our life. But caste, religion, ethnicity and language cannot separate us. Tamil community has such lofty principles," Palaniswami said.

Title: Chandragupta, Bindusara, Ashoka: The 3 young studs who’ll debut at Republic Day parade
Content:
The young studs, Chandragupta, Bindusara and Ashoka, during rehearsal

KOLKATA: Some new entrants to the mounted police stable, who were earlier race horses, and their riders have undergone rigorous training and the others “retraining” to ensure impeccable performance at the Republic Day parade .When the 20 single-coat horses bring out the best of the Kolkata mounted police on Red Road on Sunday, all eyes will be on Chandragupta , Bindusara and Ashoka, the youngest of the 11 studs that have joined the “veterans” in the force. These three, who have been chosen for the R-Day parade for the first time, joined 1.5 years ago and have trained for barely a year. While the three are six years old, some of the older horses are 17 years old and have decade-long experience. The young horses are initially being kept at the Alipore Bodyguard Lines, where they are receiving training for the next year before being relocated to the unit’s stables at the S N Banerjee Road address.“Three horses, who were veterans in the parades, had retired and we were looking for replacements. We chose the young ones, who matched the skills of the trained horses and can follow instructions,” said a senior officer with the mounted police. The training imparted by an international expert from Singapore was a four-day affair, where riders from the Mumbai Police, which are reintroducing mounted police, joined them with other riders from Bengal Police . “But it won’t be easy to spot them in the group. They are placed at different points on the foursquare set. One is on the second line, another on the third,” said the officer.The Mounted Police unit that patrols the 1,000-acre Maidan had last inducted a horse over a decade ago. The count had since dwindled from the sanctioned number of 98 to 67. The fresh inductions have bolstered the strength to 78.Several of the new horses are of Kathiawadi breed, named after Kathiawad in Gujarat. These sturdy horses have a track record of bravery and loyalty in battle and are known for alertness. “Features of Kathiawadi breed are similar to that of Arabian horses. They (Kathiawadi breed) have evolved by breeding indigenous stock with the Arab stallions,” said a horse breed expert. Earlier, most horses used to be bought from England or Australia. But that proved to be too expensive. To be cost effective, the force began sourcing horses from farms in Delhi, Pune, Mumbai, Haryana and Punjab.

Title: Centre set to seal deal with Bodo groups
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

GUWAHATI: The Centre is all set to sign a comprehensive peace deal with the four factions of the National Democratic Front of Boroland (NDFB) and the All Bodo Students Union on Monday.

The deal is likely to be signed in the presence Union home minister Amit Shah and Assam CM Sarbananda Sonowal , who will leave for the national capital on Sunday evening. State government sources, however, said there was no confirmation on the date so far.

Assam minister Himanta Biswa Sarma said the new peace accord would not upgrade the existing Bodoland Territorial Autonomous Council set up under the 6th Schedule of the Constitution to a separate state or Union Territory. "Neither a Union Territory will be created, nor new areas will be added to the BTAD. Assam's territorial integrity will be kept intact if a fresh accord is signed in the near future," he added.

Speculation is rife that the new accord would include new areas of the state under the Bodo council. The present Bodoland Territorial Council area comprises four districts - Kokrajhar, Chirang, Baska and Udalguri. They were created under the 2003 accord signed between the Centre, the state and the now disbanded Bodo Liberation Tigers .

"The framework of the accord is being prepared by the Centre and will bring permanent peace in Bodoland. The Centre has informed the state government that the new agreement which will not divide Assam further," Sarma said.

Title: Tamil Nadu: Police beef up security for Republic Day celebrations
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

Republic Day parade at Kamarajar Salai near Marina in Chennai (File photo)

CHENNAI: Police have tightened security almost making the city into a fortress by deploying around 15,000 police personnel ahead of the 71st Republic Day celebrations on Sunday. The city is brought under three-tier security, while about 1 lakh police personnel will be on vigil across TN.

Governor Banwarilal Purohit will be hoisting the national flag near Mahatma Gandhi Statue at Marina Beach on Sunday in the presence of chief minister Edappadi K Palaniswami and other top officials, followed by parade of uniformed forces, award ceremony and cultural events. The venue has been brought under three-tier security and the Marina Beach stretch will be monitored by drones, police said. Visitors will be allowed only after a thorough screening.

City police began security drills at least a week ago by increasing its strength at transit points such as the airport, Chennai Central, Egmore railway station and Chennai Mofussil Bus Terminus, apart from conducting surprise checks at hotels and lodges. Districts in the south have been placed on alert and additional strength has been sanctioned for areas identified as sensitive.

Title: Kolkata: Chilly spell to prevail for 2 days, says Met
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

The chill-bearing northwesterly wind and a clear sky forced the mercury to recede below the normal mark on Sat... Read More

KOLKATA: The chill-bearing northwesterly wind and a clear sky forced the mercury to recede below the normal mark on Saturday. At 12°C, the minimum temperature slipped two notches below normal from 15.1°C on Friday. The Met office said the chill will stay for two days.

"The chill will prevail on Sunday and Monday, when the minimum temperature will hover around the 12°C mark," said G K Das, director (weather), RMC, Kolkata.

A cyclonic circulation likely to develop over MP will start blocking the path of the northwesterly by Tuesday, and there will be moisture injected by a high pressure belt from Bay of Bengal. The minimum temperature could surge up to 18°C by Wednesday. "We are expecting light rain in the city and other parts of south Bengal that could start during the latter part of Tuesday. While the night temperature rises, the maximum temperature will retreat a bit during this period," added Das.

The rain could continue intermittently till Thursday.

Title: Kolkata ushers in Chinese New Year with music and dragon dance
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

Celebrations at Tiretta Bazaar

KOLKATA: The Chinese in Tangra and Tiretta Bazaar ushered in the New Year with music, dance and merriment late on Friday night with the celebrations that carried on into the wee hours of Saturday. This is the Year of the Rat.

Preparations for the New Year had began days earlier with 10 groups practising lion dance. On Friday night - the New Year's eve - the groups started from different parts of Tangra, including the Pei Mei School, dancing to the beat of drums and cymbals as they progressed through the lanes and bylanes of the Chinatown to finally converge at the marketplace. There they went around in a procession.

After the show concluded around 1pm, the groups dispersed and visited Chinese homes, burst crackers, performed the lion dance and handed out good luck red envelopes. This carried on till dawn on Saturday when the New Year's eve festivity finally drew to an end.

On Saturday, many homes had vegetarian meals. Some kept their establishments shut. The restaurants that were open shut shop early on Saturday, the New Year's day. On Sunday, the lion dance groups plan to visit Chinese families living away from the twin hubs in Tangra and Tiretta Bazaar in vans. "On Janaury 27 and 28, a carnival will be held at Pei Mei School grounds with games, lottery and food. It is popular not just among the Chinese but the non-Chinese population in Tangra as well," said Chinese Indian Association president Bean Ching Law.

What makes the celebration special each year is the arrival of Chinese Indians who have migrated to distant lands but return to the roots to spend the New Year with family. This year, too, Tangra's population has swelled to 3,000 from the usual 2,000 with many flying down from Canada, Hong Kong and Australia. Among them is a 56-year-old who was a child when he migrated to New York with his parents 37 years ago and has returned to Kolkata for the first time since.

Title: Meet 19-year-old collegian defying the image of woman in hijab
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

Meet Momin Haleema Sadiya, 19, a middle-class Muslim collegian who defies the image of woman in hijab. (Photo ... Read More

At first glance, nothing seems out of place in the air-conditioned, state-of-the-art gym in Mumbai’s Jogeshwari (West). But a closer look reveals that among the fitness freaks sweating it out on treadmills or pumping iron is a girl in black hijab and loose tracksuits. Standing on a leg, her other leg stretched out ramrod-like, she balances her body for a few minutes. In fitness parlance, this is called pistol squat — one of the several breathtaking bone-straightening exercises she practises regularly.

Meet Momin Haleema Sadiya , 19, a middle-class Muslim collegian who defies the image of woman in hijab.

With a gold medal in martial arts and silver in powerlifting state-level competitions under her belt, this “power-packed” calisthenics ( bodyweight exercises ) performer, fitness trainer and martial arts athlete has over 3,500 followers on Instagram. She says it only “explains my instinct to remain fit and denotes my mental strength”. She will be one of the performers at the World Hijab Day event on February 1 in Mumbai.

Sadiya, who will let her limbs speak through her performance at the event that is being held by city-based NGO Al Hadi Organisation, will demonstrate that “hijab empowers and not subjugates women”.

Fighting entrenched societal prejudices is second nature to Sadiya. Not long ago, when a maulvi disapproved of her devotion to fitness and tried to discourage her, saying “girls should be docile and nazuk (delicate)”, she told him she was only into physical exercise and not showing off her physique. “I am not into body-building shows where you have to be in bikini and flaunt toned biceps and abs (abdominal muscles). I am into exercises which strengthen body, improves immunity and concentration,” she explains.

She grew up watching elder sister Saima doing martial arts. “She couldn’t continue as my parents didn’t encourage her. She quit and she got married. But I got hooked to it and pestered my parents to let me follow my passion,” says Sadiya.

Sadiya credits martial arts trainer Mohammed Sardar “for whatever I am today”. “He really encouraged me a lot and showed that I only had to shed my inhibitions,” she adds.

Besides Sadiya, calligraphy artist Salva Rasool, karate referee Shaheen Akhtar, educationist Asma Zaidi and politician Fatima Muzaffar, dancer-turned-blogger Halima Shaikh, all in hijab, will be part of a panel to share their success stories despite wearing hijab on February 1. “Our purpose is to tell the world that hijab is not a hindrance to career path. Many female talents get wasted as they wear hijab and are hesitant to take initiatives as they think perhaps their progress will be blocked because of how they dress. We want to break that notion,” said Shabana Sadik Hussein Pattawala of Al-Hadi Organisation.

Sadiya’s parents — father is in real estate business while mother is a retired school teacher — are now convinced and are backing her to the hilt. A certificate course in calisthenics from Australia is in the pipeline for this hijabi, who moves with her head held high.

Title: Assam JMB module trained at Burdwan madrassa: NIA
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

KOLKATA: The National Investigation Agency has claimed that a module of Jamaat-ul-Mujahideen Bangladesh in Assam , which was in operation till July 2019, had been trained at Burdwan's Simulia Madrassa, which became synonymous with the October 2014 blast in Khagragarh.

Citing the major arms seizure, NIA has also claimed that the group - banned in Bangladesh and India - was eyeing attacks across eastern India, including Bengal. The revelations were made in a chargesheet filed in a Guwahati special court on Friday against five JMB members who were charged under Arms Act and UAPA.

The NIA's investigation revealed that all five were recruited to JMB by Barpeta resident Sahanur Alom, who was arrested in 2014 for his involvement in the blast that killed two people.

Title: Four kids die as roof of Delhi coaching centre collapses
Content:
Thirty children were studying at the tuition centre in northeast Delhi’s Bhajanpura when its roof collapsed

Nearly 100 firemen, 20 fire tenders rush for rescue

NEW DELHI: Five people, including four children and their tutor, were killed and eight others injured when the roof of a coaching centre in north-east Delhi collapsed on Saturday evening. Police say construction work on the terrace caused the third floor ceiling to collapse even as a tuition class with around 30 kids was in progress on the floor below.Deeshu (10), Krishna (9), Furkan (9), Kirti (10) and Umesh (35), tuition centre owner, died after being buried under the rubble.Residents of Bhajanpura 's Subhash Mohalla area who heard the crash around 4.20 pm managed to rescue at least three children. "One of the beams appeared to have broken. I could see three hands sticking out of the debris and pulled the children out," said Ravi Sharma, who lives in the building opposite the tuition centre. The fire department rescued others in a four-hour operation. A female teacher and some of the injured children are being treated at the GTB and Panchsheel hospital.Locals say the house belonged to Umesh's father.
