Umesh and his brother, Shankar, had turned into a coaching centre named 'Education Point'. The first floor of the building, too, was used for holding classes, but was under renovation.U mesh had shifted classes to one of the rooms on the second floor, while a third floor was being illegally constructed on the terrace, said a police source. Police have detained Shanker, who is co-owner of the building and the tuition centre. “We have registered a case for causing death due to negligence and have called in a crime and forensic team to examine the spot,” said Ved Prakash Surya, DCP, north east.Following the incident, chief minister Arvind Kejriwal also reached the scene to take stock of the situation.. Talking to reporters, he said: “I am pained by the tragic passing away of four students, and the owner of the coaching institute in Bhajanpura. We have ordered an inquiry. Delhi government will provide compensation to the victims.”Asim Mohammad Khan, who had gone to meet a relative in lane number 6 nearby, said, “The screams of the children could be heard from under the debris under the rubble and I immediately started digging through the rubble as fast as I could. However, soon the firemen and rescue teams arrived and took over”.The fire team had pressed in 20 tenders and nearly 100 men for the rescue operation. “The biggest challenge for us was to carefully dig through the rubble, since there was a fear of injuring others who were trapped. However, we managed to rescue them,” said Atul Garg, director, Delhi Fire Services.

Title: India Republic Day 2020: Parade, Flag hoisting time, celebration and all you need to know
Content: India is a land of colourful festivals celebrated by different caste, creed and religion. But national festivals are something, which binds the entire nation together, imparting a message of 'unity in diversity'.Republic day is one of the prominent national festival celebrated every year on January 26 with utmost enthusiasm and the zeal. This year India will celebrate its 71st Republic Day and preparations for the same are on full swing across the country.It was on Republic Day the Indian Constitution came into force and the country was declared as the largest democracy in the world. After India gained Independence from the British rule on August 15, 1947, it was felt that there was a need for a written constitution to run the country systematically. After this, a committee was formed, which was headed by Dr Bhim Rao Ambedkar to draft the constitution. The first draft of the constitution was submitted on November 4, 1947, but it took exactly 2 years, 11 months and 18 days to finally adopt the Constitution with the necessary amendments. It was on November 26, 1949, the Constituent Assembly of India formally adopted the Constitution of India. However, it came into force on January 26, 1950. Since then India celebrates Republic Day on January 26 asThe constitution declares India a sovereign, socialist, secular, democratic republic, assuring justice, equality, liberty and promoting fraternity to all its citizens.Every year on this day people hoist tricolour flags and organise cultural festivals across the country to celebrate the day. But the celebration in the national capital, at the Rajpath, has always been the centre of attraction.The president of India hoists the flag at Rajpath every year, which is followed by a colourful parade showcasing the diversity of the country and military power.India’s military power is presided over by President Ram Nath Kovind, who is the Supreme Commander of the Indian Armed Forces.Assorted tableaus representing the diverse tradition of different states is also a major attraction of the R-day parade in the national capital. The President of India also confers the military persons, citizens and children with bravery awards for showing courage in the face of adversity.It is a custom to have a foreign head of nations as the Chief Guest for the R-Day Parade and this year Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro will grace the event as the guest of honour.The flag hoisting ceremony at Rajpath in the national capital takes place mostly at 8:00 AM on January 26, 2019. President of India Ram Nath Kovind will hoist the tricolour, which will be followed by R-Day parade.For Republic Day celebration, schools, colleges, government and private offices are decked up in tricolour balloons and ribbons. In all the places the flags are unfurled before noon. Special functions are also organised in the educational institutions where thought-provoking speeches are delivered by students and teachers.

Title: #DollyPartonChallenge: Alia Bhatt, Sara Ali Khan, Karan Johar to Kangana Ranaut and other Bollywood stars get creative for the challenge
Content: Time and again our biggest Bollywood stars have proved that they are always up for a challenge. This time around, it is the viral #DollyPartonChallenge that has our Desi stars catching up to the trend that has taken over social media.The viral challenge has celebrities sharing a four-photo mosaic of potential profile photos for social media sites like LinkedIn, Facebook, Instagram and Tinder.What is seemingly known as the ' Dolly Parton Challenge' spiralled up in swift speed, with stars across the globe sharing photos ranging from a professional-looking one for LinkedIn to a raunchy and naughty pose for Tinder."Get you a woman who can do it all," the legendary singer tweeted on Tuesday alongside her meme showing four different pictures of herself that she could use on the four different social media platforms.While some of our Bollywood stars like Sara Ali Khan Athiya Shetty and Sidharth Malhotra joined in the meme fest, director Karan Johar and Alia Bhatt add their twist.Check it out:

Title: Bigg Boss 13: Sidharth Shukla speaks to Shehnaz Gill rudely; tells 'I don’t want to speak to you ever again'
Content: In the latest episode of Bigg Boss 13 Sidharth Shukla had got furious after getting to know that Arti Singh was called his fixed deposit. The topic gets discussed in the Weekend Ka Vaar episode.Vishal clarifies his stance and says that he didn’t mean it in a negative way. Arti tells Salman that she was waiting for him to clear in the episode if it was said in a bad light.After a heated discussion, Salman clarifies that it wasn’t meant negatively and Vishal has language problem.But Sidharth doesn’t take it lightly and goes to speak to Vishal about the same. Shehnaz passes by and tells Sidharth to not call her flipper and drag her into ‘fixed deposit’ comment.Sidharth says that nobody is talking to her and he has told her ‘n’ number of times that he will never ever speak to her. He tells her to think whatever she wants to think about himself, he doesn’t care. Shehnaz is also angry and tells he should stop calling her flipper and she also doesn’t want to talk to him.On the other hand, Vishal is saved from the elimination.

Title: Noida steps in to settle upkeep row at Omaxe
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

No senior Omaxe officials turned up at the Friday meeting

NOIDA: Officials of the Noida Authority held a mediation meeting with builders’ representatives and members of apartment owners’ association (AOA) of Grand Omaxe society in Sector 93 B on Friday. Residents have been complaining that the builder has been reluctant in handing over the ownership and has also not returned the maintenance security amount to the AOA.

As per residents, a total of Rs 12 crore for Interest Free Maintenance Security (IFMS), collected by the builder, has not been transferred to the AOA though representatives of the builders had contested the claim. Other issues included not transferring the documentation such as power and water bills, layout maps for the society, fire NOC, environment clearances and compliance certificates in the name of the AOA.

“The builder has been trying not to hand over the documents so that we are not able to claim full ownership of our property and its services,” said PVS Prakash, AOA president. Residents said several infrastructure work was also left incomplete.

The Authority officials said, a mediation meeting was called last year as well when the builder’s representatives had not turned up. Even for the Friday meeting, Omaxe had sent its junior officials. The builder could not be contacted for a comment.

Additional CEO of the Authority Shruti said, “We’ve instructed the builder to send some senior officials with decision making power for the next meeting scheduled in February. We have also asked them to pay Rs 1 crore for IFMS by next month.”

Title: Noida: Eight-lane flyover to unclog Parthala Chowk
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

The flyover will connect sectors 121 and 123

NOIDA: The Noida Authority has finally selected a consultant to prepare the design and details of a flyover at Parthala Chowk . The flyover will connect sectors 121 and 123 and will be built along Vikas Marg.

Delhi Integrated Multi-Modal Transit System ( DIMTS ) Limited has been selected as the consultant to prepare the decongestion plan for Parthala Chowk, one of the busiest intersections in the city. According to an initial survey by the Authority, Parthala Chowk sees more than 28,000 vehicles during peak hours. Over next few years, the traffic police says it expects the volume of traffic at this intersection to increase by 60-70%.

Details of the proposed design of the flyover are being worked upon by DIMTS, which will clarify all specifications related of orientation, alignment and distance from the upcoming metro line.

“DIMTS will submit a plan at the earliest. It’s likely to be approved during the Authority’s board meeting on January 31. The cost estimates would be submitted too. Proposal is nearly ready and is being reviewed by the CEO,” said an official from the Noida Authority.

According to the proposal, the flyover will be about 780 metres long and have eight lanes. A foot overbridge is also being made in the vicinity that will connect with the upcoming metro station near Sector 122. The alignment of the metro line and the flyover, that’ll be parallel to each other, were also discussed before finalising the proposal.

The Authority had earlier set aside Rs 90 crore for developing a flyover skirting Parthala Chowk near Sector 121. After conducting a survey, officials had made a presentation before the Authority CEO about six months ago. They had finalised a flyover that would have connected Gaur Chowk in Noida Extension to Balaknath crossing near Sector 71. But, the project was put on hold after the Authority sought more clarity on the design and budget requirements.

Title: Karnataka to amend law to help industries acquire land easily
Content:
BS Yediyurappa

BENGALURU: The Karnataka government will soon simplify and expedite the procedure for industries to purchase agricultural land to attract more investors. Potential investors told chief minister BS Yediyurappa during the World Economic Forum at Davos about hurdles in land acquisition. “Their complaint seemed to be genuine,’’ he said here on Saturday while sharing details of meetings with global industry players.The CM said the government will introduce amendments to Section 109 of the Karnataka Land Reforms Act, 1961 to facilitate industries purchase land within 30 days as opposed to 60 days now. This will apply for both acquisition and conversion. “If the authorities don’t give permission within 30 days, it will be deemed to have been approved in both cases,’’ he added.Yediyurappa clarified that the amendment will be applicable to only those projects cleared by the State High Level Clearance Committee or single window agency. The amendment bill will be placed before the legislature in the session starting on February 17.The government has also decided to introduce a 30-day time frame for land use change (for non-agriculture purpose).However, industry sources said the amendments have been proposed not just because of complaints from investors but also due to the large number of pending projects. Of 142 proposals worth Rs 40,000 crore approved between 2013 and 2019 under Section 109, nearly 100 are non-starters or have been shelved. The state is struggling to find enough resources for development in the budget to be presented on March 5.Yediyurappa said the government is mulling over a comprehensive industrial policy in the budget session. “It’s difficult to quantify investments that will flow to Karnataka. But, you’ll see thousands of crores coming into Karnataka in the coming months and it will peak after the Global Investors’ Meet in Nov,” he said.

Title: Ghaziabad: Man deletes wife’s mails, she loses job
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

Representative image

GHAZIABAD: A woman’s important work e-mails started disappearing on a regular basis and one day, she got a termination letter from her office in Ghaziabad for ignoring them.

Unable to figure out the reason, she wanted to start afresh and opened an account in job portals. But, she alleged, her mails regarding job offers and interviews started disappearing as well. “The woman then suspected her husband and confronted him. She then went to her in-laws to report the matter, after which they beat her up,” police said on Saturday, adding that the man and his parents were booked on Friday.

The woman, who now works with an MNC in Delhi, is from Kavi Nagar. She told police her husband had mental health issues and was of a suspicious nature. The 32-year-old woman said, “When I was working with a company in Noida, my husband hacked into my Gmail and Hotmail accounts and deleted emails.” She said when she filed for a divorce in 2019, her husband created a fake WhatsApp account on her name and sent lewd messages to her acquaintances.

An FIR has been lodged against the three under IPC sections and also under IT Act.

Title: Noida to get 2nd golf course in Sector 151
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

Photo used for representational purpose. (Image credit: https:/www.noidagolfcourse.com)

NOIDA: The Noida Authority has finalised a consultant for designing the city’s second golf course in Sector 151A. The agency will submit its report next week so that the estimate and other details can be approved in the authority’s board meeting on January 31. After the 18-hole golf course in Sector 38, this will be the city’s second, for which RTN Associates has been selected as the consultant.

Over the next few days, the group will prepare drawings, designs and estimates for the new 18-hole golf course. The Noida Authority plans to have a club, restaurant, gym as well as guest rooms on the premises of the new golf course. A 90-acre area has been set aside for the golf course.

“The required surveys have been done and soil testing is also complete. The consultant is preparing its final report and estimates now. We plan to make a complete facility with several new features,” said S P Singh, senior manager at the Noida Authority.

Once the design and estimates are ready, the report will be presented at the board meeting for approval. But before that, the report would be reviewed by the CEO.

According to officials, more than 1,500 applications for membership of the golf course are pending with the Authority as the existing one in Sector 38 has reached its full capacity and more members cannot be enrolled there.

The golf course in Sector 38 is about 30 years old. In its board meeting in September, the Noida Authority had approved the new golf course in Sector 151A.

Title: Infographic: 71st Republic Day: Major Constitutional changes in Independent India
Content: January 26 honours the date on which India’s Constitution came into effect nearly 70 years ago. However, the document prescribing the rights, duties and powers of India’s citizens, has, over the years, undergone several changes . A look at the major ones and how they have changed the course of the country.

Title: Tamil Nadu: Man sexually assaults, brands step-daughter
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

Representative image

Title: Awards for pilots of ‘friendly fire’ copter
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

NEW DELHI: India’s third-highest gallantry medal in peacetime, Shaurya Chakra , has been awarded to six Army and three police personnel for conspicuous bravery in counterterror operations , while the two pilots of the Mi-17 V5 helicopter shot down by “friendly fire” after the Balakot air strikes have been given the Vayu Sena Medal for gallantry.

In this year’s Republic Day list of 409 gallantry and other decorations, four Shaurya Chakras have been awarded posthumously to Naib Subedar Sombir Singh from the Army and Challapilla Narasimha Rao, Kamal Kishore and Aman Kumar under the ministry of home affairs.

Squadron Leaders Ninad Anil Mandavgane and Siddharth Vashisht, who were awarded the Vayu Sena Medal posthumously, were flying the ill-fated Mi-17 helicopter for an operational task when it was shot down at Budgam by a SpyDer quick-reaction antiaircraft missile fired by the air defence unit of the Srinagar airbase on February 27.

The four other IAF personnel killed in the accidental “blue on blue” incident, which took place during the time when Indian and Pakistani fighter jets were engaged in the aerial skirmish in the Nowshera sector along the Line of Control, have been awarded “mention-in-despatches”. They are Sergeants Vikrant Sahrawat and Vishal Kumar Pandey and Corporals Pankaj Kumar and Deepak Pandey.

Wing Commander Abhinandan Varthaman, of course, was awarded the Vir Chakra on Independence Day last year for shooting down a Pakistani F-16 before his MiG-21 was downed on February 27.

Among the Shaurya Chakras, Naib Subedar Sombir Singh (Jat Regiment/Rashtriya Rifles) laid down his life while leading an assault team during a fierce encounter in J&K’s Kulgam district, which led to elimination of three terrorists in February last year.

Lt-Col Jyoti Lama ( 11 Gorkha Rifles ) and Major Konjengbam Bijendra Singh (Army Air Defence), killed two terrorists each in separate encounters in Manipur while they were posted in the Assam Rifles last year.

Title: Honour for CBI official in PC case
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

NEW DELHI:Twenty eight CBI officials were awarded the President’s police medal for distinguished service and police medal for meritorious service on the occasion of Republic Day .

The list includes Deputy SP Ramaswamy Parthasarathy, who was part of the team that probed the corruption case against former finance minister P Chidambaram and his son Karti. People recalled Parthasarathy as one of the cops who had climbed the walls of Chidambaram’s bungalow in Jor Bagh last year to arrest him in the INX Media case . He has been awarded the President’s police medal for distinguished service.

Officials, however, explained that the medal is not conferred in probe in one case but the selection takes into account the overall service record and requires a tenure of 25 years to be eligible.

Joint Director D S Shukla, who headed a team that deported, Roshan Ansari, the first Indian national from UAE besides probing murder cases of Mumbai journalist J Dey and Bihar journalist Rajdev Ranjan, has been given the President’s police medal for distinguished service, officials said. Shuklaled team achieved conviction in murder case of J Dey in two years.

SP Binay Kumar of special crime unit, who is known to be a specialist in cracking homicide cases, has been awarded police medal for meritorious service. He had led the probe into infamous Khairlanji murders of 2006 in which four members of Scheduled Caste community were brutally killed over a land dispute by upper caste members in Maharashtra, officials said.

SP Nirbhay Kumar, who had probed infamous Nithari murders, PF scam in Ghaziabad, IRCTC case involving former railway minister Lalu Prasad, midday meal scam and murder of Delhi Police ACP Rajbir Singh, has been awarded the police medal for meritorious service.

Title: Himachal Pradesh: 2.5-year-old drowns in open septic tank of health centre
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

Victim Pari Kumari

DHARAMSHALA: An uncovered septic tank of a government health center has claimed the life of a two-and-a-half-year-old girl in Gagret area of Una district in Himachal Pradesh . The victim, Pari Kumari , had come with her parents Bhupinder Kumar and Kamlesh, as they wanted to meet some relative getting treatment at the centre. While no action has been taken against any government officials, police have named a private plumber, hired for minor repairs at the centre, in the FIR.

Incident had taken place on Friday. The family from a little village in Gagret area had come to the health center. The child went missing in the early afternoon. After after hours of physical search revealed no signs of her, CCTV footage led the family to her body in the uncovered septic tank of the building.

On Saturday, local residents expressed surprise at the fact that police had book plumber Shadi Lal instead of the administrators of the centre for leaving the septic tank uncovered, which led to the tragedy.

Lal told TOI, “I work privately, they (officials of the health center) had just contacted me to clean a few blocked lines in the building. I am not even a contractor. In routine, if they call me for repair work and I go there. It not my duty to purchase the tank covers and nor can I do that on my own.” He, however, did not say he could have devised a makeshift cover to prevent this kind of incident.

When contacted, Una superintendent of police Diwakar Sharma said police would question all the persons involved be they contractors or hospital administration. “Nothing can be ruled out till the final report of investigation comes. We are trying to find out whose negligence resulted into the death of child,” he added.

Health minister Vipin Parmar, told TOI over phone, no one had been suspended in this case but a departmental inquiry would be ordered to fix the responsibility.

Title: Punjab: Live-in partners held with Rs 2.5 crore heroin
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

Amritpreet Singh of Patiala and Lakshmi of Doraha in custody

LUDHIANA: The Special Task Force (STF) arrested live-in partners with 560g heroin that had been hidden in a specially-made cavity in the seat covers of their car. The heroin is worth Rs 2.5 crore in the international market.

The accused — Amritpreet Singh , 31, of Patiala and Lakshmi, 37, of NRI Colony of Doraha — stayed in a rented accommodation in Doraha, police said.

Inspector Harbans Singh, in-charge, STF Ludhiana, said the accused were arrested from near the canal bridge in Sahnewal following a tip-off. They were crossing the area, when STF personnel stopped them for checking at a checkpost.

Besides the contraband, police seized an electronic weighing machine and 60 empty packets from the car. The couple confessed that they had procured the heroin from a Nigerian national based in New Delhi, besides two other smugglers from Jammu and Tarn Taran.

Police said Amritpreet, who was earlier into farmer, and his live-in partner had been addicted to drugs for the past several years. Both got into drug peddling to buy drugs for themselves. Earlier, the woman was arrested by STF on December 24, 2018 with 200g heroin. However, she again started peddling drugs after she came out on bail.

Amritpreet is also facing trial in a NDPS case in Patiala. The accused have their clients in Ludhiana and its nearby villages.

Title: Ludhiana: Raped by cousin, 14-year-old turns pregnant
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

Representative image

Title: Power theft: Border areas take big bite out of PSPCL’s revenue pie
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

Representative image

PATIALA: Despite efforts to cut down transmission losses, the cash-strapped Punjab State Power Corporation Limited (PSPCL) is still losing Rs 1,200 crore every year to power theft in the state’s politically sensitive border zone.

Of all four zones into which Punjab has been divided for administrative purposes by PSPCL, transmission line losses are more than 30% in at least seven divisions, against the state’s average losses of 14.7%. Of these divisions, five fall in circles under the border zone.

Maximum losses have been reported from 12 divisions in Amritsar, Tarn Taran and Sangrur, where figures exceed 25%. In Tarn Taran circle, which falls in the border zone, Bhikhiwind and Patti divisions have losses of 47.14% and 40.28%, respectively. Amritsar cricle’s three divisions — West, Ajnala, and Sub-urban — have losses of 33.18%, 31.62% and 31.21%, respectively.

In the west zone, Malout division of Muktsar circle has losses of 33.28%. In the south zone, Patran division of Sangrur circle has losses of 30.24%. Divisions where losses are between 25 % and 30% are City Tarn Taran, Lehragaga, Bhagta Bhai Ka, Zira and Baghapurana divisions.

A source in PSPCL said the main reason for losses in these areas is political interference in efforts by the corporation to check power theft. The source said political patronage was provided irrespective of which party ruled the state.

Border and west zones have been notoriou for power theft, which costs PSPCL Rs 1,200 crore annually. These politicians call it a “facility” to their area consumers like “free power to agriculture”. “Politicians fear they might lose elections if power theft ‘facility’ is withdrawn from their ‘affectionate consumers’,” said an officer.

Contractual staff for meter readings is another big hole in the revenue of PSPCL. They incite and help consumers to slow down metering equipment or fill fake readings, putting PSPCL to a big loss, the officer added.

In Punjab, the deficit between actual cost of supply and actual revenue recovered is 48 paise per unit, which is highest amongst the 10 states where losses are less than 18%. Himachal Pradesh has the least gap of 3 paise per unit, while Gujarat and Goa have a gap of 6 paise per unit. The highest gap of Rs. 2.13 is in Arunachal Pradesh , followed by J&K with a gap of Rs. 1.85 per unit.

With the PSPCL moving the PSERC seeking another 14% hike in the cost of power for the next fiscal, bringing down losses can go a long way in keeping the rising power cost in check.

Title: Hotelier’s murder: Police to quiz aides to track down gangster
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

Ludhiana: Hoping to track down notorious criminal Sukhwinder Singh Moni, who is the prime accused in the murder of hotelier Harjinder Singh Jindi at Jawahar Nagar, the police on Saturday brought three members of Moni’s gang on a production warrant from Ludhiana central jail.

The police had arrested the trio — Deepak Billa, Deepak Deepu of Shimlapuri and Ajay Kumar of Ferozepur — on November 13, 2019, for SBI ATM robbery in Sudhar area.

The police are now trying to find out Moni’s possible hideouts.

In their investigation, cops have also discovered that Jindi had talked to Moni after he had come out on bail in PNB robbery case in October 2019. Jindi had tried to convince Moni that he had passed on the information about him to police.

The police have prepared a sketch of Moni’s accomplice, who was there was with him at the time of firing.

Police commissioner Rakesh Agarwal said the police are scanning CCTV cameras installed in nearby localities to check where the car, used by the accused, headed after the crime. Now, the police will interrogate Billa, Deepu and Ajay to know whether Moni is hiding in the state or not.

Agarwal said, “The investigations so far have suggested rivalry between Moni and Jindi since 2016, when Moni’s gang had executed the PNB robbery in Kochar Market. When Moni was arrested in the case, he believed that Jindi had given information about the former to cops.”

“Thereafter, Moni came out on bail in early 2019 and then executed Rs 25-lakh robbery from a cash van in Roorkee in April 2019. The Roorkee police arrested him but he came out on bail in October 2019. Following that, Jindi and Moni had talked to each other to resolve their differences,” Agarwal said.

“The family has claimed that Jindi had a heated argument with someone over the phone a few days ago and that person might be Moni,” he added.

On November 2, 2019, the Moni’s gang had uprooted an ATM, containing Rs 23 lakh from Sudhar area. Following the incident, the police was after Moni and his accomplices. In the meanwhile, Moni allegedly shot at a man in Ambala on December 6. He was hired as a contract killer.

Fake number plate

Police commissioner Rakesh Agarwal said the accused had used a mobile application to get a Delhi registration number for his car. Even if the police had managed to track down the details of car used in the crime, the investigation will roam around the person who actually owned the number, he added.

Title: Woman arrested for attacking mother-in-law
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

Ludhiana: Sarabha Nagar police on Saturday arrested a 34-year-old woman for allegedly trying to kill her mother-in-law. Police said the woman — identified as Renu Bala of Agar Nagar Enclave — allegedly attacked Shashi Sharma, 59, with a washing paddle. When neighours rushed to her house after hearing Shashi’s screams, Renu claimed that some unidentified man had attacked her mother-in-law.

While the incident occurred on January 22. The police recorded the statement of Shashi on Friday following which a case was registered. Renu works a nail artist at Agar Nagar Enclave, Sarabha Nagar.

ASI Rajinder Singh, investigating officer from Sarabha Nagar police station, said Renu and Nitin had got married 10 years ago. But Renu and Shahsi had strained relations since the marriage. The cop said a few days ago, Renu and Shashi had some argument over some domestic chores following which Shashi complained against Renu to Nitin. Thereafter, Nitin scolded Renu, following which she wanted to take revenge from Shashi.

“As Renu is a nail artist, she keeps gloves at home. She wore the gloves and attacked Shahsi with a washing peddle on her head six times. When neighbours rushed to their house after hearing the screams, Renu said that some unidentified accused had attacked her. Subsequently, neighbours rushed the injured woman to the hospital. Police said the woman was earlier unfit to give statement. On Friday, the FIR was lodged,” a police official said. The court on Saturday sent her to judicial custody.

Title: After 12 years, panel formed on Buddha Nullah bridge opening
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

Ludhiana: After lying unused for almost 12 years, there is hope that the bridge on Buddha Nullah near Pavitar Nagar may be open to traffic as a committee of councillors has been formed and members have been given one month to submit the report. This bridge has no direct access to the road because a private property falls at one of its end and a committee has been formed to find a solution to this problem and the piece of land could be acquired.

In the MC general house meeting on September 23, 2019, a proposal was made by area councillor Rashi Aggarwal that owner of the land should be given money for giving passage to connect this bridge with the road so that commuters could utilize it. The existing bridge, which is functional, is old and congested and most of the time people face traffic jams. Answering this resolution approved by the MC house, the local bodies department has asked mayor Balkar Sandhu to form a committee of councillors for taking a decision in this regard.

In this committee councillors Jai Parkash, Harbhajan Dang, Gagandeep, Kuldeep Singh, Om Parkash Ratra, Gurdeep Neetu, Rashi Aggarwal, Maninder Kaur Ghumman and Maharaj Singh are members while superintendent Surinder Pal Singh is member secretary. The committee members will visit the site and conduct meetings over the issue.

A resident of Haibowal Manish Kapoor said, “If this bridge is thrown open to traffic then we will not get stuck on other bridges over Buddha Nullah and in a few seconds we can reach Hambran Road. At present, encroachments have covered the bridge because it has no direct passage.”

Another resident of Chuharpur Road Anju Dhir said the authorities had spent money in constructing this bridge and they should have thought about making it functional as well. Now, they should not waste more time because the existing bridge also needs repair.

This bridge was constructed in 2007 and since then the population of the area has gone double and there is a lot of burden on other bridges constructed over the drain like the main bridge of Haibowal, Gopal Nagar and old bridge of Pavitar Nagar. During peak hours people face traffic jams almost daily. If this bridge gets approach and become functional, then some load of traffic will be reduced on other bridges. Even in 2010, the officials had tried to get approach from owner of the land, but it did not work at that time.

Title: Major mishap averted in fire at sweets shop
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

Ludhiana: A major tragedy was averted with timely action by fire-fighters when they took out an LPG cylinder that had caught fire inside a sweet shop on Gill Road on Friday night during a fire incident.

The fire had broke out at Dyal Sweets on Gill Road and owner of the shop was informed by some people of the area about it. The owner informed the firemen at the Gill Road fire station. Though the fire brigade took one hour in controlling the fire but they managed to check the spread of fire to some adjoining shops. The fire had broken out in the front side of the shop and things kept there were completely gutted in the fire but the firemen did not let the fire spread to the backside of the shop.

The sub fire officer at the Gill Road fire station, Maninder Singh, shared that the owner approached the fire brigade around 11.05pm as the shop was nearby and they reached the spot in a few seconds. He said an LPG cylinder had caught fire inside and first of all they removed that cylinder from there because at least six to seven more LPG cylinders were inside the shop. He said if that cylinder had blasted then it would have become difficult to control the fire outbreak. He said as commercial LPG cylinders were kept inside the shop fire arrangements should have been taken care of but there was no such arrangement inside the shop.

Meanwhile, people had also gathered around spot where the fire was blazing. The fire brigade controlled fire in an hour and returned but smoke could be seen billowing from the area for a long time.

Title: Prime accused in police recruitment scam surrenders
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

Dharamshala: The prime accused in Himachal Police recruitment scam surrendered before on Saturday. The accused, Ketan Choudhary, walked in to the police headquarters and surrendered before the Kangra superintendent of police.

Choudhary is a resident of Jawali area of Kangra district. Earlier this month, the kingpin of recruitment scam, Vikram, had also surrendered before the police in same manner after avoiding arrest for almost five months.

On August 11, 2019, Himachal Police had conducted recruitment exam at Paraur area of Kangra to fill up 1,063 posts in the department. During the exam, CID and police arrested four youths impersonating as aspirant.

So far, police have arrested persons from Rajasthan, Haryana and Himahcal Pradesh. Investigation officials suspect involvement of the same gang in recruitment in other government departments as well.

Title: Ludhiana News - Times of India
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

Woman gets injured in road mishap

A woman, Sonam Rani of Jamalpur here, got injured when a speeding struck hit her on the 33-foot road on Saturday morning. The victim is a teacher in a private school. She was on way to her school on a scooter when the truck hit her scooter. When she fell down, a tyre of the truck ran over her leg. Some onlookers managed to nab the accused and handed him over to the police.

500g opium seized

Division number 2 police have arrested Avtar Singh of Sahnewal with 500g opium. The accused was arrested form a checkpost near Cheema Chowk, following a tip-off. A case has been registered against him.

Title: Driving record may hold key to visa to US, Canada
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

Ludhiana: Getting long-term visa for United States and Canada, which are among the most sought-after foreign destinations for Indians, might actually depend on clean driving record of applicants.

These countries have sought records of applicants on traffic violations committed in their native land. Ludhiana police have already got five such request letters from embassies of the US and Canada, seeking to know whether applicants from Ludhiana commissionerate have been involved in such violations or not before granting them visa.

Ludhiana police commissioner Rakesh Aggarwal said in the past four months, they have got five such request letters from embassies of countries like the US and Canada over applications by Ludhiana-based residents, seeking permanent residency in the respective countries. He said since they have digital database now, they check the records and share the details of the applicants with the embassies.

Meanwhile, immigration experts said this is uncommon for any city, if such requests had been made to local police by embassies.

“Normally at the time of filing of application for visa for most countries, an applicant has to tick about whether he has a criminal record and if they (countries) later find out that one does have such record, they deport those persons. However, traffic violations cannot be taken as a ground for rejecting visa by countries, unless it leads to criminal offences like causing deaths on road etc. I haven’t heard about such instances wherein embassies have sought traffic violations report from police,” said immigration expert Ayush Jain. However, he said criminal record can be ground to deny visa to applicants.

Road safety experts linked the request letter about traffic violations with the highest fatality rate in Ludhiana.

“The embassies have sent such request letters to Ludhiana as the city is number one in the country with 68.6% fatality rate in road accidents. So, there is general concern that Ludhiana residents might not be following traffic rules and may create havoc on their roads when they come to their countries. It is good that they have asked the local police to verify driving record, including traffic violations. This move will make a lot of people follow traffic rules,” said international road safety expert Kamaljit Soi, who is member of National Road Safety Council, an apex body for road safety in India.

“The aspiring youths who want to go abroad will desist from breaking the laws. We want all the countries to inquire from police about traffic violations committed by applicants,” he added.

No request from smaller nations

A senior police officer said traffic violations alone cannot stop the embassies from issuing visa. He said they have not got any such requests from smaller countries.

In the list

Police officials said earlier police had manual data of traffic violations, so NOC was many times issued without checking the record as it was laborious process. The parameter of checking traffic violations before issuing such visa has been added recently by the embassies of these countries, they added.

Parameters

Cops said the financial statement of the applicant and no criminal record are few other parameters before the embassies issue visa.

Title: RTI activist brings attention to missing tin sheets around City Centre structure
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

Ludhiana: A city-based RTI activist has diverted the attention of Ludhiana Improvement Trust (LIT) chairman Raman Balasubramanium towards the missing tin sheets put up around the construction area of the City Centre building in Shaheed Bhagat Singh Nagar for safety of people here through a complaint on Saturday.

The activist, Arvind Sharma, who is a resident of SBS Nagar, has complained that not only these sheets are missing but the site had also started to get converted into a garbage dump. He claimed that sometimes even the streetlights do not function and this could lead to some accident at night time.

He complained that when somebody enters SBS Nagar from the T-point, it becomes risky for commuters in darkness as the tin sheets were missing and some vehicles might just crash into the structure of the City Centre and lead to some tragedy. He also complained that while entering from G-block side heaps of garbage could be seen around the site. He rued the fact that these garbage heaps might lead to some major health problem for residents of the area as they were being made to bear the foul smell. He said already due to the City Centre structure area residents had been facing many issues and even now the authorities concerned had not been able to resolve the issue.

The LIT chairman said, “I have received the complaint and even LIT is keen to take over the land but still some legal issues are pending. We have approached the senior leadership in this matter and hopefully positive results will come out.” He said he would look into the matter and see if some immediate step could be taken for public safety.

LIT has already pursued the case with local bodies minister to bring City Centre land in use as the local court case had ended and they could settle the case filed by a private firm in Delhi HC through interim resolution professional (IRP) appointed by the National Company Law Tribunal, Delhi, for fulfilling the process of insolvency.

Title: City’s young entrepreneur raises hot issues in Davos
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

Ludhiana: Karanvir Singh, a voice of the youth for the nation, incisively raises concerns on public-private partnerships and its future in India during the annual meeting at Davos in Switzerland. A young global entrepreneur, Karanvir is representing the nation along with a myriad of business leaders, union ministers, chief ministers, and change makers at Davos 2020. He is the founding chairman of Visionum Group, which acts as a bridge between the government and the people, and is known for playing a significant role in promoting a clean environment, education, safe communities, women empowerment, start-up ecosystem, AI, blockchain, public transportation, and encouraging youth entrepreneurship across India. During the four-days visit to Davos, Singh has raised concerns and valued points on climate action, youth empowerment, women empowerment and youth entrepreneurship.

Union commerce minister Piyush Goyal led the Indian delegation to the 50th World Economic Forum at Davos which has entered its last day. Actor Deepika Padukone and spiritual guru Jaggi Vasudev Sadhguru have also attended the forum this year. Numerous delegates and leaders all around the world have marked their presence and highlighted the umpteen number of remedies to issues plaguing in the world. This year, four states from India —Punjab, Madhya Pradesh, Karnataka, and Telangana — had their representations at Davos, with their contemporary problems and solutions. Karanvir Singh has also highlighted that Visionum Group is making Indian MSME sector digitalised with the motive of enticing customers globally through the platform of connecting nations.

Title: Cong govt under fire from own MLAs again, Sandoa and Dhiman this time
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

Patiala: The Congress government in Punjab — which had just got past the crisis created by its four legislators from the home district of chief minister Amarinder Singh over the issues of corruption, phone tapping and a non-responsive bureaucracy — has again come under fire from its own MLAs.

This time, the issues are drugs and delayed development, and the revolting MLAs are Surjit Singh Dhiman from Amargarh and Amarjit Singh Sandoa, the MLA from Ropar who had defected from Aam Adami Party to the Congress ahead of the Lok Sabha elections in 2019.

Dhiman has accused government officials of being lax in dealing with the issue of drugs. The Congress legislator said people voted Congress to power as it promised to eradicate drugs from the state within four weeks. He said the fight against drugs was given a thrust initially, but the campaign had lost steam and things were back to square one.

In reply to a specific query, Dhiman said, “It is not what I want, but party workers are demoralised. I am worried this would reflect in the results of the 2022 assembly elections. For 10 years during the SAD-BJP rule, party workers faced the Akali wrath, hoping that when the Congress will return to power, things would change. But this has not happened.”

He said he had repeatedly raised the issue of drugs with the state DGP and even the chief minister, but now he was feeling that the administration was not serious in dealing with the issue. Sandoa, on the other hand, said even after joining the Congress, he was unable to arrange enough funds for the development of his constituency. “Yesterday, I raised the issue during a local event in which assembly speaker Rana KP, cabinet minister Charanjit Singh Channi and Anandpursahib MP Manish Tiwari were present. While Rana KP and Channi get enough funds for their constituencies, I had to make an appeal to the MP to allocate funds for Ropar,” he said.

Asked if he felt ignored by the state government, he said he was answerable to the people of his constituency and he was morally bound to seek overall development of his constituency. “While I want more funds for my constituency, I am also hopeful the CM will soon ensure more funds are allocated to Ropar,” he said.

Title: Punjab farmers drum up decibels to beat locusts
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

Bathinda: After a few dead locusts were spotted in some Punjab areas bordering Rajasthan, the panicked farmers and horticulturists in Fazilka district are banking on ear-shattering sound power to rock the locust threat. While some are buying crackers, others have already deployed farmhands to beat utensils in the fields and to drum up the dhols to scare away some locusts that have entered Punjab. No swarm of locusts has been seen so far in Punjab but reports from adjoining Rajasthan are giving them sleepless nights.

The farmers are accusing the agriculture department of failing to foresee the danger and suggesting carrying out of aerial spraying as a pre-emptive move to handle locusts that enter Punjab.

The swarms of locusts spotted in Lalgarh and Rai Singh Nagar in Rajasthan in the last two days and sharing of video clips regarding these have further made farmers in Punjab edgy.

There were reports of locusts at the farm of Bharat Krishak Samaj chairman Ajay Vir Jakhar, who is also chairman of Punjab farmers commission, as well as that of Punjab Congress president Sunil Jakhar in the adjoining villages of Maujgarh and Panjkosi, located near the Rajasthan border.

The locusts were also spotted in Dekhu, Bandi, Pathrala, Raike Kalan, Pakka Kalan and Phullomithi villages in Bathinda, which are more than 50km from Rajasthan, signalling that locusts are coming to Punjab, though in small numbers. This was confirmed by Bathinda chief agriculture officer Guradiita Singh. The agriculture teams were sent to these villages on Saturday to check the ground situation, but they claimed that there was no loss to crops. Farmers in half-a-dozen Muktsar villages also claimed to have seen locusts.

Kinnow grower Ajay Wadhwa said, “Locusts have been seen at our farm in Diwankhera village. I have purchased crackers and our workers are into beating utensils on the farm to scare them.”

Ajay Vir Jakhar said, “A very large locust swarm spread over 1km was spotted on Friday night in Rai Singh Nagar in Rajasthan, which is not far from Punjab. In my farm in Maujgarh, locusts have been seen in small numbers on Kinnow trees. The locusts are a clear and present danger.”

An old-timer in Panjawa village, Karnail Singh recalled the colossal damage to cotton crop caused by the tiddi dal (locusts) in neighbouring Rajasthan in 1993 as well as in Punjab.

Agriculture department officials are in touch with Central Integrated Pest Management Centre (CIPMC) and entomology department of Punjab Agriculture University to devise a strategy to face any possible incursion.

Fazilka chief agriculture officer Manjit Singh said he had visited a score of villages, including Maujgarh, Panjkosi, Diwankhera, Panjawa and Kikar, adjacent to Rajasthan border, but they had nowhere come across any small or big group of locusts. “However, despite this, we are vigilant,” he added.

Punjab agriculture department director Sutantar Kumar Airy said that “department is on its toes and is in touch with agriculture officials of Rajasthan.”

Title: Tata co. serves notice on LSCL, MC
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

Ludhiana: As the Ludhiana Smart City Limited (LSCL) has imposed a penalty on Tata Projects Limited for not completing the replacement of ordinary lights with LED ones, the latter has served a notice to LSCL and MC. The company has held the MC responsible for delay in the project by saying that they did not get required permissions and work orders in time. The decision regarding giving extension to the company till March end is still pending and for that mayor Balkar Sandhu has formed a committee and a meeting will take place soon.

In the house meeting on December 31, 2019, the issue was raised by councillors that the company was going very slow and there was no maintenance of streetlights. The initial deadline of the company was May 7, 2019, which was not met. The company was given three months extension but then too work was not completed.

One of the MC officials claimed that company in its notice has shifted the responsibility on MC and moreover the existing infrastructure of the city was very bad. Against a demand of Rs 64 crores for replacement of streetlights, approval was given for only Rs 13 crore.

Title: Five Himachal cops get President’s Police Medal
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

Shimla: Five police officials from Himachal Pradesh have been conferred President’s Police Medal.

IGP intelligence (CID) Diljeet Thakur will be honoured with President’s Police Medal for Distinguished Service on Republic Day, while four other police officers will be conferred with President’s Police Medal for Meritorious Service.

Those conferred with President’s Police Medal for Meritorious Service include: SP law and order at Shimla police headquarters Khushal Chand Sharma, Kinnaur SP Saju Ram Rana, inspector at Police Training College in Daroh Sushil Kumar and sub-inspector from Chamba Krishan Kumar.

Title: Two years on, four policemen behind gangster Vicky Gounder’s encounter get gallantry awards
Content:
Gurmeet Singh Chauhan

CHANDIGARH: Four Punjab Police officers, including an additional inspector general (AIG), have been conferred with the police medal for gallantry (PMG) for neturalising Punjab's most wanted gangster Harjinder Singh, alias Vicky Gounder , on the Republic Day of 2018.The team led by AIG Gurmeet Singh Chauhan of Punjab Police’s organised crime control unit (OCCU), comprising DSP Bikramjit Singh Brar (then an inspector), sub-inspector Balvinder Singh, and assistant sub-inspector Kirpal Singh, had shot down Gounder, 29, near the Rajasthan border. After the encounter, unknown associates of the gangster had issued a threat on social media to kill Brar as revenge. Punjab Police had been chasing Gounder since the 2016 Nabha jailbreak.Thanking Punjab chief minister and DGP, Punjab, for recommending their name, Chauhan said they were happy that their work had been recognised. “This award will motivate the entire team for giving their best in the line of duty,” said Chauhan, who lauded the efforts of the entire team involved in the operation.Bikramjit Singh Brar was also awarded with police medal for gallantry in 2011. In addition to this, Shashi Prabha Dwivedi, additional director general of police (ADGP), human resource development, Punjab, and Harwinderpal Singh Virk, deputy superintendent of police (DSP), state special operation cell, Amritsar, have been chosen for President’s police medals for distinguished services.In all, 16 more officials have bagged police medals for meritorious services. Thet include Barnala SP (investigation) Sukhdev Singh Virk, Moga DSP Sukhwinder Singh, inspector Harjinder Singh, ASI Satpal, SI Manoj Kumar Sarin, ASI Gurbaj Singh, SI Surmail Singh, ASI Kulbirchand, ASI Rupinder Singh, ASI Janak Raj, ASI Ashok Kumar, ASI Kuldeep Kaur, inspectors Chamkaur Singh, Harvinder Singh and Amarjeet Singh, and ASI Resham Singh.

Title: Punjab CEO bags Election Commission of India award for accessible elections
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

S Karuma Raju receives the award from the President in Delhi

CHANDIGARH: Punjab chief electoral officer has bagged an Election Commission of India award for providing accessibility to vote to persons with disabilities (divyang), senior citizens and ill persons during Lok Sabha elections 2019.

President Ram Nath Kovind conferred the ‘Best CEO for Accessible Elections’ award on S Karuna Raju on Saturday, during a National Voter’s Day function held at Zoravar Auditorium at Manekshaw Centre, New Delhi.

Raju said the honour belonged to voters and all electoral stakeholders of Punjab, and was the result of support from the Punjab chief secratary and principal secretary (finance), and arrangements made during elections in collaboration with the departments of rural development and panchayats, health and family welfare and social security.

He said all arrangements were put in place as per the instructions of the Election Commission of India. The state engaged persons with disabilities with the help of a mobile app with sign language. Free transport were also aprovided to them and volunteers were also placed at all polling booths spread across 13 parliamentary constituencies.

Raju said the credit of award went to the hard work and efforts of additional CEO Kavita Singh, additional CEO Sibin C, additional CEO Gurpal Singh Chahal , additional CEO Bhupinder Singh, all deputy commissioners and SSPs to translate the vision of EC into reality.

Title: Chandigarh’s Langar Baba, hockey star Rani Rampal get Padam Shri
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

Rani Rampal

CHANDIGARH: Jagdish Lal Ahuja, 84, of Chandigarh and Indian women hockey team captain Rani Rampal of Haryana were conferred with Padma Shri on Saturday.

Ahuja got the prestigious award for social work, while Rani bagged the award for her contribution in the field of sports. Famously known as ‘ Langar Baba ’, Ahuja has been organising langars for over 500 poor patients and their attendants daily for over two decades outside Post Graduate Institute of Medical Education and Research (PGIMER), Chandigarh.

Not only this, he provides patients other support, from financial assistance to blankets and clothes.

A self-made billionaire, who had come to India at the age of 12 empty-handed after Partition, started serving free food in 1980s in diffrent parts of Chandigarh and later moved his base to PGIMER in 2000. He sold his properties worth crores to fund his mission.

While talking to TOI, Ahuja, who is suffering from stomach cancer, said serving langar to people is like going to temple and vowed to continue to serve people in need till his last breath.

Saturday turned out to be a great day for Rampal, whose brace enabled her team to started their first tour of the Olympic year with a confident 4-0 victory over New Zealand Development squad In Auckland.

Rani, who is instrumental in India qualifying for the first time in back-to-back Olympic Games is also been nominated for the 'World Games Athlete of the Year' by International Hockey Federation.

In recent years, it is her composure and experience that has helped push the Indian women ahead - whether it is medals won or a top-10 FIH ranking and successive Olympic qualification.

ABOUT THE AWARDS

Padma Awards, the highest civilian awards of the country after Bharat Ratna, are given in three categories — Padma Vibhushan, Padma Bhushan and Padma Shri. Padma Vibhushan is given for exceptional and distinguished service, Padma Bhushan for distinguished service of high order and Padma Shri is given for distinguished service in any field. These awards are conferred by the President of India at a ceremonial function at Rashtrapati Bhawan.

Times News Network

Shimla: Shimla resident Prof Abhiraj Rajendra Mishra has been conferred with the Padma Shri in the field of literature and education. He is the former head of Sanskrit department of Himachal Pradesh University, Shimla, and the vice-chancellor of Sampurnanand Sanskrit University, Varanasi.

Prof Mishra has enriched modern Sanskrit literature with more than 250 Sanskrit epics, lyrical songs, dramatic works, fictions, ghazal collections and poems, and has earned much name and fame in the country.

His works are being taught in the postgraduate course of more than 13 universities and 48 students have received their PhD degrees through their thesis on the works of Prof Mishra. At present, he is the convener of the Sanskrit Advisory Committee of the Sahitya Akademi, New Delhi.

He was born in Dronipur in Jaunpur district in Uttar Pradesh, to Pandit Durgaprasad Mishra and Abhiraji Devi. Abhiraj Rajendra Mishra is the winner of Sahitya Akademi Award for Sanskrit for the year 1988 and is popularly known as Triveṇī Kavi as he has composed many books in Sanskrit, Hindi, English and Bhojpuri.

Title: Punjab: Drug peddler held with 8kg opium gets 12 years RI
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

Representative image

LUDHIANA: A local court has sentenced a drug peddler to 12 years rigorous imprisonment after he was found in possession of 8kg opium. Special court judge Arun Kumar Aggarwal also imposed a fine of Rs1.2 lakh on the convict, and in default of payment of fine, he will have to further undergo rigorous imprisonment for two years.

On December 30, 2014, Dugri police had booked Paramjit Singh of Sukhana village (now a resident of Dugri) and Kuldeep Singh of Hathoa village in Amargarh of Sangrur under the Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances (NDPS) Act for conscious possession of opium. As per prosecution, on 29 December 2014, ASI Kashmir Singh — along with ASI Raj Kumar and other police officials — were present at the 200-feet Road, Flower Chowk in Dugri, and at about 10pm, due to fog, a Honda Activa being driven by a Sikh gentleman came from the side of Pakhowal Road, who on seeing the checkpost stopped the scooter about 10 steps behind and tried to turn back. But the said person was apprehended by ASI Kashmir Singh on the basis of suspicion, with the help of other police officials. A cloth bag with black handles was lying on the scooter.

Later, police recovered 8kg opium from two transparent polythene bags within the cloth bag. Police then arrested the accused — who later disclosed his name as Kuldeep Singh — and investigated into the matter. On March 5, 2015, he was arrested from Gill Chowk, along with 20g opium. Police later presented a challan against the accused persons in the court. During trial, Paramjit pleaded false implication, while Kuldeep stated he had no relation with the former.

Additional public prosecutor for the state pleaded for punishment to the accused on the basis of prosecution evidence. The defence counsel pleaded that as per the prosecution case, recovery was allegedly effected on December 29, 2014, and in accordance with the guidelines/instructions, the sample parcel is to be deposited with the chemical examiner within a period of 72 hours in order to avoid any false implication. However, the sample parcels of this case were allegedly deposited with the chemical examiner on January 7, 2015. Thus, necessary instructions had not been followed, and the benefit was to be extended to the accused.

The court, however, did not find merit in the submission of the defence counsel, and remarked that the guidelines regarding deposit of sample parcel within 72 hours are only departmental instructions, which do not have any force of law. No such instruction is contained in the NDPS Act 1985.

The defence counsel submitted that although the alleged recovery was shown to have been effected at a public place, the police party or the investigating officer did not join any independent witness to make the prosecution case credible and genuine.

The court held that the submission of the defence counsel was devoid of any merit. Even as it convicted Paramjit, it acquitted Kuldeep, and observed that the prosecution had not been able to prove its case against him.

Title: Karnal: Armed thieves take three hostage, loot cash & jewellery
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

Police at the house where the robbery took place

KARNAL: Three unidentified miscreants on Saturday morning struck at the residence of a private school owner in Budha Khera village of Karnal district and decamped with cash and jewellery worth lakhs after taking the owner’s daughter-in-law, grandson and house help hostage at gunpoint.

At the time of the incident, owner Harvinder Kaur was at the school.

As per the family members, while one of the three bike-borne miscreants remained outside, two barged into the house. They took daughter-in-law Mandeep Kaur, her seven-year-old child Asmat and maid hostage at gunpoint and decamped with 250 to 300g gold jewellery and Rs 3 lakh cash, besides the digital video recorder (DVR) of the CCTV cameras installed in the house. The robbery took place between 7.45am and 8.20am.

Cops were informed as soon as the thieves escaped. On being informed, DSP Rajiv Kumar, CIA and forensic teams reached the spot and started investigation.

The DSP said, “We have formed special teams to investigate the robbery, but cannot disclose any information at this point.” A case has been registered in this regard and the suspects would be nabbed soon, he added.

Title: Sikh visitors fume over statue protesters in Amritsar
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

A Sikh group complaining about Panthic bodies protesting against ‘giddha’ and ‘bhangra’ statues on Heritage St... Read More

AMRITSAR: A video was going viral on Saturday in which a group of Sikhs were seen accusing Panthic bodies which are protesting against ‘giddha’ and ‘bhangra’ statues on Heritage Street of trying to vitiate the peaceful atmosphere of Punjab and asking the police to arrest the protesters .

The group is heard calling the issue raised by the Sikh bodies irrelevant. “These people had earlier caused much damage to Punjab in the name of Khalistan and now they are again trying to push the state into quagmire. Police should immediately arrest these people,” one of the Sikh visitors was heard saying in the video.

Meanwhile, a partial bandh was observed in Amritsar on a call given by Shiromani Akali Dal (Amritsar). The party’s activists, in collaboration with a few Muslims, also held a protest against CAA and NRC at Bhandari Bridge.

Similarly, in Patiala a number of unions staged a protest against the Union government on the same issue. With black stripes tied on their foreheads, the protesters took out a march in the town with national flags in their hands. The protesters raised anti-government.

SAD (Amritsar) functionaries in Patiala also staged protest. They took out a march and then staged a sit-in near Fountain chowk in the city. Former MP Dharamvira Gandhi also joined the protesters for sometime and said that the CAA was promoting hatred among the communities in India. The central government was going against the basic principles of the Indian Constitution, he alleged.

Title: Haryana to expand single-point connection, HERC okays 10,000 smart meters
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

File photo used for representational purpose

CHANDIGARH: After launching the scheme in selective group housing societies of Faridabad and Gurgaon, electricity distribution companies are all set to expand the networking of single-point connections for the colonies, commercial centres and in the rural areas.

This comes along with the electricity distribution companies’ plans to install 10,000 prepaid smart electricity meters in the urban areas to make supply and collection of revenue more effective.

Targeted to assess real time energy consumption, Haryana discoms — UHBVN and DHBVN — plan to install meters covering its consumers in Panipat , Faridabad, Hisar and other districts by March 31.

On Monday, the full quorum of Haryana Electricity Regulatory Commission (HERC) headed by chairman D S Dhesi has given the go ahead for meters during the meeting held for this issue. Issues of single-point connection, prepaid electricity meters too were taken up during the meeting.

The concept of single-point connection was launched in the state in 2014 after it got the go ahead from electricity regulator HERC.

In this system, electricity distribution companies provide one connection following this the sub connections are issued by the builders or society managing the group housing. Since maintaining accounts is responsibility of society, the societies are given concession in electricity tariff in addition of being charged for bulk rates.

In November last year, the regulator had sought comments and reviews from stakeholders before planning the expansion to more area. The stakeholders had submitted their suggestions by November 28.

Sources said inadequate electricity infrastructure, linking of grid supply of the area with common maintained services by the builder or the societies were some of the issues that were highlighted. HERC will hear feedback from general public on February 6 before taking the final decision on the expansion of single-point system.

Once the system is launched in the government colonies, shopping malls and institutions, it will be also be introduced in rural areas where companies enjoy good presence.

Title: Road rage: 2 shot at, 4 booked
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

Ludhiana: Sahnewal police have booked four persons for firing at two men who tried to untie ropes used to block a road in Ram Nagar at Jaspal Bangar village on Friday. The bullet missed the target.

The accused — Sunny of Ram Nagar, Raju, Anu and one unidentified person — were booked under Sections 336 (Act endangering life or personal safety of others), 323 (voluntarily causing hurt), 506 (Criminal intimidation), 34 (act done by several persons in furtherance of common intension) of the IPC and Arms Act.

In his complaint, Amritpal Jindal of Canal View Enclave alleged that his employees Vikram and Rahul Jindal were going to the sub-registrar’s office at Gill village on a motorcycle they found out that someone has tied ropes to block the road near Ram Nagar. When they tried to untie the ropes, the accused turned up at the spot and attacked them. One of the accused even fired at them, but the bullet missed the target.

ASI Balvir Singh, investigating officer, said the accused are already facing trial in criminal cases in Kapurthala.

Title: PAU employees submit nominations for union polls
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

Ludhiana: A team of PAU Employees Forum submitted nominations for elections of PAU Employees Union (recognised), going to be held on February 5. A large number of non-teaching employees, including female staff, gathered near the examination hall in the morning, and marched towards the union office under the leadership of Baldev Singh Walia to submit nominations for all 15 posts of the executive council to the chairman of Election Committee.

The nominations for different posts from the PAU Employees Forum are president Baldev Singh Walia, senior vice-president (open) Lal Bahadur Yadav, senior vice-president (reserved) Gurpreet Singh Dhillon, vice- president (open) Navneet Sharma, vice-president (reserved) Keshav Rai Saini, general secretary Manmohan Singh, treasurer Daljit Singh, secretary I Guriqbal Singh, secretary II Dharminder Singh Sidhu, joint treasurer I Mohan Lal Sharma, joint treasurer II Baljinder Singh, organising secretary (open) Harminder Singh, organising secretary (reserved) Baljinder Singh, propaganda secretary (open) Gurchet Singh, and propaganda secretary (reserved) Raj Singh.

Title: Coronavirus fear: Bizmen cancel trip to China
Content: Ludhiana: With coronavirus spreading its tentacles in certain parts of China, killing 41 people and infecting more than 1,000 others, several Ludhiana-based businessmen have cancelled their trip to the country.In view of cases being reported in Australia, France, the US and seven Asian countries besides China, several countries have already started taking action to prevent a global pandemic.The Ludhiana health department too has been directed to keep tabs on the foreign travellers and be ready to deal with such cases in the future.City businessman Surinder Sharma, who has cancelled his business trip to China, said, “I don’t want to take any sort of risk as it might take some time for the health authorities in China to handle the situation properly.”Dr Rajesh Kumar Bagga, Ludhiana civil surgeon, said, “The Union government has already installed screening systems at international airports to track people with symptoms of novel virus.”“According to the state health department, the strain of coronavirus is not much different from swine flu virus. We have got necessary facilities to deal with such cases. We already have isolation wards,” the civil surgeon added.The health authorities have advised people to avoid close contact with people with symptoms of cough, running nose etc. “The travellers are advised to wear a mask if they have symptoms of respiratory problem,” Dr Bagga said.The health department in its advisory has asked China-bound travellers to follow some public health measures at all times, like maintaining good personal hygiene, washing hands with soap and covering mouth when coughing or sneezing.“Passengers heading to China, in particular to Wuhan city, have been advised to monitor their health closely. If you feel sick on flight, while travelling back to India, inform the airlines crew about illness, seek mask from the airlines crew, avoid close contact with family members or fellow travellers and follow the directions of airline crew while disembarking,” said the civil surgeon.

Title: Mayor says no to vendors demand on running biz at old sites
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

Ludhiana: Roadside vendors met mayor Balkar Sandhu on Saturday with their demand of allowing them to run their business as they were doing earlier and return their rehris, which had been impounded during the anti-encroachment drive. The mayor, however, refused to do so and instead asked them to start their business at the sites identified for establishing vending zones. He added that they would soon establish formal vending zones and till that time they should shift to these places. The mayor also claimed that they would not charge any fee from them until they were given proper vending zones.

The vendors had staged a protest outside zone A office on Friday, where they had met senior deputy mayor Sham Sunder Malhotra, but he had advised them to meet the mayor once and so they had met Sandhu. The vendors were asking the mayor to stop the ongoing drive being done by the police and MC because it was hitting their business. They also requested the mayor to get FIRs cancelled which had been registered against them.

Sandhu said though vending zones had not been established but they would not let these vendors lead to traffic jams at least on 12 roads, where a joint drive was going on. He said they could go to those sites where vending zones were to be established for selling things and run their business.

However, president of Rehri Farhi Union Punjab Bal Krishan Pappi said they had told the mayor about a few locations in the meeting and on Sunday he would come with vendors to check out those locations. He said the officials should give them lists of identified locations for vending zones so that they could shift there.

Meanwhile, Youth Akali Dal has demanded that police and MC should avoid strict action against street vendors and cart pullers. YAD district president Gurdeep Singh Gosha said the MC and district administration should allot vending zones in every ward instead of registering cases against poor people.

He added that they welcome the step of removing encroachments from roads but the police should not register case against the poor. Gosha said registering case was not a solution of any problem. He said if police would not stop registering cases against street vendors, then YAD would join the agitation of street vendors and cart pullers.

Title: Farmers’ body opposes Brazil president as chief guest
Content:
This story is from January 26, 2020

Bathinda: All India Kisan Sangharsh Coordination Committee (AIKSCC) has expressed anguish at the decision of the Union government to invite Brazil President Jair Bolsonaro as the chief guest at the 71st Republic Day parade. AIKSCC said Bolsonaro was anti-farmer and government should not have invited him. A score of other organisations fighting on feminist issues too have opposed invitation to Bolsonaro.

In a press release on Saturday, AIKSCC said, “India is reeling under a very deep and sustained agrarian crisis. Sugarcane dues of more than Rs 20,000 crores are pending towards the governments across the country. While input costs of fertilisers, diesel and electricity are rising, the government has failed to ensure minimum support price at 1.5 times the cost of cultivation.”

“Even so, the government is under pressure to even further reduce prices and subsidies as a complaint has been filed by Bolsonaro-led Brazil government in the WTO against support measures given by India to its sugarcane farmers and export subsidies for sugar to companies. This they say should be reduced to less than 10% of the total value of production,” said AIKSCC working group member Darshan Pal.

The complaint also decried expanded export quota of sugar by India which it said would depress international sugar prices, he said, adding that Brazil was the biggest exporter of sugar and was one of India’s main competitor in world markets.
